description:
1. Horrible service. But does that make it more authentic European? As others have said, there doesn't seem to be an organized reservation or seating system. I'm pretty sure the hostess forgot about us and seated several parties before us on accident... probably because she was doing 3 jobs at once though. Luckily, we weren't in a rush. Once we sat down, everything else was slow as well. Slow to order, slow to get the check. Just slow. I guess it's a reminder to slow down or whatever, but I think it's because they only had like... 3 people on the floor (hosting, waiting tables, bussing), and the restaurant was packed.

2. These complaints aside, the food was BOMB. OH MY GOD. Heavenly. We didn't expect it at all. We were just on a little hike / walk up Bernal and looking for a warm place to eat. I had never heard of Vega, but all the seats were filled (surprising for a Tuesday night), so we naturally gravitated toward the restaurant that everyone else seemed to like despite there being other places to eat on that street. We ordered the gnocchi pasta and a pizza (don't remember which one), but I was so blown away. It reminds me of my favourite Italian restaurant in Russian Hill (Ristorante Milano) - just cozy and homey, and feels like Italy. Next time, I'm definitely ordering wine to go along with it.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Definitely a cozy, romantic restaurant in the heart of Bernal. Top recommendation from a co-worker who used to live nearby and is in love with all of the pasta here. We had a nice family dinner here, and while my gnocchi was stupendous, my partner's pappardelle was extremely undercooked. 

RESERVATIONS: Made online (group of 5, Saturday at 5:30pm) just a few days in advance. 

SERVICE: Genuine, friendly, and patient. Half our group was about 40 minutes late for our reservation, and that was no issue for them!

THE COST: $190.75 before tips for dinner for five. Not bad!

THE FOOD:

INSALATE
* Insalata Della Casa ($10) - 3.5 stars
Tried a bite, this was fine, nothing super exciting but works if you need a salad.

PRIMI PIATTI
* Rigatoni ($17 + $3 sausage) - 4 stars
I tried a bite, this was good! Definitely a big, hearty dish if you're super hungry as well. Meat was great (italian style - nicely ground meat), and plenty of baked cheese on top.

* Gnocchi Della Casa ($17) - 5 stars
Soft & heavenly. I couldn't decide between the sauces & was able to get half Tomato Basil, half Gorgonzola & Fontina. Both were fantastic! (Though looking now at the receipt, I realize I was charged $2 for that. Not a big deal, but I wish they would've mentioned something!)

* Papardelle Al Ragu Di Cinghiale ($19) - 2.5 stars
Extremely undercooked. No, not al dente - my partner and I know how to appreciate al dente. This was objectively too hard and not cooked long enough. Maybe it was an off day, but he couldn't finish this!

SECONDI PIATTI
* Costolette Di Agnello (lamb chops $24) - 4.5 stars
Very nicely cooked lamb, tender and soft, juicy, and plenty of wonderful flavor.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I am so glad one of our friend introduced us to this place because they wanted to enjoy the  1/2 priced bottled wine on Wednesdays (yes, that's right, instead of wing Wednesday, it's wine Wednesday and who could say no to wine). This is one of my favorite Italian places in SF and it's not because of the wine Wednesday, although it is a great incentive. I have been here so many times after our friend introduced it to us, I definitely lost count of how many times I have been here but the last time I was here was about a couple of days ago for dinner.

My best friend came to visit and her favorite cuisine is Italian, so I had to take her to one of my favorite place in town. We decided to order a pizza for the table and our own pasta dishes on top of that. Though it is carbs on carbs, we have no regret. I really like their pizza here because I'm a fan of thin pizza so that it comes out lighter and crispier and this place is one of my favorite to get pizza because they do just that. For the table, we went with Pizza Ai Funghi which is essentially mushroom pizza with truffle oil (because anything with truffle is always amazing). The pizza came out very thin and crispy just as I like it and the mushroom portion was generous. If you wanted parmesan cheese on top of any of your dishes, they will bring out a block and a very long grater and grate your cheese in front of you (drools). The pizza was gone within 5 minutes.

For the pasta dishes, our table got Boscaiola, Capellini Al Granchio and Linguine Al Nero Di Seppia E Calamari. The Boscaiola is handmade gnocchi with mushroom, Italian sausage, parmigiana and white truffle oil. Not only was the flavor amazing but their gnocchi was really good and fresh. It was not my dish but I definitely was eating a lot of it (sorry to my friend that I stole the gnocchi from). The Capellini Al Granchio is my all-time favorite and my highly recommended dish here. It is angel hair pasta with fresh Dungeness crabmeat, tomatoes, garlic, and extra virgin olive oil. The portion is big and there is enough Dungeness crabmeat that I had a piece at every bite. I really like how light this dish sits in my stomach but it is packed with flavor. On top of that, angel hair is a pasta that can overcook or undercook easily due to how thin it is but it is always cooked perfectly here. My second highly recommended dish here is the Linguine Al Nero Di Seppia E Calamari, which essentially is squid ink linguine with calamari, garlic and parsley. The pasta is cooked perfectly and flavor is amazing. If you haven't had squid ink anything, I highly recommend it (unless of course if you're allergic to it).

Though we didn't order it during this dinner, I would recommend the Polpette E Polenta as well because the meatballs are amazing. Overall, I definitely highly recommend this place. The pizzas are great and the pasta is amazing as well. The place is small so try to either make reservations or go early and if you're into wine, go for wine Wednesday!

TLDR: One of the best Italian place with amazing food and  1/2 priced bottle wine on Wednesday.

Atmosphere: 4 out of 5 (intimate but it can get a bit loud)
Food: 5 out of 5
Service: 5 out of 5
Presentation: 4 out of 5
author: Chenny O.

description: Talk about authentic! I took a friend here for his birthday and we were both amazed by the quality of the food & the fast service. The squid ink pasta was a hit! I would come back for that dish alone. The carbonara was delicious but I could do more than one serving of the squid ink pasta. The noodles were al dente and perfectly cooked, the sauce was rich but light, the seafood in the pasta was tender and delightful. We had the flourless cake and tiramisu to finish. I'd skip the flourless cake was too dense for our liking but that doesn't take away from how wonderful our experience was at this restaurant. I'd definitely recommend it. Sit outside with a glass of wine and enjoy your meal!
author: Marlene T.

description: The past 5 visits have re-affirmed my conviction that this is the best dang casual Italian spot in SF. All of their seasonal special pastas - lobster spaghetti in the spring, squid ink linguini in the fall - have been so perfectly made. The mushroom pizza has been a favorite appetizer to share with the table. The owner is friendly and remembers regulars, and clearly takes pride in the craft of their kitchen. Overall, I can't recommend them more highly.
author: Ken H.

description: They don't honor the reservations customer make. Once you check in you still have to wait a long time.
author: kityee a.

description: This Place is amazing. As you walk in and the aroma coming from the kitchen catch your Imagination. Your appetite grows exponentially.This place has a nice vibe. My mouth started to water when I Saw the food on everyone's plate. The service was attentive and efficient. My pasta dish and salad were incredible. And the wine was delicious
author: Tim J.

description: Great little neighborhood place.  Cozy and inviting.  Food was delicious; attentive staff; great wine list.  Even the house wine is very good.
author: Dolores M.

description: Oh Vega, I wish I could return to you every night. Your like my long lost Italian family.
author: Seth P.

description: Favorite Italian restaurant in SF. A little off the beaten path from typical Italian areas like North Beach but worth the visit. Intimate atmosphere, unbelievable gnocchi and baked ravioli, great date night spot.
author: Brady A.

description:
Okay this spot is so unassuming, I would have never thought to come here but I'm so glad we stumbled upon this place.

The space is pretty small so you're going to be packed in but I can see this spot being great for a romantic dinner for two. 

I'd been craving a simple red sauce pasta for awhile and the Dungeness crab angel hair hit the spot. My dinner companions opted for the baked rigatoni and the fettuccine with the wild boar ragu -- also red sauce and also delicious.

The portions are huge and prices are reasonable. This place is going on my list of frequent go to spots!
author: Eunah T.

description:
Had the Impelatada di vongole e cozze ( fancy word for calamari in a delish sauce) and shared a Pizza Capricciosa.

Vega is now my new favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco even tough its sort of hidden in a nice quiet off-center neighborhood.
The vibe gives a wonderful private intimate feel. It can be perfect for a solo meal or for a romantic dinner. 
Nice polite fast staff, AMAZING food. For a second I thought I was in Rome. 
Cant wait to come back.
author: Zita M.

description: Had a lovely experience at Vega. Located in cute Bernal Heights, the atmosphere is trendy but romantic. They don't offer a gigantic menu like most Italian restaurants, so everything they do is very tasty. The wine list is extensive and reasonably priced. I recommend ordering a few things and sharing. The owners stayed late to chat with us after we finished our meal, and we learned that they own a wine bar down the street. I'll have to check out that place too.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
Wow. That place is good!

It's a bit hidden in a rather quiet neighbor street. There are big windows that allow you to take a look inside and get a feel for that super relaxed, romantic atmosphere that you'll experience. The place is really small, tables are very close to each other, and it's fairly dark inside. This makes it perfect for a basic and simple date night. The service is on point and super friendly. They have a good wine list with mostly bold Italian wines. As I know nothing about Italian wines, I just picked any but the waitress was nice enough to tell me that this was the only wine on the list that she wouldn't get herself ever.

Besides that, the food is amazing. They have a good mix of meat, seafood and vegetarian options. As everyone else is saying, these GNOCCHI are amazing. You can taste the potato but it's not overpowering, they are cooked al dente but not too hard - and that sauce they come in is so on point. Besides that, the Pizza is amazing too - very traditional Italian pizza.

I walked out of this place feeling so happy and relaxed, and not too full of heavy food to go to the bar next door.
author: Jonas G.

description: What is the point of reservations if you don't honor them?  Our group of three arrived at the restaurant and then were squeezed into a tiny table barely big enough for two.  When we asked the waiter about this, he just shrugged and said "it's Friday".  A few minutes later, we see a 4 top opening up and we ask the waier if we can be moved to that table so we fit.  He says he'll check with the manager.  Time goes by.  Another waitress comes by and we now ask her if we can be moved to that table. She says she'll let us know.  We sit for a while.  We look around and notice that 3 of the occupied 4 tops only have 2 people, so there should be no reason they couldn't let us move to the open 4 top.   More time goes by.  They seat some people at the 4 top we had asked about.  More time goes by and they seat several other parties, completely ignoring us.  By this point it is 25 minutes past our reservation and we had been sitting there hungry, just waiting the whole time.  Finally we give up and leave.  Unbelievable how horrible the customer service is!! I get it that things get busy, and I would totally be OK with it if they were at least trying their best, but it seems like you could accommodate a reservation within 25 minutes, especially if you are seating party after party after party.  Especially infuriating since they were not even apologetic about it and completely ignored us.
author: vlad k.

description: My husband and I are always looking for good restaurants in SF that have outdoor seating with strong heating that can keep us warm on chilly nights. Vega meets these requirements! We can bring our dog with us here to enjoy tasty Italian food and a bottle of wine while we stay warm under the heaters. Service has been great every time we've been, although there is often a wait for a table. Would recommend checking it out!
author: S C.

description:
I'll be back.

Wonderful service. Delicious food. Everything started right on track with the bread. Soft and not unedibly hard, great for dipping in that olive oil.
Next we got the pizza funghi as an appetizer. If you can pay about the same amount for a pizza as an appetizer, why not? Seriously, one of the better italian pizzas that I've had. Tons of mushrooms and definitely some truffly goodness. Only ate half so we could move on to the pasta!
Gnocchi alla boscaniola - this is where it is at! Fluffly pillows of goodness, creamy savory sauce, delicious mushrooms and italian sausage. When i come back, it'll be hard to not choose this dish.
Seafood Risotto - well executed. Plentiful clams and mussels. Risotto cooked perfectly. very well done dish, but not blow me out of water like the gnocchi.

Give this place a shot. It's in a nice, quaint neighborhood of Bernal Heights. Try the gnocchi, you'll be glad you did.
author: Edward L.

description: Cozy neighborhood Italian spot with awesome Italian wine selection. The food that is both comforting and really satisfying. This is the type of place you bring your family, a close group of friends, or that someone special in your life. It's not trendy or a "scene", which makes it more accessible and even more awesome.
author: Darin E.

description:
My wonderful boyfriend brought me to Vega to surprise me with a dinner reservation. I love being wined and dined, so obviously I was already in a super chipper mood. The experience at Vega was great and helped make the night perfect; the waitress was friendly and knowledgeable and the food was delicious all around. Even my boyfriend who doesn't usually care for Italian food said that he is now much more open to Italian cuisine (since he enjoyed the food a lot!)

The space is very intimate and small... Because of the small space, reservations are limited and seemed to be booked back-to-back as much as possible. We had to wait a little bit even though we had a reservation... But I really liked that they offered us the wine menu to glance over/order from while we were waiting. I had my glass of fancy smancy wine before we were even seated! 

Once we were seated, they gave us our menus and then brought out a cute little plate of heart shaped bread + olive oil(?), which was basically bottomless as it usually is at Italian restaurants. I had been craving/eating carbs all week so of course I helped myself to a shameless amount of bread while we waited for our food. We ordered an appetizer (polpette e polenta) which was beef meatballs and roasted polenta to share, and an entree each -- he thought that I might like the dungeness crab pasta dish made with real dungeness crab meat, so he suggested that I get the capellini al granchio (delicious, by the way..) while he himself got the gnocchi alla boscaiola (also delicious!!!) 

Our waitress checked up on us a couple of times and someone came by to fill our water cups, so service was very attentive, we were in and out of the place in about an hour with only a little bit of leftovers. On the way out, we saw several tables who went with the pizza options and many of them looked mouth-watering.. Definitely have to drag my boyfriend back here for a round two! 

( sorry I'm lacking in food pictures, my temporary phone has a terrible low-light camera ): )
author: Evelynn C.

description:
Atmosphere (night time):
*Calm
*Relaxing 
*A little cramped but not to cramped 
*Dark by candle light 
*Perfect for a date night

Service:
*Set a time for 8:30 on yelp and are table was ready on time.
*Are waitress was very nice and helpful with the menu 
*She even picked a pasta out for me that went good with my lamb.
*Beverages were at the table immediately!

Food:
*Bread was hot and fresh and delicious. 
*A little to much on the olive oil in everything we ate but that's just me.
*rigatoni was very cheesy and sweet just how I like my red sauce!!
*Lamb was great and cooked medium rare like I ordered. 
*the appetizer I ordered was slices of beets with ricotta cheese and olive oil. I didn't like it to much because it was very plain. But it was very fresh!! (maybe I'm just an unhealthy eater). 
*salad was very good with cranberry, caramelized walnuts, pink grapefruit, greens, etc.. it was great..
*tiramisu was a little dry

Restroom:
*clean
*with everything needed lol
*but the guy who serves the bread was cutting bread by the restroom so u could Imagine what I mean when I said a little cramped.( it was outside the restroom so no cross contamination) 

Bill: $100 not including tip (not to bad)
I'll be back to try the pizza!!
author: Jay V.

description:
Sunday night-party of 2- reservation for 6pm
Parking- one pass around the block and scored a spot on the residential block
Check in- reservation or not if the table is open they seat you. When we arrived there were two tables for two left and we got the window counter. 
- waves of heat from the kitchen alternating with the cool breeze.  
Service was very attentive even as they filled up quickly and crowds began to gather out front waiting for a table. Water, menus and specials shared with us. We ordered and got his recommendation as to whether we could have the meatballs with polenta to start, a pizza and two pastas....... and still have room for dessert. He thought so but said we'd probably take a little home. 

*Meatballs and polenta *****~ will get again! Polenta was delicious with crispy edges! 
*Burrata, mushroom and truffle oil pizza~*** very subdued but ok and needed something( we drizzled a bit of the sauce from the gnocchi and wow factor carried over) 
*Gnocchi with mushrooms, Italian sausage, and truffle oil*****~ dreamy. One of the best gnocchi dishes I've ever had
*Pappardelle with boat sugo****~ pasta is so light and fresh, sugo tasty and lean, but the gnocchi is a hard act to follow
*Dessert~ never made it that far.. next time for sure!
author: Elaine S.

description:
I came by here again after moving from Bernal heights and it was delicious as always. It does get pretty packed since it's a small place, but it's your cute, neighborhood Italian place with solid pasta, wine, and Italian desserts. 

I would highly recommend trying the lasagna or the Ragu- it was my absolute favorite. The ambience is lovely and cozy with their low lights and tea candles.
author: Sophie P.

description:
I had the chance to visit here last night with my friend and had a great time. Luckily I made reservations on yelp b/c by the time 7pm rolled, there were people waiting outside. Our reservations was around 6:30pm and were seated right away and was given our menus. 

For drinks, we had the prosecco which had a lovely crisp taste and was super flavorful. For our food, we started off with some salad and we had the insalata della casa which AMAZING! It had mixed greens, grapefruits, and walnuts with citrus vinaigrette. Super delicious and lots of flavors. The walnut had some sugar coating on it and it went very well with the salad. (FYI the walnuts can get stuck to your teeth lol) For our main, we ordered the pizza capricciosa (it has prosciutto, artichoke, mushroom and farm egg!!) and gnocchi alla boscaiola. The pizza capricciosa was good and tasted amazing but I've had a similar pizza before with a farm egg on top so this pizza wasn't anything special but it was still good. We ended our dinner with gnocchi alla boscaiola and it was also one of my favorites. It had mushrooms, italian sausages, white truffle oil and parmigiano. It had lots of flavor and overall tasted amazing. 

My overall experience here was great and I'd definitely would love to come back again and try other things on the menu!
author: Monica W.

description: Just had such a great date dinner with the wife here. Cozy and intimate place. We liked the food especially the pastas and the wine list is interesting and fairly priced. We will come back for sure.
author: Paul G.

description:
The gnocchi pasta with pest is the best I have ever had!! Hands down. And every variety of their pizza is delectable - the vegetarian ones as well as the ones with meat all done to perfection. Don't miss this excellent gem!!

You won't regret a meal at this fabulous spot. Cozy, intimate and great service.
author: Karen Q.

description:
Great!

We really liked both the pasta (RIGATONI AL FORNO) and the pizza (PIZZA AI FUNGHI CON OLIO DI TARTUFO)! Both were fresh and tasty.

The restaurant is very warm and inviting -- people coming in know the people working there, and they are all very friendly. The service is great.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Love this place! Especially the crab and endive salad and pretty much any/all of the desserts I've tried there.
author: Shayna Y.

description: Cozy space. Has heated patio seating on the sidewalk. The chef is amazing. One of the best places IMO in this neighborhood. Also got to meet a bunch of people who have been visiting the place for a long time and they seem to be enjoying it too
author: Abhiram M.

description: Husband drives for Muni and would pass by this place everyday and always thought it to be a Vegan Restaurant.  One day after a trip to Puglia Italy, we were looking for somewhere to eat and feeling Italian that was close to home. We immediately consulted our friend YELP who's always the next best step and found this hidden gem!  When we got to the front my husband says he didn't want vegetarian and I said it was Italian!  We walked in and were seated immediately. Our server turned out to be the owner who by there was from Puglia with her husband and she was absolutely divine! The food was amazing and has become our go to place!! Today is my 20 year work anniversary and we can think of nowhere else to go but here to celebrate. It's a hidden gem and you must go!!
author: Robertta M.

description: This is my husband and my go to dinner spot. The food is always consistently delicious.  We have loved everything we've tried but generally stick with our usual rigatoni with meatballs for him and mussels/clams for me. The staff is also really lovely.
author: Natalie T.

description: Omg! Second time here.. make reservation if you can. They are good at getting you in at the time promised.. so delish..
author: Grace G.

description:
A hidden gem in a quaint neighborhood,we were visiting from out of town,looking for a good Italian restaurant 
We were not to familiar with this part of town,but boy did we find a really good place to eat
Food is very good and the staff was both helpful and very friendly.Definitely will eat here again next time we are in town
THANK YOU fir a memorable experience !!!
author: Carlos S.

description: Whenever I write a review, I like to start by emphasizing that I am not the type of person who bothers on taking the time to review places at all. So when I do is because I consider that place totally worth it. Vega is definitely one of them! My hubby and I decided to do last minute dinner in SF last night. So after considering our options we agreed on italian. We were already in the Mission district, and didn't feel like driving for too long so we decided to head to Emmy's. I am SO GLAD we couldn't find any parking because basically that is the reason why we kept driving toward Bernal Heights. Oh boy! What a lovely surprise. Super cute, little place. It was busy!! I thought we were not gonna be able to get a table but, we got lucky and were seated on a corner by the window which we loved!! Everything from start to finish was delicious! The service super friendly and attentive. First we got their super delicious bread made in house along with some tasty, tasty olive oil. Then we got their Caesar salad... THE BEST Caesar salad I've ever had. The dressing is not your typical creamy dressing, oh no... it's this delicious emulsion of oil, and lemon, and anchovies topped with the yummiest shaved parm. My God! You can taste every element on every-single-bite. Sooo good... Hubby had their wild boar papardelle and I had the spaghetti alla puttanesca. Both of them so well prepared and flavored. Of course, we also got dessert. I am a pastry chef, so I am hard to impress when it comes to desserts. Thumbs up for their tiramisu! Perfection. Right amount of espresso, right amount of sweetness. Their mascarpone is like a cloud that melts in your mouth. The best part of all, unlike SO many overpriced and over rated places in the city, Vega offers high quality food and service for your money. It's our new favorite little hidden gem.
author: Mar C.

description:
One of or favorite spot in the city for Italian food.
We have me come this place few time for dinner past few months. We have tried their papardelle and their linguini with calamari. The service is great and the food is delicious and well seasoned. They don't overcook the pasta or the vegetables.
author: Farshid G.

description: Go here on a Wednesday, it's 1/2 off wine bottle night. Also, the al Forno is super good!! everything is homemade. Make sure that you make a reservation bc it fills up quick.
author: Jorge P. G.

description: I had a reservation for 6:00PM I was running late and they were kind enough to hold our reservations. This place is cozy, and gets really popular around 6:45. The pizza we ordered could easily serve two people. I had the Meatballs and Polenta which was pretty good but the Tiramisu with expresso was absolutely delicious. This place does get loud, due to it being a small place and that it caters to families. Consequently, it's a bit harder to have a conversation with the person across the table. I would say not the best spots for date nights.
author: Jan Kirby Z.

description:
17.07.01.       1st of many visit
                      Visited it 4 times already

Food ------------------ 3.5 to 4
Service --------------- 3.5

Can get loud in the small space
Good solid Italian fare
Homemade pastas ... you hear it all the time ... 
     Never did asked if they made it in-house or
           brought homemade pasta ... hmmm

GNOCCHI ALLA BOSCAIOLA
    Homemade gnocchi w/ mushrooms, Italian sausage, 
                  parmigiano & a touch of white truffle oil
    Another FAV for me here

SPAGHETTI ALLA PUTTANESCA
    Handmade spaghetti w/ tomatoes, 
          capers, anchovies, black olives, chilli flakes & garlic
    Very strong flavor dish that my friend had ... she loved the strong

CAPELLINI AL GRANCHIO
     Handmade capellini with

     Friend's fav ... a light dish ... well for him

FETTUCCINE AL RAGU DI CINGHIALE
    Handmade fettuccine

         I am a dark meat eater ... so I expected the result so I didn't
           deduct and points for that   

Good solid Italian fare in the Bernal Heights hill
author: S.K. Y.

description: Cozy setting. Quality, original food. Nice staff. Their reservation management can be improved though.
author: Koosha N.

description:
If you were looking for authentic Italian food in Bernal Heights, look no further! We were on vacation here in San Francisco and stayed just down the street from Vega, and I took my sister here for dinner because she was craving pasta. We walked in and got a table for two. The restaurant is lit by candle light, so this is a real romantic setting if you were going to come here for a dinner date.

All the dishes names on the menu were in Italian, so the owners wife had no problem going over the menu with us! She was very nice and gave us a little run down of the family business and how the recipes came straight from her husbands mother from Italy. All the portion sizes were huge, so sharing is definitely an option. Everything on the menu is delicious and authentic.
author: Michael D.

description:
Excellent neighborhood spot!  Seemed very authentic to a person of non italian origin; they knew many customers on a first name basis! 
-We really enjoyed the gnocci boscaiola, along with everyone else on yelp, bae got the daily special with speck which was delicious and he deemed upscale beakfast pasta. -They also have a nice selection of italian wine by the glass, I enjoyed a generous glass of nebbiolo at a reasonable price.
-The only drawback was that we were seated at the window booth seats and we had made a reservation and there were 2 person seats available. Definitely affected the vibe.
author: Angelique A.

description: Dare I say the best Italian food I've ever had! The staff was amazing, the atmosphere was small but quaint.  The gnocchi is a must have
author: Timothy R.

description:
Vega gets the stamp of approval from this pasta-fiend born and raised outside NYC. 

Swung by on a Saturday night in a group of 7 with no reservation and we were still seated in roughly 25 minutes. The menu was devoid of dishes like lasagna, chicken parmesan and other Americanized Italian dishes. Instead, we were greeted with a choice of homemade linguines, gnocchi and orecchiette to name a few. 

I personally had the Linguine Ai Frutti di Mare (which seems to be seasonal or a special since I don't see it on their regular menu). Either way, it was absolutely fantastic! The pasta was clearly handmade and had just the right amount of bite. The seafood included was decently generous and the sauce was just the right balance of garlicky, slight heat and sweetness from the wine. (4.5/5)

I also managed to snag a bite of the Gnochhi Alla Boscaiola and my taste buds nearly exploded. The gnocchi was clearly made in-house as they were fluffy, billowy and buttery puffs of potato-goodness. The sausage and truffle oil provided an amazing richness and depth that's hard to describe without just tasting it. The portion doesn't look large but it's a rich dish and I could see it being very filling. (4.5/5)

If I'm ever in the area, I'll be back to try every other item on this menu. Thank you Vega for satisfying my ever-constant craving for good Italian food!
author: Jason W.

description: I live in the neighborhood and eat at Vega or get takeout at least once a week. The food is always delicious and the staff is incredibly wonderful. Love this place.
author: Ellie H.

description:
Delicious Italian food in Bernal Heights.  Food is always great and the staff is very friendly. I love the vibe of this neighborhood spot very cozy little restaurant on popular Cortland Avenue. Everything was fresh and very homemade tasting - the servers were friendly and were knowledgeable on each dish.

Minestrone ~ flavorful vegetable soup
Impepata di Vongole e Cozze ~ the mussles & clams in garlic, white wine & chili flakes sauce was delicious I kept dipping my bread in the broth it was that good
Burrata Pizza ~the mushrooms on the pizza was too strong barely tasted the burrata will get another one next time
Fettuccine with Wild Boar Ragu ~ simple yet hearty dish could use a bit more herbs and spices
Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola ~ mushrooms, italian sausage, parmigiano & white truffle oil made this one tasty pasta dish
The Torta al Cioccolato ~ a little too dry the vanilla ice cream helped me eat this rich dessert. Overall I enjoyed my dining experience at Vega. Suggest to order family style and share appetizers, pizza and pasta dishes so you can sample and enjoy more delightful dishes. 4 stars for this gem.
author: Maria M.

description:
Made reservations on Yelp. We arrived a few min before 6:30 and were seated promptly at the table by the window. 

Service was very efficient and professional. My girlfriend and I had a lot of catching up to do so it was the right amount of service without ever feeling rushed or interrupted.

I had the fish of the day (halibut) on a bed of cauliflower and potatoes.  It was good although the fish was slightly over done.  My friend had the baked rigatoni which was a good vegetarian option for her.  We shared a salad and then indulged in some desserts.  

Parking was easy.
author: Kathleen W.

description: Vega is a family friendly great food little spot on Cortland. Their gnocchi and pizza are authentic and the spot is quite cozy. We enjoy going their with friends, with family, and with our baby daughter. We do recommend a reservation though as they can get packed. The seating out front is always nice to enjoy the breeze. A go to staple in the city.
author: Jeny L.

description: Such wonderful authentic Italian food with adorable decor and a great wine list! The service is great and the gnocchi's are the best in the city.
author: A R.

description:
My husband and I were on our way to an event that started at 6:45pm, and I needed some quick food. Cortland Street was a wasteland on Columbus Day; everything was closed, even the corner markets. Vega was the only place open that wasn't a bar. We walked in, said we were in a hurry, and asked how long it would take to order a small pizza to go. The waitress said "15 minutes." I said great, placed my order, paid for it. (The time stamp on my receipt said 6:18.)

After 20 minutes, my pizza was nowhere in sight, and at almost 6:40, I asked where it was. The waitress languidly replied "it's gonna be 10 more minutes." What? I replied that was NOT acceptable - we had to be somewhere at 6:45, and she had told us it would only take 15 minutes. The waitress didn't seem to care, so I called over the owner, a man with a thick foreign accent, who also didn't care that we were in a hurry and had been lied to about the wait time. In fact, he seemed annoyed that we were even asking. 

When the pizza finally came up at 6:47, it sat in the service window for 3 entire minutes before anyone bothered to box it up and hand it to us! Needless to say, we were very late to our event.

...But the real reason I am leaving a negative review (instead of just enjoying my pizza and letting it go) is because when the owner finally handed us our pizza at 6:50, instead of apologizing for the wait, or for misleading us about how long it would take, he raised his voice and berated my husband for my "impatience"! HOLY SH*T HOW RUDE‼ That, my friends, is how you earn a one-star review from a customer. Never setting foot in this hostile little hellhole again.
author: Christine D.

description:
A very charming neighborhood spot

We felt a little cramped at the tiny table for two against a wall

The margarita pizza was tasty

And the New Years eve special, crab ravioli was good

Service is a bit off as we sat quite awhile before anyone  came for our order.  And when they finally arrrived, they asked us to move, even though they told us to sit there, because they had forgot a party of six reserved the spot. And at the new table, once again, we waited ten minutes and finally we could place our order 

It might have been nice to offer an appetizer or a little something for the inconvenience..... show some class.  She seemed very bored and blah

I would positively get my next order to go and eat it at home,
author: Foodlover B.

description:
If I had known Vega was so solid & charming, I wouldn't have waited so long to visit.  It's a neighborhood spot, but it has an intimate vibe.  I had no idea it was so small.  I've driven by numerous times, & from the outside, it looks a lot bigger.

Pizza & red wine.  A successful marriage for eons.  I was keen on ordering a pie, since the word pizza is featured on the restaurant awning.  But seeing all the pasta dishes at every other table made me wish I'd ordered a pasta dish as well.  Next time.

The vegetarian pizza was a win.  Having only 4 toppings total, it's nice & simple.  Homemade red sauce, mushrooms, caramelized onions, & arugula.  The crust was solid throughout, & had a touch of saltiness.  It was clean & delicious.

This is an Italian owned & operated restaurant.  Our server, Luca, spoke fluent Italian, & broken English.  This characteristic always makes my Italian food taste that much more authentic.  

If I lived in bernal heights, I'd be here on the regular.  A quintessential neighborhood Italian restaurant.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Unpretentious setting. Excellent food. Fast, pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: The staff and owners consistently put out super dishes at a reasonable price, tasty wine selection, welcoming attitude, immaculate dining area. Vega has been a mainstay of the Bernal dining scene for many years.
author: Stephen R.

description:
We paid a somewhat high price for three very basic pasta dishes.
I asked for one dish to be made without cheese on top. The waitress was more than happy to replace it, but then they simply scraped off the plate and returned the same one without the cheese.
author: Asaf N.

description: Amazing place for dinners. Their linguini in squid ink sauce with  is the best. Very nice service, great place, amazing wine. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Bernal Heights area!
author: Moorissa T.

description:
I came here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday with his family. Everything from the service to the food was fabulous. It's a family business and you are  definitely taken care of like one. Authentic Italian food. 

We ordered the Ossobuco, Pesce Del Diorno, and the gnocchi Boscaiola. They were all delicious but my favorite was the Boscaiola! It was creamy but not overpowering. 

Best Panna Cotta I've ever had.
author: Tam V.

description:
Came to Vega unexpectedly with my boss and I was blown away! She has been here once and kept telling me how good it is. 
The restaurant is small so better to arrive early when there's less people. Our server was very attentive and our drinks were always filled.
Polenta and meatballs as our app. The polenta was cooked to perfection. Crispy on the edges and soft in the middle. The meatballs had the perfect amount of seasoning and the tomato sauce was not overpowering. Such a simple dish but they made it right.
Entrees were Gnocchi alla boscaIola and carbonara. 
One of the BEST gnocchi dishes I have ever had. I don't like mushrooms but thankfully my boss ate them for me. The truffle was not overpowering and the cream sauce wasn't too heavy at all. The Italian sausage added the right amount of kick to it as well. This dish was so dreamy and I will order it next time I visit.
The carbonara was not on the menu but our server was so nice to ask the chefs if they can prepare it for us and they did! Portion was huge! It was a little on the salty side, probably from the pancetta but still very good!
I can't wait to be back to Vega for a 2nd round and try more of their pasta dishes! Highly recommended!
author: Nari M.

description: Excellent neighborhood Italian restaurant serving dishes better than many North Beach establishments. Small dining room and friendly, efficient service. Very busy so a reservation is important. The best food on Cortland Avenue in Bernal Heights.
author: Ramon R.

description: Love this place! I take my cat sometimes to the restaurant and sit outside or they can hang out. Staff is wonderful and they always make accommodations for my husband and myself. We are locals and often come here several times a month
author: K S.

description:
Ordered the margherita pizza + farm egg + Italian sausage. It was very flavourful. Would order again. Probably the best margherita pizza in bernal heights.

The gnocchi looks small but by the time you get through it you will be full my date says.

Pro-Tip: No need to order any appetizers at this place as all the main courses are really filling.
author: Tom P.

description: Great quality of food! Love the organic selection thank you so much! love the intimate dining by candlelight and relaxing music it's so refreshing not to go somewhere where you feel like you're at a club when all you wanna do is have a nice dinner ‍yes it can be a little loud because it's a confined space however everything was pleasant my one disappointment was the Profiteroles  anywhere I've had them it's been a beautiful creampuff in a chocolate sauce not creampuffs sitting on a plate with chocolate sauce smeared on top of them that was very disappointing the tiramisu was good -a little dry  but good !our pizzas were great ,can't wait to come back and try the pastas
author: Soph C.

description:
My goodness!! What the heck they got in the gnocci sausage?-- 

mama mia mama mia-- hell I drove 45 miles just for that and worth every bite of the ride--

coupled with the mushroom sausage shitake pizza--- we shall call that "Broke-the Mouth" moment where you eyes are popped open, no breathing allowed, smiles from cheek to cheek and your thinking of only that happy moment in life.  You we're in a dream-- happiest moment in life was on grandpa's shoulders being carried thru the village and just remembering how he did not want my feet to touch the ground--

how I wish to live a 4 year old again--

The Pizza was that good-- happy moment--life, happy place, happy thoughts. I think of that pizza and it makes me happy. 

Will be there soon enough again-- Owner did a good job with staff movement and table turnovers. Wait was no long for the take-out. Crowded and the eating on the streets in the car was divine watching all the people go by.

Highly recommend for intimate dinner out with you significant other and taste buds that can change overnight over a pizza holy tomato. Syrah with the taught and your good to go.

Remember a place called the Golden Spike on Columbus Ave in North Beach in the 80's-- old italian lady use to cook the Best cioppinno and scooped the pan with her bare hands with the cigarette ashes falling into the pan-- for me that was another happy moment for hungry truck drivers in those days in San Francisco-- 

City by the Bay--- Herb Caen called it then Baghdad by the Bay-- old Herb was one of a kind-- met him many a times--- usually at the bar in the alley near the Chron building on 5ht or the old newspaper hangout at 3rd and Mission-- made into some fancy hotel now.
author: Paulie P.

description:
3.5 stars

Cute place with nice ambience and lighting. Definitely run by Italians who take a lot of pride in their food. 

Dungeness crab salad - pretty good. Fresh crab but some of the pieces were a bit icy.

Fettuccini with duck ragu sauce - the first bite was much better than the last bite. The portion is huge, enough for 3 people with more to spare. For some reason, the pasta got a lot more worse as it got cooler so definitely eat this one fast!
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Food and desserts were delicious and service is pretty good. 

Parking can be pretty hard to come by, so plan on circling around to find street parking. Atmosphere is pretty noisy, definitely not a "impress your date" place and seating is not very intimate, so it's pretty good for groups.
author: Terad D.

description:
Vega is one of the best Italian restaurants in San Francisco. Gnocchi alla boscaiola is my favorite dish but anything else is just great. Ingredients are carefully chosen, ambience is simple but cozy, service is good and fast. Last night we had fettuccine with wild bore ragu, veal scaloppine, and some gelato as dessert. Wine bottles are 4 time the price of a glass so you can pair different wines with different dishes instead of having 2 glasses of the same wine.
A reservation is more likely to end up in a little wait anyway, but better do it.
author: Florentin H.

description: The boscaiano gnocchi is probably the best gnocchi I've ever had -- oozing with truffle oil. Ordered the sautéed spinach as a side to balance out the rich creamy and meaty gnocchi dish I got. Another plus is that the owner and chefs actually speak Italian here apparently.
author: Trevor W.

description: Anytime I'm in SF I make sure to come here. Favorite Italian restaurant of all time. I'm usually not big on Italian food but this place makes me love it. Every. Single. Time. Service is great and food is amazing, what more could you want? It's super small and has a cozy feel to it. You can't go wrong with anything you order. But as far as dessert goes: PANNA COTTA.
author: Elham B.

description: Excellent service and the food was delicious.  I highly recommend the gnocchi!  The place has a very nice atmosphere going and you can tell the staff likes working there.  The prices are also highly reasonable.  Great date spot.
author: Andrew L.

description: I was there two weeks ago made a reservation place is clean good customer service great food . I got the ravioli plate with mushrooms and it was delicious .
author: Ivan M.

description: I was really excited to come here due to the positive reviews, but I walked away unimpressed. We made a reservation and still had to wait 15-20 minutes to be seated on a Sunday evening, which was a bit disappointing. I also thought the dishes could be seasoned a lot more - we had the rigatoni and a pizza to share, and I salted both of these, which I've never done before at an Italian restaurant. Overall, a cute and intimate atmosphere, but the food left a lot to be desired.
author: Stacy K.

description:
This place is great! Great ambience, food and service! Great for date night, friend night or whatnot.

I ordered the pasta with clams, mussels, and calamari. It was delicious! The kind of delicious where you want to keep eating even though youre full. It's the kind of delicious where you glare at your date for asking if they could try some. You can tell the pasta is home made, there's just the right amount of sauce, mussels/clams/calamari was cooked perfectly. 

My date got the rigatoni and he also had similar thoughts that it was delicious and well cooked.

Cons: 1) the bread had kind of tasted funny, a nutty taste to it? Call me American, but I just like sourdough and butter

Everything else was great! Definitely coming back again!
author: Mimi T.

description: Super good italian food on cortland.  One of my favorite neighborhood spots.  The pizzas are on point, although not too big, and the pastas have all been fantastic.  Typically, do order pickups which have always been good, but have eaten here once before and it was a good date spot.
author: christopher h.

description:
Vega is DELICIOUS. I recommend the gnocchi with mushrooms, the spinach salad. I didn't like the sardine appetizer because of the bones in it, and the mushroom pizza is good, a little more cheese than I'd like. I'd ask for light on the cheese in the future. The seafood risotto is delicious and I liked the capellini with crab, but wouldn't get it again.

I've eaten there twice, and would return. I think the price is right for the food etc.

Also I read in other reviews that they don't do great with reservations, so I called at 6:30 to confirm my 8pm reservation, and we were seated on a Friday within a few minutes of arriving (5 - 10), so no biggie there.

Cheers!
author: Carolyn N.

description:
I was able to get a same day reservation on opentable so 1 star just for that!

The food was good. We started with a salad which was huge and delicious. The pasta was awesome as well. So, why only 3 a-ok stars? Service. 

From the moment we walked in the door, we had to track someone down to be seated. Told her our name and she didn't really bother to look up but instead yelled over at someone else to seat us. From there we waited about 10-15 minutes to get a drink order in for wine. 10 more minutes to get said wine. And another 10 to actually order food. By the time we got our salads, I was kind of over it already. Pasta was next and by then I was just hoping we'd get the check soon. No offer for a second glass of wine, we had our card waiting on the table for the second we saw any employee to get us out.
author: Leina K.

description:
Cute little neighborhood restaurant in Bernal Heights.  Place is crowded and reservation is recommended. 

Service is great and waitstaff is attentive.

The CAPELLINI AL GRANCHIO was large enough to share.  Plenty of crab meat to go around.

Since the restaurant is small and crowded, ventilation is horrible, but I'd happily come back
author: Angelica C.

description: Best Italian food in the city...such an assuming restaurant, but with great fresh salads, pastas with perfect red sauce and cheese. Sometimes you just want a great bowl of pasta. I haven't even bothered getting the pizza here because I always find a pasta that's so amazing
author: James R.

description:
Ate dinner here late on a Saturday night and we were delighted surprised with Vega! Our female server was very friendly and provided great service from the minute we walked in. The ambiance is very cute and intimate with some great music playing in the background. 

We ordered a the Ricca salad to start, and shared the Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola/ Saltimbocca. Everything was delicious! Best Gnocchi we've had in awhile, and being Italian, I'd like to think I know good Italian when I eat it! The sauce with the Saltimbocca was so good we were using the complimentary bread to wipe every last drop of it. We had a couple glasses of their house Chardonnay, which was also surprisingly cheap (only $5/glass) and yummy. 

By the time the dessert menus came, they had already closed we were clearly the last ones in the restaurant. We still did not feel rushed and decided to share the Affogato-was a great decision! The espresso helped digest all the food we just ate and the ice cream and fixings hit our sweet tooth. 

We will definitely be back and look forward to trying the pizzas!
author: Brett B.

description: Delicious pastas and salad and lovely service. I had the spinach salad and the orchietta pasta with broccoli rabé it was perfect. My date had the angel hair with crab and he was raving about it. We have also ordered great pizza from here and then brought it down to Holy Water to eat with cocktails on a too busy to get a table at vega night. (always ask your bartender first in case they don't want outside food in) I'm happy this gem is in my neighborhood!
author: Leann W.

description: The best Italian place in San Francisco. The owner was very friendly and was very engaged in the costumers and in the kitchen and made it feel like we were in a small family owned restaurant in Italy. He was straight from Rome yet his restaurant was better than any food I've ever tried in italy. Everything from the wine to the appetizer to the gnocchi to the pizza was perfectly made and exceeded expectations. 10/10 would Recommend.
author: Spencer G.

description: Went for a long time friends 60th birthday and we were not disappointed. The service was great, The wine selection was a good variety and the portions were great!
author: Elpie K.

description: A neighborhood jem! If you love delicious  Italian food and great service don't pass this up! Did I mention the wine selection, outstanding!
author: Renee M.

description: I love the gnocchi it's so good. And the waiters are very attentive. It's a small place so sometimes the wait can be long. But great Italian food!
author: Monet A.

description: Not very good at all in my opinion. Pizza crust was majorly lacking- tasted stale and pre made. Egg on top was cooked through, 'pancetta' was undercooked and massive whole onion slices and asparagus spears were awkward toppings. Generous squid appetizer though the white beans underneath were devoid of any thought or flavor.
author: Anthony R.

description: Beautiful decor. Fast service. Amazing food. They even had someone singing and playing the guitar! I believe his name was Alfredo Imparato. Definitely coming back! Thank you for a wonderful experience
author: Serena T.

description: Came here last night for dinner. The place is small but, the food servings are huge. I got the squid ink pasta with the calamari appetizer. The squid ink pasta was the daily special for the day, and it was delicious. As mentioned before, the serving portions are huge so it would be best to share. The calamari appetizer could have been a meal itself since, it was a large portion. The calamari was delectable but, I wish there was more of the lemon sauce on my squid. Other than that, everything was great.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Great restaurant whose biggest issue is their lack of ability to honor reservations.  It's a shame for it's a good place but not managed well.
author: Mark F.

description: Absolutely amazing place. The staff is fun and helpful. The food is absolutely amazing and I would recommend the capricciosa pizza and the gnocchi allá boscaiola.They're both delicious and a necessary if you come here. Even though it can get busy I still think it's an underrated place in this area.
author: Filip C.

description: My husband and I are regulars at Vega and we have always had amazing meals! We have brought friends that continue to come back because they loved this hidden gem in Bernal Heights. The service is always good. The food is delicious! The owners (husband and wife) are kind and gracious. We couldn't ask for a better, truly authentic Italian restaurant in our neighborhood. Vega is a MUST!
author: Katie T.

description:
I want to start out saying the food is VERY GOOD here.  That is not the problem.
I will make this short.  Reservation (on a MONDAY) made for 7P, table not ready,
they'd let us know.  NO-ONE ever came to let us know anything!!!!  Standing outside
in the COLD for a half hour (yes, now 7:30P!) and I have to go in to inquire........WTF?!?!
They said there still are NO TABLES.  Why on earth do you take a reservation when 
you cannot seat your customers???????????????????????????  They have no
hostess to handle the guests.  No apologies, no wine offered in the way of an apology....
JUST LEFT STANDING OUT IN THE COLD with NO IDEA of when we'd be seated.
WE LEFT AND WILL NOT BE GOING BACK!
author: Patrice C.

description: I've been here a couple of times and I have not been disappointed. The pasta is fresh and you can't help but want more! The ambiance is laid back and we always have a great time! Great little spot in the neighborhood. Love it.
author: Mel P.

description: Yum. Pizza to go on a Saturday night. Not locals. Loved the Margherita and the mushroom/truffle oil pizza. Both were incredible. And so fast!!!
author: Danielle W.

description: The food was very good and tasty. Restaurant was very clean. The staff was very professional and polite. I would definitely come back and I highly recommend this restaurant
author: Marta L.

description:
Girls Night Out (GNO). 

In my 20s, GNO meant getting tipsy, making googly eyes with the guy across the bar who looks cute...after 7 shots; then trying to walk over to him but toppling over because I walk in heels like a baby giraffe in roller skates...after 7 shots.

Now that I'm in my 30s, GNO means enjoying a carblicious meal with a glass of wine while gossiping about how long our significant other lasts in bed. Just kidding, fellas!

For a last minute GNO, I suggested going to Vega for dinner because I had a solid meal on my first visit and parking is plentiful. Vega is not a destination restaurant by any means but if you're in the area and looking for a simple, tasty, and satisfying Italian meal than look no further than Vega. The portions are generous and prices are reasonable. On Tuesdays, kid's pizzas are 50% off and on Wednesdays, bottles of wine are 50% off.

On my two visits, I've tried the following (sorry for the poor quality pics):
*Carpaccio di Polipo: Octopus carpaccio ($10): http://bit.ly/1uR2I8T
*Tortino di Granchio: Dungeness crab w/ avocado, cucumber & endive ($14): http://bit.ly/Zo3r7B
*Impepata Di Vongole E Cozze: Mussels w/ garlic, chili flakes, parsley & white wine ($12): http://bit.ly/1qYU1J1
*Quattro Formaggi Pizza: Mozzarella, fontina, goat cheese, gorgonzola, & pear ($15 + $4 for prosciutto & egg): http://bit.ly/1oVs6GJ
*Pizza Capricciosa: Homemade tomato sauce, mozzarella, prosciutto, artichoke, mushrooms & egg  ($15): http://bit.ly/XcfdAi
*Pappardelle Al Ragu: Papparadelle w/ beef, pork & lamb ($18): http://bit.ly/1mb4MZz
*Costolette Di Agnello: Rack of lamb w/ roasted polenta & white truffle oil ($22): http://bit.ly/1mb4WjG
*Panna Cotta & Vanilla Gelato ($8 + $3): http://bit.ly/1s50qWx

You can't go wrong with any of their seafood apps. They're fresh and chock full of seafood goodness. My favorite is the mussels in the white wine broth. The broth is robust with a nice kick; it was an addicting dip for the grilled bread. 

I enjoyed the thin crust pizza on my first visit (quattro formaggi). It was crispy throughout with a perfectly cooked egg that oozed upon poking. I didn't have the same luck with the pizza capricciosa on my second visit. The middle was soggy upon arrival and the egg had a fully cooked yolk. *sad pouty lip* 

If you have value on your mind, then I would opt for Vega's pastas over their pizzas. The portions are HUGE. My papparadelle could easy feed 2 hungry people. The sheets of pasta were perfectly al-dente and lightly tossed in a flavorful, thick ragu sauce. Really liked the trio of meats; the lamb added a subtle gamey bite. Rustic and comforting. 

I had a taste of the tender rack of lamb (medium rare) which was meaty, juicy, and downright delicious. It was a special of the night (first visit) and I would highly recommend this dish if it's available and if you're feeling like a carniwhore that night.

If you still have room in your tummy, then the panna cotta is a great way to end dinner. It's firm yet lightly smooth with a refreshing hint of lemon.

Service is everything you would expect from a good neighborhood restaurant: warm, friendly, and attentive. Much better than what I've experienced at their other restaurants (Liberty Café/Bernal Star).

The ambiance is dim, a little cramped, and old skool. Great for a casual date but not for parties larger than 4. 

For our GNO party of 4, we shared 2 apps, one pizza, 4 entrees, and each had a glass of wine. The total was only $43 pp including tip plus we each had a doggy bag to bring home. 

Leaving with a food baby to go home to comfortably plop on the couch and watch Lifetime Movie Network sure beats nursing a hangover, bruises, and a twisted ankle from toppling over because I walk in heels like a baby giraffe in roller skates...after 7 shots.

Hmmm, I wonder how GNO in our 40s will be like...a little Magic Mike action?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: We were happily surprised by this place!  Small and quaint, but excellent quality and totally accommodating for our little toddler!  Gnocchi was amazing, handmade paperdelle was awesome, but the best was the grilled squid.   Yum!
author: Edgar C.

description: It's a lovely place, great food but I felt rushed from the moment I arrived. I've had this same experience more than once there, but I keep going back for the food. After last evening, I think I will find another place where I can relax while I dine.
author: Donna B.

description:
This place was straight up amazing!

I went with a very close friend of mine one spring weekend, and dare I say... I tried octopus carpaccio for the first time ever! It was delicious and amazing- it tasted like prosciutto for some reason.

I also shared a pasta and a pizza- I can't remember what, but it was great :)

Overall, don't worry about spending too much here- I spent around $30 or $40 here, and I ordered a lot.

Lovely place! Will be coming back soon.
author: Anders Z.

description: Wow, glad we just happened to be staying across the street from this place because the food was wonderful!
author: Katherine S.

description:
Fabulous Italian food and great service. Wonderful choices for glasses of wine. We ordered pasta and pizza and it was great for us 3 adults and 2 children. Dessert menu is lovely but the kids only wanted chocolate ice cream, which tends to be rare at Italian restaurants :-)
I always love eating at Vega!
author: Michael S.

description: I still fantasize about the gnocchi with gorgonzola and fontina sauce. All you need is a bottle of Nebbiolo and some good conversation. I really can't think of anything better...
author: Adriana G.

description: Walked in with my friend and enjoyed it! Great service and promotion of 1/2 bottles of wine--what a Wednesday night! The artichokes appetizer was a great start (and I'm not a huge fan of artichokes) and the rigatoni with beef meatballs was delicious! I will be back soon!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
The good:
*Italian in the city, with a neighborhood vibe (Bernal Heights, away from the SF hustle bustle)
*Solid pasta dishes
*Good and attentive service
*Takes reservations

The better:
*Most pasta is handmade and served perfectly al dente
*Generous portions
*Cozy, romantic, yet family-friendly ambiance

The best:
*Homemade gnocchi with mushrooms, Italian sausage, parmigiano & white truffle oil (although, "I think it was better the first time I got it")

The could be better:
*Cozy but cramped--elbow to elbow with your neighbors
*Almost always crowded, and you may have to wait even with a reservation
*The food is good, but sometimes the flavors are a little off

Notes:
*Still need to try the pizza
*Popular for take-out
*Rounding up from 3.5 stars
author: Kate V.

description:
A delicious neighborhood gem.  

My girlfriends and I did a last minute dinner while was of our girlfriends was back in town.  My friend suggested Vega and it was great choice.

To start, our party of four decided to go with two appetizers and a pizza to share:
*Impepata di Vongole e Cozze ($12) - A must order!  The mussels come in a white wine broth.  The chili flakes give it a slight kick.  You'll find yourself asking for more bread to soak up the delicious broth.
*Tortino di Granchio ($14) - Good & refreshing.  A generous amount of shredded Dungeness crab meat, sliced cucumbers, and avocado slices are placed on top of endive leaves. 
*Pizza Capricciosa ($15) - Sounded good, executed bad.  The pizza was topped with mozzarella, prosciutto, artichoke, mushroom, and egg.  I wish the prosciutto and egg were placed in a more centralized location on the pizza so it could be present on each slice.  My other complaint is that our pizza was soggy and our egg was overcooked and lacked any kind of runniness in the yolk.  

For my entree, I went with the Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola.  It was delectable and delicious!  The homemade dumplings were tender with a slight chewiness to them.  It was mixed with sausage and mushrooms in a cream sauce.  Truffle oil was added to the dish as the finishing touch. 

WHAT TO KNOW:
*Street parking (some metered)
*No wait at 6:15pm on a Tuesday
*Service was attentive and friendly
*Portion size, a pizza, two appetizers and an entree for each of us was a lot of food.  
*Dress in layers.  The restaurant gets hot and stuffy.
author: Nicole S.

description: The Carciofini Ripieni (warmed artichoke hearts stuffed w/goat cheese, wrapped in Prosciutto di Parma, pesto and mixed greens) appetizer is outstanding. I wish they did a full pasta dish with that --- I'd be there every night. For my entree, I had the Capellini al Granchio (handmade capellini with fresh Dungeness crabmeat, tomatoes, olive oil, parsley). It was pretty good, but not outstanding.
author: Paul L.

description:
You just cannot do any better than this place. I saw this place on Check Please and have bookmarked it for the last 2 years. This is quite the hidden gem.
Always go for the artichoke hearts and their famous gnocchi with sausage. Service is beyond amazing and fast plus efficient. Wine list is speculator and affordable; especially if you go on half priced wine nights ;)
Have the most romantic date here and just sit and enjoy the enchantment.
author: Kelly T.

description:
1. Do NOT come here hungry, the wait can be long and no one will greet you when you arrive. 

The two of us arrived on a Thu evening, hoping to try out this place. It was 8:30ish by the time we arrived, and there were a group of people waiting outside. We were quite confused when we entered the door, hoping to be greeted by a waitress or hostess and tell us what to expect, however, no one showed up or even noticed we were here. My fiancé noticed there was a sheet of paper hidden at the counter by the kitchen door, and figured out it would be where he should put the name so he did. There were only 2 more waiting in front of us according to the sheet so we decided to wait it out. 

Whilst we were waiting outside, a man from another group told us they called the place before heading down here, and they lived only 2 mins walk from here, were told they'd be seated, but then they had to wait 30 mins and still waiting to be seated... we were already quite hungry... we went in to check a few times and eventually got hold of a waiter who finally seated us. 

With all said, it takes a lot of initiative if you wanna be seated at this place. Don't expect very good service from the beginning. 

2. The place is very small and intimate, hence LOUD. 

It's an Italian restaurant in America, so be prepared for some loud talking in this tiny restaurant. My fiancé and I are both quiet people and we could hardly hear each other in there. It was also so cramped in there... it's be difficult to even get to the bathroom after you're seated.

3. Food is amazing. 

Luckily we were not disappointed once the food was served. All the waiting made sense eventually. 

I'd happily give it a 4 star if ain't for the lousy service at the beginning where we had to figure out all by ourselves, given the price is $$$. 

Please keep up with the good food but also improve your service. Use some kind of technology to help if there is a shortage of staff?
author: Britta C.

description:
Take someone special here. It's a cute Italian restaurant in Bernal Heights that you can easily miss. In fact, we walked by Vega, the second time, and didn't even realize it. It's small and intimate with maybe 20 seats. 
Food is delectable. My favorites are the wanted artichoke hearts, calamari, and the house gnocchi with Italian sausage. Their wine list is pretty substantial. Mostly wines from across Italy. 
The service is outstanding. Everyone is knowledgable about the food and is quick. 
Make reservations.
author: Tony L.

description:
Another favorite restaurant on Bernal Heights! I'm so glad that Bernal Heights is livening up.

I was craving Italian so the hubbie and I decided to give Vega a try. We've frequented Bernal Heights, however we never really noticed Vega before. Now, we will never forget about it. 

The atmosphere of this small restaurant is simply charming. It was reminiscent of our time in Italy when we ate at small local restaurants. 

I ordered the lamb with mushroom and polenta. The hubbie ordered wild boar rigatoni. Normally, I do not like tomato based pasta, but the rigatoni was so good! It wasn't sour/tangy like most tomato based pastas. I enjoyed the tomato & buttery flavor of the dish. The lamb was also amazing! Cooked well and not too salty. 

As for the service it was delightful. We felt welcomed and not rushed at all. We will definitely be coming back again and recommending Vega to our friends!
author: Donna L.

description: There are still a few gems in San Francisco where you can have a really lovely meal for $25/30pp and this is one of those gems. The place is cozy, food is excellent (funghi pizza, the gnocchi are my favs) and the wine list solid Italian wines. Great neighborhood spot and I hope it remains affordable.
author: Hema P.

description:
Really delicious with really high quality ingredients.  Most of their veggies are organic and their olive oil is imported from Italy.  You can check with the server that the pasta dish has handmade pasta; if not, they let you substitute for one of their handmade ones.  My favorite is the clam pasta.  

My only complaint is the long lines; I would come here more often if the wait was shorter!
author: T Y.

description: This is the deal, they do lots of things I "like," and they do a few things I "love." As we all know, taste is subjective. There is, however, one item on their menu that is truly "anointed," their Mushroom Pizza - aka "Pizza Al Funghi con olio Di Tartufo."
author: Nick S.

description:
Love having this restaurant in the neighborhood - it feels warm and intimate, with low lighting and warm reddish colors.  They have two "mushrooms and truffle" type pizzas - and our server recommended the pizza al funghi as the better of the two.  I don't know since that's the only pizza we ordered, but it was fantastic!  So was their famous gnocchi bosciola.  The octopus carpaccio was certainly exotic but a bit too weird and lemony.

We also had a couple solid glasses of red wine.  Would absolutely go back.
author: Aaron M.

description: I am so fortunate to have found Vega! Food is consistently delicious. The gnocchi alla boscaiola is amazing. My friend Jeff consistently orders this dish and eats it with his arm protecting his plate to prevent others' wandering forks! The pesce del giorno is also a beautifully seasoned dish -- regardless of the fish of the day -- with the lovely combination of tomatoes, olives and capers. Pizza with mushrooms, artichoke with goat cheese app, and desserts are all fantastic too. Even the olive oil they serve with the bread is deliciously fruity. I have yet to have a bad meal here!
author: Mary H.

description:
I am so glad my boyfriend discovered this charm! We had reservations for 7:30pm on a Saturday but we arrived around 6:30pm. With the restaurant being relatively small, I was not optimistic we would be seated early. Luckily, one table was available and we were seated immediately. The warm ambience makes it a great place for a couples date night or girls' dinner date. 

We ordered a pizza capricciosa (homemade tomato sauce, mozzarella, prosciutto, artichoke, mushrooms, egg) and fettuccine al ragu (handmade fettuccine w/ slow cooked wild boar ragu, topped w/ parmesan cheese) to share and both were delicious. The portion for the pasta was huge and more than enough for two to share so we packed our leftovers to go. I'm used to Italian restaurants plating very small portions so this was a pleasant surprise. I preferred the pasta over the pizza, the pasta is fresh and you can tell in the taste/texture. 

There was only 3 waitstaff so it is a bit challenging to get their attention but otherwise, the service is great. Our bill came out to around $35 which I consider to be affordable for a good Italian meal. I am definitely looking to come back to try the other dishes on the menu.
author: Linda H.

description:
Vega could have easily been a 4-star joint if it wasn't for one single reason: we had a reservation at 8 and didn't get seated until 8:30 and they didn't seem to really give a shit about it.  This place is tiny, son, and they have no types of technology to manage their tables and flow.  

Anyway, after the wait, we needed the food to be epic and it almost got there.  The starters were forgettable (polenta was dry and flavorless, the insalata ricca with candied walnuts, raisins, and goat cheese was amateurish) but the mains were delicious.  I had their popular gnocchi all bascaiola and it was incredible, quite a treat.  My wife had the pizza rossa and it was a little work of art.

Again, could have easily been stellar if it wasn't for the 30 min wait.
author: Saminda W.

description: Not that this restaurant needs more top reviews as it is very obvious that its exquisitely decorated yet cozy casual small restaurant ambience reaches full capacity frequently just by the loyal patronage of those living in the neighborhood.  However, my 2nd visit, years after my first visit, was just as great. Wait staff is very efficient yet super helpful and friendly. The prices are extremely affordable with each portion order generous enough to share especially if ordering more than one entree.  The quality and taste is superb, noticeable from the first bite. However, unless you're vegan or totally vegetarian, which I am not, next time I will order an appetizer or another entree with the all vegetarian pizza I ordered, though I had them add sausage.  I order a perfectly tossed medley of greens with citrus slices, candied walnuts and thick shaves of parmesano cheese followed by delicate layer of vegetables on Vega's signature thin crispy crust with a high pile of arugula. Had I known there would be a lot of fresh greens on top of the pizza, instead of a salad of greens, an appetizer or entree would have been better. I enjoy fresh raw greens, but confined to a salad or appetizer tray of crudites. However, the choice was my fault, but what I ordered was nicely executed. However, the ambience is more fun and more conducive to dining with someone else.
author: Lizabeth G.

description:
A nice little Italian restaurant in a residential like neighborhood. 

I came in with two other friends for dinner and we all ordered pasta. My friends ordered the fettuccine wild boar ragu and the dungeness crab angel hair pastas. I ordered the orecchiette broccoli rabe. 

For me, the orecchiette itself was good, but the abundance amount of broccoli rabe was a bit overwhelming and made it a bit too bitter to enjoy after eating most of it. 

The fettuccine wild boar ragu was good. The pasta felt like it came from a box. My friend thought it would be handmade like they stated on their website. The noodles were not al dente and felt a little overcooked. The wild boar ragu wasn't gamey, so they cooked it well and was good. 

The dungeness crab angel hair pasta was good but the noodles were a bit mushy as well, a bit overcooked. And since angel hair pasta was already so thin, it started to lose a little bit of its firmness/texture. 

Overall, the food was pretty good if I don't get into detail about it. The environment is nice. I would consider coming back when I have an ill pasta craving.
author: Emily W.

description: Best date night EVER with my lil 27month old! Great food and early in the evening there's plenty of local neighborhood folk with their kids. Great atmosphere for a romantic date too. I love Vega and so glad they are in my hood:)
author: Erica R.

description:
We had a reservation for 8p for my mom's bday (made it on Seatme). We still had to wait 30 min. That knocked one star off. WTF. The bread wasn't good, the goat cheese salad had only a tiny amount of goat cheese, and the roasted polenta was gross.

I wasn't expecting much after a disappointing start...

Then the spaghetti, minus anchovies, blessed with kalamata olives, chili flakes, and capers, buh-lewwwww my mind. The pizza rossa+mozzarella was solid.

I'd go back for the pizza and pasta, skip the apps.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Great atmosphere. I appreciate that the let us reserve a table for 10 and that it was ready when we got there. The menu was interesting and appealing. Since I don't eat wheat or corn-I had fewer choices-but the options were very appetizing. Two people had the rack of lamb, which looked nice but small, I had the chicken--really yummy. One friend had a pasta dish that she enjoyed, one friend had minestrone and the rest of the table ordered pizza! They looked fabulous and they really enjoyed them!
author: Monica T.

description:
The food here was great.  Everything we tried was really delicious.
The place looks nice and is cozy, but maybe a little too cozy.  The people at our table in chairs kept getting bumped into as the waitress passed by again and again.
The service was terrible.
As we walked in waiting for someone to take notice of us (there were plenty of tables) no one greeted us. When we were finally seated, it was a full 10-15 minutes before a server came over.  When she finally did, she was a little gruff and started right in on "what can I get you". I don't mind waiting for food, but waiting for more water, our check, ect was ridiculous. OUr waitress served our food and never came back. We had to get the check from someone else after waiting for her.
The management should know.  You have a great place with tasty food.  You need better service.  I'd like to go back, but the service was borderline hostile.
author: C D.

description: Get... The affogato.... And.... The tiramisu... Hot damn this place is fabulous! Sometimes do you have to wait longer than originally anticipated? Yes. And. Who cares. Welcome to SF. Awesome dessert, appetizers (meatballs are awesome) and this pizzas are fabulous. You can add a fried egg and arugula to any of them. Simply delish!
author: Melissa D.

description:
Invite my dad to dinner in one of the gentrified areas of SF & you'll be reminded, in the form of horror stories & cautionary tales, of the city's sordid past. Our drive to Bernal Heights brought up friends from a bygone era: "Didn't Uncle so-and-so live in that corner house? Doesn't so-and-so's mom still own that house on Banks?" It's a trip down memory lane, both the good & the not so good. 

These days, Cortland's much-improved, modern shoppe-lined street does much to ease my dad's mind that we're finally safe here. 

Our party of three took our seats in Vega promptly at 5. From offering useful recommendations to the busser asking how we liked our pies, service was refreshingly genuine. 

Their thin crust pizzas were delicate, yet sturdy & had a good amount of chewiness. We ordered:
-- margherita: bubbly brown fior di latte mozzarella, a nice chiffonade of basil. Classic, & classically delicious. 
-- margherita w/ sausage added: did not try, but satisfactory for our carnivore, based on how much was eaten (or rather what little was left!) 
-- official name is "pizza ai funghi con olio di tartufo," but feel free to refer to it as the mushroom & white truffle oil pizza like I did: shiitake mushrooms are the star of the show -- meaty with a strong woodsy flavor, so glad for the lavish portion! Mild duo of mozzarella & fontina compliments, while a drizzle of white truffle oil elevates the mushroom flavor. 

A solid contender to be one of my regular pizza joints.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Great Italian food and atmosphere. Good selection of wines too.
Suggested to those looking for a true Italian experience.
author: Nicola S.

description:
I really enjoyed our dinner here. This place is really quaint, and feels really welcoming. When you walk in, you don't feel like you're in a big and busy city. 

They brought out fresh, soft bread, and very sweet and strong olive oil to start. And I ate way too much bread, considering the size of our meal. We shared the pizza with asparagus, smoked pancetta (aka bacon), Carmelites onion, and mounds of parmigiano and mozzarella. It was insanely good, with the perfect crust texture. It was like a breakfast pizza, with wonderful smoky and saltiness from the meat, and sweetness from the onion.

We also go the rigatoni with meatballs, which even though delicious, I would have been completely fine without, considering the star pizza.
author: Joey S.

description:
