3.5 Stars

Small neighborhood restaurant in Bernal. Spent a double date night here. Our party of 4 had reservations for 7pm on a Friday night and there were no problems getting seated right away!  It's definitely a cozy place. The tables on our sides were so close, I could almost make out what the other people were talking about.

We started off with 2 appetizers. The calamari and cannellini beans as well as the mussels. OMG! I could have eaten the mussels as my main entree! The broth was so flavorful. Sadly, we only had 4 pieces of bread with the dish. It would have been nice to have more to soak up the yummy broth.

Our table happened to share small bites of our entrée with each other so that we could try everything. 

We ordered:
Baked Rigatoni, the Gnocchi, the Chicken breast and the pizza Capricciosa.

The rigatoni was definitely cheesy and hearty. There was so much that even my hubby couldn't finish.

The gnocchi was soft and pillowy. I loved the Italian sausage.

The chicken was moist, not dry at all and was a great combination with the prosciutto.

I had a slice of the pizza and surprisingly, it was just ok. (Must have been because I had pizza the other night?)

Overall, the portions are satisfying. If I were to come back, I'd get the either of the appetizers we ordered as my own entrée! Service was great as well! By the time we left, the place was full and even a few people waiting outside to get seated.
author: Mimie L.

description:
Location: Noe Valley/Mission, which makes parking extremely difficult. There is metered parking but it's difficult to find a spot. 

Atmosphere: It's a small space with low lighting and closely packed tables. It's a great place for a girls' night or date night.

Service: Friendly and fast service from our hostess and waitress.

Food: AMAZING. If everything else (atmosphere, service) were subpar, I would still come here for the food. Having vacationed in a couple of cities in Italy, I think that the pasta at Vega is genuinely Italian. The baked rigatoni can be extremely hot, but is delicious. The pasta is fresh, and really brings me back to Italy! I wish I had tried the desserts, but I'll save that for next time!
author: Ruby K.

description: Vega is our neighborhood joint.  I love it.  The fish is always delicious.  I always get the insalata ricca, and love it.  But the real winner is the boscaiola.  It's incredible.  On Wed nights they have half off bottles of wine.  The owners are friendly and own two other restaurants on Cortland.  Good food, good people.
author: Matt G.

description:
Very disappointed....but not because of the food. 

Friday night me and my boyfriend made a reservation for 8:45. We arrived 5 mins early and were still waiting for 20 mins after our reservation time. By 9:05 my boyfriend and I just wanted to eat so we told them we would sit outside even though it was a rainy night.

What's the point of a making a reservation?. 

We sat down and got taken care of quickly since we were the only humans sitting outside. 

When our food came out it was only ONE plate. 
Me and my boyfriend looked at each other and asked where the other dinner was and the waitress said "I thought you just ordered one meal". 

So let me get this straight, me and my boyfriend made a reservation to split a meal?. NO....

Aside from our date night being ruined, the waitress had no sympathy for HER mistake and was actually really RUDE when we told her she was wrong. 

We waiting 20 mins for another plate to come out but by this time me and my boyfriend were DONE.

Our meal should have been comped....PERIOD. 

We won't be back
author: Jay S.

description: Best Italian food I've had in a really long time, a real gem in Bernal! Will definitely be back again soon - be sure to make a reservation beforehand as the place is quite small!
author: Anthony L.

description:
"Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." - Leonardo da Vinci

The Italians are masters of the elegance in simplicity. Vega serves food like I remember enjoying all over Italy. This restaurant is also like Italy - small, loud, busy, and offers a really great meal at an affordable price. 

We ordered: 

PAPPARDELLE AL RAGU' DI CINGHIALE
Like hand pulled Asian Noodles -  handmade pasta is in a world all it's own. I ordered this to have something to really sink my teeth into. The pasta was satisfying, the sauce was wonderfully balanced - not acidic, and the wild boar was tender and slightly gamey. This is a wonderful comfort meal. 

PIZZA MARGHERITA and CAPRICCIOSA
This is beautiful pizza that reminds me of what I had in Italy with the homemade sauce, beautiful cheeses, and wonderfully crisp yet tender dough. These were perfect. 

ORECCHIETTE ALLE CIME DI RAPA
The pasta was al dente, the sauce was simple yet delicious. I can't wait to have this again! 

CALAMARI E CANNELLINI - this was a dud. 
I am really picky about calamari. I expect the technique to be textbook perfect so I am chewing tender delicious body - not Goodwill tire. This had good flavor with the cannelli beans but I looked like a cow chewing cud. It was disappointing. 


Noteworthy: 
This place is small so make sure to book reservations to avoid waiting. 

Bambino Tuesdays 1/2 off kid pizzas - AVOID if you do not like kids! 

1/2 off WIne Wedesdays . . . let's gather a bunch of Yelpers and make it a date! 

Vega is in a class all it's own. I love it.
author: Jennifer C P.

description: The pizzas were AMAZING! Split 2 with 3 people and we still didn't finish. High quality ingredients and friendly service. I will definitely be going back to try more on the menu! Nice little outside seating. Yum!
author: Steph M.

description: This is our neighborhood restaurant and we feel so lucky to have it steps away as we'd cross the city to go to it. The food is so good, the people are so nice and it's a cozy place on a foggy night. Try either of the gnocchi dishes or the puttanesca.
author: Kira M.

description: The food and ambiance was great but the wait was a bit on the long side.  Overall it was a great experience.
author: Ivonne G.

description:
More like 3.5 stars
Pros:
Yummy food
Huge portions
We were seated on time

Cons:
Took 40 minutes to get our appetizer and almost an hour to get our dinner. 
Cramped and stuffy and dark
LOUD

Plan on sharing your dish if you order pasta; it truly is too much for one person. 
Do not go there hungry, because by the time you get your food, you will be starving and hangry. 
Try to going when it's not busy or if it's a nice day so you can sit outside and have more personal space and fresh air. I felt bad for the employees. It really is cramped. They should eliminate one table.
Oh, they were out of the home made pasta. Was really looking forward to that. Check ahead before you go.
author: ibby m.

description: We had a reservation for a table for 8 people at 8 o'clock. But the table was not ready at that time and we waited 45 min before sitting. The owner was not friendly and did not apologize about the delay. We ordered pappardelle with boar meat sauce but we got just sticky pappardelle with beef sauce. So, definitely not boar. We are Italians and we know what is Good Italian food. For sure we didn't have anything close to that. This place is only expensive.
author: Luca T.

description: Lucky me I stumbled into this place when first moving to San Francisco. I've been here on numerous occasions and absolutely NEVER been disappointed. Consistency is key here and the flavors continue to dazzle me. I think I have tried almost everything they offer on the menu but my favorite has to be the Cappellini al granchio and their Gnocchi yummmmmmy. Great..... now my mouth is watering......
author: Moon S.

description:
Last night was my first time eating at Vega and I am so happy my man and I decided to have dinner there. 

The restaurant is intimate and it wasn't busy when we came in. The service was great, the prices were decent, and the food was incredible. Everything we ordered was delicious. We split a pizza and both got the rigatoni. Ordered the tiramisu for desert and it did not disappoint.   Everything was lit. Definitely coming back soon.
author: Kaitlin F.

description:
Hellloooooo nurse! 

That was irrelevant, I just have Animaniacs on the brain, oddly enough. Anywho y'all, let me tell you about my evening last night. My newly engaged gal pal Vanessa R and I headed up to Bernal Heights for a little ladies night gab and wine (not whine!) fest. We'd been meaning to get up there for some time, so I finally pulled the trigger and booked via SeatMe which made things quite seemless. 

Vanessa informed that Bernal is up-and-coming for lesbian / gay couples, so we played into that a bit, as she is very girly with a giant rock on her finger, and I am boisterous and tatted up, good times. (Apologies if anyone is offended by my generalities / stereotyping)

*Half price bottles of wine* is reason enough for me to bus my way to Vega on a Wednesday night. We went with a (regularly $38) bottle of Pinot Bianco and put it in an ice bath to cool me down from my hike up from the bus stop. Our waitress was very friendly and also works down the street at the sister wine bar, VinoRosso, where Vanessa had just tried and they remembered each other, which was nice.

We shared a salad and a pizza, the Insalata Romana ($9) was big enough for us to share, but the raddicio and arugula combo needs something sweet to break up the bitterness. Might I suggest candied almonds or pecans instead of plain almonds? The Gorgonzola was creamy and delicious, but the salad definitely needs a hint of sugar.

The Margherita Pizza ($11) was our next dish, and we were a little suprised when we didn't see sliced tomatoes accompanying the basil, but the menu doesn't say anything about sliced tomatoes, so we let by-gone's be by-gones. They do have a delicious tomatoe sauce on the pizza, just not your traditional Margherita pizza. It was good overall, but burned on the bottom, sadly.

So, why a 4 Star review? Well, for the things already mentioned, also the place was crazy hot inside, like I was sweating in a tank top, and we were seated at arguably the worst table in the place: next to the restroom. At the end of our meal, we both agreed that the times we'd been to Vega in the past were much better. Maybe it was an off night, whatever, we had a nice time together and that's what really matters. The end.
author: Crystal C.

description:
We have been going to this restaurant for 4 years! Everything about this place is fantastic! 
I don't have many favorite restaurants as these days food can be about the same anywhere!  Not here! 

The atmosphere, the music, the staff - All incredible! 

The food is so amazing.  The gnocchi is truly the best I've ever had.  

The wine list is superb! 

You can't go wrong at Vega.  It's really a slice of heaven in your mouth!
author: Angela P.

description:
My go to neighborhood place for Italian. The food is excellent. Love the mussels appetizer and the artichoke hearts wrapped in prosciutto. The chicken saltimbocca is perfect as is the baked rigatoni. 
I have not had the pizza yet. The place is quaint and the staff is friendly.
author: Robert O.

description:
Vega is one of the great San Francisco pizzerias.  Located on happening Cortland, it offers a nice, atmospheric Italian experience.  I generally order the Pizza Vegetariana, which I'd like to pitch in this review.  Although I am not vegetarian, there is something sublime in how this pizza comes together: I really savor the combination of the arugula, mushrooms, olives, and caramelized onions.  There is a delicious sweetness to this particular pizza that makes it worth trying.  

Separately, I would also put in a very good word for the Capellini al Granchio - a hearty pasta dish featuring crab meat.  

I have not often had desserts - usually one pizza leaves me feeling quite contented.  The wine list is extensive and Italian beers are also available.  

Gluten-free pizzas are available; a friend of mine pronounced hers to be delightful.

Reservations are recommended.  Walking in on even a Monday evening is a 50/50 bet.
author: Rob R.

description: Aside from the food being absolutely amazing, the servers are phenomenal to say the least. A very homey, warm environment. Visiting San Francisco (the city of food) and eating here twice in a row says a lot about this place. You can tell the food is freshly made. The bread they bring out with the side of Corto oil is delicious. I can't stop raving about this place, it is a must!!!! Also, not to mention Leo was an amazing server and very attentive! A++++++++
author: Lucy M.

description: We really enjoy coming here. Our last visit was especially wonderful with the cran cappellini at its best and great service. The neighborhood is charming too with cute shops and a couple solid bars nearby.
author: yumm y.

description:
Cute place, great ambiance. Wait staff took a long time to notice us, at first, but afterwards they were timely and always friendly. Food was decent, but nothing that would make us come back a second time.

We ordered:
- Polenta and meatballs (which were burned underneath, so you couldn't cut through them easily).
- The spinach salad had too much balsamic dressing, but was still tasty. The goat cheese and walnuts made it. 
- We added Italian sausage to the Vegetariana pizza. Not my favorite SF pizza, but the dough was good. The pizza over all was a bit too sweet, and too over-run with arugula, for both me and my husband.

Overall it was a completely okay meal. The staff were nice and polite, we were seated easily because it was late on a Sunday, and the meal was good but not anything to rave about. We were told by the waitress that we should have tried the pasta, which they are known for. It's too bad we didn't try it. I doubt we'll ever be back.
author: Tawnee K.

description: Rich tasty Italian! It was a tad noisy; my mom ordered a dish with carmelized onions but they didn't hear her. Over all lovely! The food was really good and I would return
author: tracy J.

description: I can't get enough of this restaurant's crab Cappellini. I also like their warm bread and olive oil with balsamic vinegar. The chef and staff tolerate me and my substitution of the red sauce with cream sauce everytime I come here. That means a lot to me. I am way more enamored of it that way with seafood. My boyfriend LOVED their Cioppino which there are so many BAD Cioppinos out there to be tasted. It is hands down the best! A glass of Fahlanghina and a tiramisu for dessert and that is a good night!
author: Stella T.

description: Amazing food! Everything was delicious! One of the best Italian restaurants in the city.
author: Hanna S.

description: Made reservations through yelp for Valentine's day 2017 at 9pm. My boyfriend and I arrived about 20 minutes early and was able to get outdoor seating in the front of the restaurant. I usually don't like sitting outside but it made our date more secluded and quiet. The waitress was great. She always checked in and the food came out at a good pace. We ordered the Carpaccio di polipo, Rigatoni, and Orecchiette alla come di rapa and enjoyed all of it!! I'll definitely return to try more of the menu.
author: Lauren L.

description: I love this restaurant. Parking can be a pain, but it's worth circling for awhile. The bread and pastas are super good, and the chicken saltimbocca is great.
author: Dean C.

description:
Three star for the food. Average Italian. Two stars when price taken into account and push it up half a star for good service. 
I haven't eaten a lot of Italian in SF so can't compare it to the competition here but wouldn't fly in NYC or other cities I've eaten Italian eg San Diego. Mama Mia.
author: Rajash S.

description:
Lovely place! Lovely service, owner, food. Just lovely!

INSALATA ROMANA - Organic arugula, radicchio, gorgonzola, toasted almonds in house dressing. We had it with Parmesan instead of blue cheese. Delicious!! I think it's my favorite salad I've ever had to date!

PIZZA AI FUNGHI CON OLIO DI TARTUFO - Mozzarella, fontina, mushrooms, white truffle oil. Fresh shitake mushrooms. Mmm! Mushrooms galore! So good! If you like your pizza loaded with shitake and truffle infused oil, you're going to be in heaven when you take a bite of this pizza!

GNOCCHI ALLA BOSCAIOLA - Homemade gnocchi w/ mushrooms, Italian sausage, parmigiano & a touch of white truffle oil. OMG. Where to start with this one. If you're looking for authentic, fresh made gnocchi, try this dish. It was seriously the best potato pasta I've ever had. I was full before starting with the salad but I finished my half. I had a slice of the mushroom pizza and was so stuffed that I didn't think I can eat much more but when the gnocchi came out, I had more than a few! It was my favorite dish!

Affogato al Caffe - Hot espresso poured over vanilla bean ice cream topped w/ freshly whipped cream. DELICIOUS!

Such warm hospitality, great ambience, and attention to the many details that make this entire dining experience one of the best that I've encountered. Most important question is will I go back? Assolutamente! ;)
author: Mayana P.

description:
Best casual Italian restaurant in SF for me!

I've loved everything here - the pastas and the pizza. We've tried a soup, gnocchi, couple of pasta dishes (rigatoni being the standout) and pizzas and all of them were very good.
author: Manjesh N.

description:
Yelp's reservation system made scheduling dinner for 5 people very convenient and simple. This was my second time at the restaurant and it was even better than the first. We arrived at 7:30pm for our reservation but the table before lingered for about 10-15 minutes after paying their bill so we had to wait a little bit. The waitress was very nice and apologetic from the beginning so it wasn't that bad. 

The service was very good. We got water and bread along with the wine we ordered, and the food came out very quickly. We ordered an assortment of pasta (the di mare with clams and mussels was my favorite) and the Contadina pizza (which has egg and asparagus on it) and they were all generously sized. Most importantly, our dinner was perfectly flavorful. Everyone enjoyed the dinner and the coziness of the restaurant made it a nice place for a family dinner.

Big thanks to the chefs and our waitress for a great experience. I am looking forward to another meal here soon.
author: Mel L.

description: The most disgusting food I've had in a while. Driest pasta with dead muscles. Good luck.
author: Art Y.

description:
Super delicious pizza! Great service. Good prices. Really enjoyed the vegetable side dishes. Nice wine menu. Cozy ambiance 
Would definitely go back for the mushroom and truffle oil pizza and the cheese and pear
author: Glam K.

description:
The food is great. The service is excellent and friendly. The ambience is relaxing and cozy. 

I would have given them 5 stars. The reason why I took out 2 stars is because of their reservation system. Two or three times out of five times when we were there, we had to wait for over 30 minutes past our reservation time. They are attentive to you while keep you waiting. But after all, they do keep you wait and wait and wait, despite your reservation. I've been there maybe ten times, some with reservations and some without. I am convinced that they operate on first come first serve. So, don't take their reservation too seriously, because they don't.
author: Julia H.

description: We had a long wait but it was worth it!! The staff were friendly and the food was AMAZING! We got the house Syrah for $5/glass and were very pleased. I ordered the gnocchi and I want to go back again today to eat it again - so yummy!! My husband got the linguine and loved it as well. It's a smaller spot but we brought our son in his stroller and they were very accommodating and made sure we were comfortable.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Fire!!!!  The pizza - margarita is a beautiful piece of art! Loved it. Perfect personal size pizza - dough and sauce are perfect!  The pasta here is also really good and you won't go wrong! Little coming to this little spot to sit and enjoy some quality food! Come give it a try you won't regret it.
author: J M.

description: Love the ambience here but my pasta dishes were pretty bad. Fettuccini w/ wild boar didn't have a great flavor, quite bland actually. Angel hair w/ 1 tiny tiny piece of crab was bland as well and just unfulfilling. Maybe their other dishes are better.
author: Justin W.

description:
Your reservation system is a joke
Seat me system is bogus. We walk into Vega for a 6:30 resv today and the hostess says open table is not working and there is a hour wait. Well you guys dont have open table, ahh don't be stupid. Then thru offer me a glass of wine with no where to stand and a 6 year old next to me. 
We came 30 Minutes to go to Vega after seeing their highlights on check please. They should be on the show "people behaving badly". 
Of course I don't expect to hear from mgt.
Be warned people don't use seat me or expect to be seated right away by this poorly run establishment.
Run a reservation system right or close down.
My two cents
author: Gary M.

description:
My friend recommended Vega some time ago so when we made plans to eat, we made an online reservation for an early weekday dinner. Vega is a cozy restaurant with dim candle lighting. Service was very friendly. It sure filled up, mostly with couples, by the time we left around 7:30pm. 

I looked over the menu online before dinner and wasn't sure what I wanted to order although everything looked good, including the pizza. I remember gnocchi Thursdays when I was studying in Rome and lo and behold, our dinner at Vega was on a Thursday. Because it was only fitting, guess what I ordered? Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola! I usually don't order pasta dishes with white sauce because I love my tomatoes but the sausage and mushroom combo sounded too good to pass up. There are gnocchi options for vegetarians and three other sauces are offered. The gnocchi was sooo delicious and fresh, and with the sausage, mushrooms, and white sauce with white truffle oil, it was hearty but heavenly. I really should have eaten only half the dish but it was too hard to not finish it. I was definitely stuffed from the dish and the good glass of house white I had. I also tried some of the bread which was like bread I've had in Italy, a little bland and dense but it's simple and good for dipping in olive oil.

Next time, I'll be sure to save room for dessert!
author: Maya S.

description: Though my husband didn't like his main dish of pasta with boar ragu, everyone else liked all their food. I had a gnocchi dish with mushrooms and Italian sausage which was wonderful. Share some appetizers, especially the meatballs with polenta and the artichokes. I'd go again, and so would my husband. He liked everything else he had except for his main dish.
author: Marlene S.

description: You'll find a very pleasant, busy, welcoming environment at this small restaurant. Our meals were excellent, portions are generous, the food was served quickly, and the wait staff was pleasant and efficient. My one objection is that the tables are packed-in, but I can't blame the management for optimizing the space, because all the tables were taken when we were there and I'm sure they didn't want to turn guests away. This was our first time at Vega and we'll return.
author: Frances P.

description:
I REALLY REALLY REALLY want to give Vega 5 stars because their food is so AMAZING. Sadly...I must 

minus 1/2 star: they are so busy that service is not the best =/
minus 1/2 star: its so loud in the restaurant that you kinda sorta have to yell to be heard

I first came here about a year ago for my boyfriend's surprise birthday dinner. Good reviews on Yelp but mostly because it was named Vega and my boyfriend's last name is Vega. It turned out to be an amazing experience. We had the mushroom pizza and baked rigatoni with sausage. Yummy! The portions are pretty hefty too so we actually had leftovers. 

My boyfriend had been mentioning recently that he was craving food from Vega so we came here again a couple of days ago. I really wanted to get the mushroom pizza again because it was just THAT good but I forced myself to get something different. We ened up with the cheese and pear pizza and gnocchi alla boscaiola (with mushrooms, Italian sausage, parmigiano and a touch of white truffle oil). Both were AMAZING. I think everything on their menu must be superb. 

You can tell that they use a lot of the same ingredients because honestly the gnocchi kind of tasted like the mushroom pizza (which also has mushrooms and white truffle oil). The sausages were also the same ones that they use for the baked rigatoni. I mentioned this to my boyfriend and he said that Chef Ramsay once said on Kitchen Nightmares that a successful restaurant focuses on a few key ingredients. So I'd say they've gotten that right.

I would love to come back to Vega but maybe on another night when it's less crowded. Or maybe it's always crowded. We've only come on Wednesdays before (1/2 price on all their bottles of wine!).
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Vega Vega Vega! This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant. I would eat here everyday if I didn't care about my waistline  

The food is incredible, the vibe homey, fun and relaxed. You will most likely have to wait for a table. Making a reservation doesn't help. We've made reservations several times and we still end up waiting 30-45 min. BUT, all is forgiven for their delicious food and yummy wine. 

We always order a salad or one of their veggie sides, the rigatoni al forno (holy crap this is SOOOO GOOD), and a pizza. Lately I've been getting their gluten free crust pizza and it's phenomenal. I almost didn't want to write this review bc I'd love to keep this place to myself, but sharing is caring....
author: Carolyn C.

description: So I gave Vega another chance and got their sausage gnocchi and it was AMAZING!! Totally worth the price and I will definitely be coming back when I need this flavor filled dinner. Highly recommend this... And I've tried many places with gnocchi throughout the city!
author: Rachel B.

description: If this location wasn't so out of the way from where I live, this would be a go-to favorite Italian spot. The ambiance was incredible with dim lighting and candles. The service was also excellent, they asked if we wanted a glass of wine while we were waiting for our table! The pastas are to die for-especially the angel hair with crab. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Haley P.

description:
This is a smallish Italian restaurant with a really nice neighborhood feel and I would highly recommend making a reservation because I can tell you that everyone in this Bernal Heights neighborhood is aware of the great quality food this place dishes out.

We stared by sharing a margherita pizza which I will never do again and by this I mean I would never share again; I would get my own because this pizza was incredible. The Carpaccio did Polipo (Thinly sliced octopus, lemon juice, olive oil, arugula   for $10) is a must have. It was just plain excellent. Other incredible dishes were the spaghetti with meatballs, although the dish was light on the meatballs, and the capellini al granchio (handmade capellini with fresh Dungeness crabmeat, tomatoes, olive oil, and parsley) was excellent. I had Tiramisu for dessert and I would highly recommend it.

We felt a little rushed, and we obliged because we saw numerous people waiting and the service was really good. Overall this is a very good restaurant and I will return shortly.
author: Chocoolate I.

description:
Drove by and decided to stop for dinner. Very happy that we did.

Carciofini Ripieni: Warm Artichoke hearts, stuffed with goat cheese and wrapped with prosciutto on top of pesto and spring greens. Excellent! The artichoke hearts were soft and tender. The prosciutto was seared so it had a bite to it and the pesto/mixed green balance everything out. This is a perfectly satisfying and light appetizer.

Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola: Gnocchi with mushrooms, sausages and truffle oil. I am a gnocchi fanatic and had high hopes for this dish. My first bite was just ok. Added  some salt and I was good to go.

Pizza Margherita add sausage and 2 eggs: Greatly done pizza! Everything on the pizza was fresh and rich. The dough was thin and had a great crunch. My only complaint is the pizza was slightly warm when it was served. I was expecting something hot and bubbly.

House Wine: $5 for glass of good wine.

Complimentary Bread and Olive Oil: Bread was dense, but I think thats the authentic version.

Long wait to get seated. The waiter told us to come back in 30 mins, when we did she had no idea who we were so we had to wait another 15-20 mins for seats to clear up. Once we sat down our order was taken quickly but it took another 40 minutes for our food to come out. We didnt mind the wait so much because we were busy talking, but some people might not be as patient.

When we asked for the check they brought out their Panna Cotta desert ON THE HOUSE! I dont expect every establishment to run smoothly all the time, sometimes hiccups happens. I am happy that Vega was able to make up for the unexpected delays by giving us free dessert.

I will definitely be back to Vega's great food, romantic setting and awesome customer service.
author: Charisa N.

description:
As always, the food, wine, and service were all excellent.

The only negative is that the air in the back of the restaurant where we were seated was hot and stagnant. It was a little hot earlier in the day and since Vega, like most restaurants in San Francisco, doesn't have air conditioning it's vital that they keep ventilation moving through the restaurant. I'd suggest an exhaust fan that could pull cooler air in off the street and out through the kitchen.
author: Chris D.

description: I made reservations for 4 for 8:15 on a Saturday and ended up arriving an hour early unexpectedly as a table of 2 instead--and the staff was wonderfully accommodating. We were sat within 5-10 minutes at a lovely table outside, ordered right away, and got our dishes quickly too. The Dungeness crab salad was excellent--and we were glad to have the warm bread and olive oil straightaway as well.
author: X-topher B.

description:
Opt for this place instead of a super modern and trendy spot downtown for Italian. Came here for a post training dinner with girlfriends.

-East to find parking!
-Quaint neighborhood.
-Fantastic, small family business feeling.
-Delicious, real bread an oil before appetizers.

Our meals and the tables next to ours were great. I just wish there was more mozzarella on my Margherita pizza; but they did give me an extra bowl of basil when I asked :)
author: Zoe M.

description: Outstanding food, romantic atmosphere. We live the homemade pasta and $5 wine. This is our favorite local spot. Outdoor seating and cute vibe. Great prices and easy to make a reservation.
author: Ashley K.

description:
Such a shame to have to give this place 2 stars because their Minestrone soup might be the best I've ever had!  

The service is where this place is really lacking.  There are not a lot of tables in the place so it can get crowded pretty easily.  However, with 2 waiters or waitresses, service should be on point.  Sadly, it was not.  

But the nail in the coffin for me was getting my to go container.  I ordered a pizza and only had 2 pieces, which left 2/3 of the pie.  I asked to have it boxed and a very small box was brought back to my table along with the check.  I thought for sure that there was a mix up because there is no way that 4 slices of pizza would fit into here.  Boy was I wrong!  It had been smashed and folded into this small box.  What a waste.
author: Meaghan N.

description: It's a cute litte space in Bernal Heights and the food is really good! I had their pizza, really enjoy their selection of wine.
author: Tiff W.

description:
We had a dinner here about a month ago, and it was such a comedy of errors, it took me awhile to have the time to write this.

We made a reservation, but had to wait over an hour past the reservation time. There were other people in the same situation, but it shouldn't have happened.

When we finally did get seated, it took awhile for anyone to come over and take drink orders. 

Now the real fun begins...

The owner (who waits tables and runs food ) brought out my husband's soup and was juggling a bottle of beer. He dropped the beer in the soup, splashing the entire table and floor, and would have drenched us if we hadn't moved so fast.
He then acted like it was no big deal, and seemed annoyed that I backed away from the table so fast. I understand accidents happen, but at least be apologetic about it.
Beer washes out, but i didn't want be in damp clothing for my entire meal.

He didn't make much effort to clean it up.I used my napkin, and a busser came much later and replaced the table settings. He seemed really surprised no one had even cleared and wiped the table. The owner actually seemed annoyed when he came back, and questioned me as to why i had new silverware. Umm, because everything was wet, and I had no napkin due to my attempt to clean up the mess you made.

We figured the soup would be brought out immediately.Since it's already made, how long can it take? Especially after the messy incident?
It took a long time, and the food took quite awhile too.

We shared a margherita pizza, and wild boar ragu. Both were fine, but we were really annoyed and really hungry by the time it came. 

When we were done with our food, and had each had a drink, the owner shows up again and offers us another drink. Neither of wanted it, as we had also had a cocktail somewhere earlier.
We would have preferred he just comp the drinks we already had. 

I can see how this is a great neighborhood spot, but the entire experience was so bad, we couldn't wait to get out of there, and wouldn't return.
author: Amanda G.

description: The food here is so amazing. I would have given this place 5 stars but it seems every time my husband an I come here we get terrible service. On our last visit we had reservations  and the staff sat us right next to door. We asked if we could move and one of the waitresses told us we could move to one of the tables in the back. Once we moved  the other waiter practically yelled at us telling us we could not sit there. It was a terrible experience but the food is excellent.
author: S A.

description: This is our reliable neighborhood go-to spot and it didn't fail us this time, either. Service is always warm, friendly, and efficient. We shared a lovely green salad with candied nuts and citrus - yum! We also split the octopus over white beans. The octopus was perfect - the beans were a bit undercooked so we left those over. My mom had a terrific seafood risotto; my wife had gnocchi boscaiola, our daughter had gnocchi with pesto, and I had the puttanesca. Perfect flavor balances all around. if I hadn't been saving myself for dessert, I wouldn't have taken any home. But then I would have had delicious leftovers! Two of us had pannacotta, my mom had tiramisu, and our daughter had the ice cream sandwich. After a perfect decaf cappuccino, we rolled our full bellies up the hill to our home. Cheerful environment, with lots of lively conversations all around. Thanks, Vega!
author: Esther L.

description: The place is small and intimate and the food is delicious! Authentic Italian. Great place for a date night. Also, our server knew her wine! And helped us decide what would go best with our meal. Definitely coming back next time I'm in SF!!
author: Jocelyn A.

description: We had the Halibut and really enjoyed it..just delicious! Highly recommend!
author: LM B.

description:
To me, every opportunity to eat in the city is golden, thus, I was slightly disappointed by Vega. 

While any city restaurant has limited space, at Vega I was physically uncomfortable--Pressed between the wall, my neighbor and someone sitting at the table behind us. It was literally a struggle to just get in to the chair. Additionally, another person at my table expressed that she was rubbed on the arm by everyone that passed by our table. 

I was also disappointed by the food. We had the pizza with mushroom and truffle oil and it was ok--extremely oily however. We also had the Riggatoni which tasted no better than a pasta I would make at home with sauce from a jar. The third thing we ordered was the Pizza Vegetariana, which also sounded better than it actually tasted. 

Service was neutral.
author: Anila Y.

description:
I thought Vega was A-OK.

On the plus side, we were seated immediately and greeted by smiles, quick service and a very romantic/cozy ambiance. The place is intimate and dim-lighted, a perfect recipe for getting in the mood. Prices are also fair, coming out to an even $60 for a good amount of food.

On the down side, the food was not as good as we'd hoped. Every bite of our octopus carpaccio seemed to have sand in it and the tomato sauce used in the gnocchi tasted as if it had come straight from a Safeway can.

Our other appetizer, the meatballs and fried polenta, was descent, and the calamari with cannellini beans was good.

Overall, great atmosphere with good service but food that didn't quite meet our (admittedly high) expectations.
author: Teiki K.

description:
I came here on a Monday night with my friend/ coworker, before some apartment hunting. I apparently came here on a good night, because typically for dinner it's quite busy.  A very cute, small, intimate restaurant. Our waitress was super sweet.

We both ordered wine and shared an appetizer and pizza. For our appetizer we ordered the prosciutto wrapped artichoke hearts with pesto and i forgot what kind of cheese. There were 4 pieces that came and in the middle was a yummy salad. Light, refreshing and good tasting dressing.  For our pizza we had the truffle and mushrooms. Oh my gosh. Ok, first anything with truffle is usually pretty good. But this thin crusted delight was so yummy. 

I was definitely happy, satisfied and impressed with our dishes. A little hidden gem in bernal heights. The next time I visit my friend or are in the area, I will definitely keep this on my list of places to visit and hope to try more of their yummy dishes!
author: Remy-Anne V.

description: Great neighborhood italian place! I love their food, and you don't have to wait hours in line to get a table.
author: Sal R.

description: I love Vega. It has great Italian food, especially the rigatoni al forno, and it has a great wine list, with half price bottles on Wednesdays. Also the olive oil that they serve with their bread is particularly delicious. The space is cozy and charming, and the staff is very friendly. Many of the patrons are locals from the neighborhood, but I've also struck up conversations with people from other parts of the city (it's the kind of friendly place where chatting with people at the next table just feels natural).
author: Eve A.

description:
This was Valentina up until a few months ago, a fact that I greeted with a relative shrug since it never moved up my significant wait list of want-to-try dining destinations. I rarely go up Cortland, which is a shame since it is a charming section of Bernal Heights with an almost Mayberry-like allure of small town quaintness. From what I can tell, Vega is quite an upgrade to the previous operation even though it's still a compact place. In fact, Jamie W. and I had to be seated at the only table in the iddy-biddy bar section. I kept getting grazed by the waitstaff as they sped by with dishes to serve in the main dining room. 

The menu offers a solid though predictable selection of items, but the execution is definitely above average. I started with the $10 Insalata Della Casa, a nice spring greens mix with shaved parmigiano and a lot of sweetness - pink grapefruit, pears, candied walnuts - with just a minimum of citrus vinaigrette thrown in, a wise move as I wasn't in the mood for dessert right away (see photo). Jamie went right for the $11 Pizza Margherita, which was nicely turned with a lightly crisp crust, definitely a house specialty (see photo). Our main pasta course was quite tasty twists on basic spaghetti. Jamie ordered the $14 Spaghetti Carbonara, which was not nearly as heavy as I would have expected (see photo).

In just the right portion for the carbs involved, it definitely had the eggs but also pancetta instead of bacon and a light dousing of pecorino and parmigiano. Mine was definitely different, the $16 Spaghetti al Granchio, a tomato-based pasta with the chunks of fresh tomato nicely balancing the dungeness crab complemented by capers and parsley (see photo). My one slight suggestion on this dish is to undercut the cumulative sweetness of the crab and tomatoes with something more savory, perhaps anchovies. We shared a dessert, the $7 Affrogato, which is a shot of espresso drowning a scoop of ice cream, all topped off by whipped cream and a dusting of cocoa powder (see photo). It was light enough to be satisfying though it appears to be more of an afterthought on the menu here. 

FOOD - 4 stars...solid Italian fare medium-priced and well executed with fresh ingredients 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...still small and tight but in a neighborhood way 
SERVICE - 4 stars...fine (though we had the advantage of being 12 feet away from the kitchen) 
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely worth a return to Bernal Heights
author: Ed U.

description:
This is a really good neighborhood Italian restaurant! We were a party of 5 including 2 children with an early reservation. The salads were fresh, the meatball with polenta appetizer was delicious, and both the chicken and the halibut entrees were excellent. The kids also loved the pizza. Pasta dishes here are also very good.The service is neighborhood friendly and terrific too.
It is worth the trip to charming Bernal Heights!
author: Howard Z.

description: I really wanted to like this place...but the chicken I ordered was swimming in a white cream sauce that over powered the entire dish..It was heavy and the vegies were soggy and also drowning in the sauce..and while I felt fine after the meal..I woke up later on in the evening and threw up the entire dish. On that note.. I cannot recommend this restaurant...Food was heavy handed...
author: Stacy I.

description: Worst experience in SF in 5 years.  Had reservations at 8 pm.  At 9 pm still not seated. Paged us from a bar at 815 pm too.  Service is atrocious.
author: Keith R.

description: We came here on a Saturday night around 8:30pm because of how close it was to our AirBnB in Bernal Heights.  We were seated pretty quickly considering it's small, we didn't have reservations and it was busy.  The food was delicious and we loved the atmosphere - an energetic buzz in a cozy, intimate space.  Minus one star for the service - I can see why other reviewers were confused when walking in, as we were barely greeted and I can imagine if there were more people waiting we wouldn't have known what to do as there wasn't a clear hostess stand.  Additionally, it felt a little bit like they were trying to get us in and out - our waitress jumped straight to "Are you ready to order?" without so much as a hello.  We did appreciate that while we waited for a table they took our wine order so we had something to sip on while we waited.  Overall, if we lived in the area we'd definitely come back!
author: Courtney H.

description:
Oh the nerve of this place.

First off we had a reservation for 8:30pm. We arrive ten minutes prior, you know proper restaurant etiquette. We didn't get seated until 9pm. If we would've wanted to eat at 9 we would've reserved for 9pm. 

We decided to come here because it was a friend's birthday. We bought a cake prior to coming to the restaurant because we didn't want to buy a cake here. As soon as they saw the cake, they took it immediately and said "we have to cut it for you." We thought it was a friendly gesture, but low and behold we get a service charge for $2 per person. They should've informed us that they were going to charge us because then we wouldn't have let them cut the cake. If they were going to charge us a service charge at least seat us on time.

Besides the server Leo, because he was great, the rest of the servers were pretentious. And the food was aiight. If I could give zero stars I would.
author: Evan C.

description:
Finally, a true neighborhood restaurant!
Went there with my family (5 of us) and we all liked what we ordered. Service was excellent, too: prompt and courteous.
Things we liked best: the octopus carpaccio and the orecchiette con cime di rapa (orecchiette pasta with broccoli rabe), the latter probably the best I've ever had!
Portions are very generous, I had enough leftovers for lunch the following day.
What I liked besides the food is the feeling of un-pretentiousness: they serve very good food at a honest price and make you feel welcome. They have a glass of house Syrah for $5 which I think is terrific value. 
I wish I lived closer to it, but I'll definitely go back again.
author: Stefano A.

description:
The pizza with fontina, funghi, and white truffle oil -- get it and put it in your belly. So, so good. Muuuch better in the restaurant vs. Carry out. The gnocchi is to die for. We've been to Vega about a half dozen times and order the truffle pizza as an appetizer. Eat half and take the other half home for a lunchtime treat. Sprinkled with crushed red pepper. Yeah, baby! Not a healthy plan, but a good plan nonetheless. 

The dining room is tight and always packed. Nice dim mood lighting so it feels more intimate that you'd expect to feel in a small, crowded room. Great wine. Great service. The servers we've had have all been real professionals that know the menu items and make valuable recommendations. A terrific date spot. Make a res so you don't get stuck in the kitchen or the awkward little table right inside the door. There's also one or two little bistro tables just outside on the sidewalk. They make a lovely place to eat and enjoy a bottle of wine.
author: Hannah O.

description:
Wife and I chose Vega for our Anniversary dinner. We love it because of the local neighborhood, intimate setting. Though our kids are grown and we've no grandkids (yet) we like the fact it's very kid friendly. Oh, and the food? Scumptious! The portions are "take home leftovers for tomorrow's lunch" size.
We tried the Carciofini Ripieni, warm artichoke hearts stuffed with a creamy goat cheese wrapped with prosciutto and topped with pesto. Insalata Romana topped with gorgonzola.
author: Julian S.

description:
If you are hungry this is the place to come to for dinner. Located on the charming Cortland Avenue in Bernal Heights this Italian joint serves up incredibly large portions that we had to question if dishes were meant to be shared family style. 

I had the Orecchiette sautéed w/ broccoli rabe, garlic & chilli flakes topped w/ pecorino romano. Despite the large plate I finished the entire thing. The hubs had the wild boar ragu Pappardelle. He couldn't finish the plate so we took it home. 

Nothing fancy about this restaurant. Just solid, good, Italian food. Prices might be on the steep side but they make it up for it with the portions.
author: Esther A.

description:
Finally discovered Vega and in my neighborhood too! A good find for Italian food outside of North Beach. Thanks Yelp reviewers, based on your comments my friend and I decided to go for dinner a few days ago. Ordered what others recommended - I had the linguine with  seafood, my friend the fettucine wild boar ragu, plate of spinach and shared the grilled calamari. The wild boar wasn't what i thought, it was ground meat and couldn't tell it was wild boar, overall it was tasty. Flavors were excellent. We've had grilled calamari at other restaurants but this so far is the best we've had! 

Service is very good, the owner is very gracious and the server very attentive, always coming by to be sure dinner was going well. We have found our "go to" restaurant and will be back. In fact going tonight with 2 girlfriends
author: alice n.

description:
Loved it.  Walked in on a Thursday around 9pm, only had a 10min wait for three.  Good ambiance, felt similar to little spots in Italy.  

Got the minestrone which was herbier than those I've had before but it was good.  Also had the gnocchi della casa with the fontina/gorgonzola sauce.  I can't believe how tasty it was (I love strong cheeses).  The gnocchi themselves were perfectly soft but not mushy.  

Had some gelato for dessert (served as a few scoops).
author: Katie C.

description:
this was my first time at vega it hurts me to write a review like this because my entree meal was fabulous, but my experience was lack luster. 

i got invited to vega for a birthday dinner. we were one of the first parties to arrive for dinner... the sever did a fine job at accommodating some of our dietary needs, she even double checked with the kitchen a few times and came back to us, but the problem was she just wasn't friendly at all. kind of a very cool personality? it was perplexing why she wasnt more openly nice and friendly to us, maybe she was having an off night, just not my typical experience eating Italian fare- the bus boy was very friendly. but the service left me feeling disappointed for days. especially given it was a special birthday meal for me... the food was pretty damn good but i couldn't bring myself to love this place because the server just didnt meet my expectations of being friendly and inviting. for example, while she entertained my questions ... she just seemed like she was inconvenienced by our presence. it wasn't welcoming. like she would answer one question and then disappear, like she decided we weren't ready to order so she was just going to come back later... uh i had more questions... left me feeling very meh.

when it comes to the food, everything was fresh... arugula salad was delicious and the portion was generous. The swordfish was seriously one of the best things I ate in a very long time, even though it was a little too heavy on the tomatoes for my taste, this is Italian after all. i would give this place another shot for the food but who knows what server you will get.
author: Coco J.

description: Just walked in with our baby and waited to be seated or at least greeted.  They had many tables open.  Two different ladies looked at me straight in the eye deliberately ignoring me not once but a couple times.  We felt like they purposely ignored us because maybe we had a baby? So rude never coming again.
author: Cherrie L.

description: Gnocchi is delicious and freshly made. Pizza is ok, not the best. Main dishes are ver good also. Cozy and warm with great service and meals are served promptly. A weeknight favourite.
author: C W.

description: The pasta here is by far as fresh as my Nonna used to make daily. I highly recommend the Parpadelle with the beef fed grass gravy (tomato sauce)! The ambiance is nice. Last time I went with a friend, we actually ended up becoming new friends with the couple next to our table and we ended up sampling each other's food. The tables are very close to each other so you can't help but interact with one another. Tuesday's are great if you have little ones who like real pizza, since it's cheaper that day/night. I recommend always getting a reservation as they can be quite packed! There is no hard liquor served, but the wine list is endless. Also no soda so it will have to be water or Peligrino for the little ones! It's local, fresh, and the wait staff warm, and friendly!
author: Jeanine C.

description:
Dined here for the first time last weekend and I think this restaurant will definitely make it onto our "go-to" list. Ambiance was warm and cozy, and the place was hopping at the dinner hour. Service was excellent, and everything was delicious especially the calamari appetizer. 

I have *one* but of negative feedback which will not prevent us from returning. We happened to sit at the two top right next to the bathroom area. There was one unisex bathroom and every time someone went to use the bathroom (at least every few minutes) we got a gaping view of the toilet. My husband kept trying to close the curtain/partition that attempts to separate the dining area from this area but it kept getting whipped open. We spent much of our meal trying to decide what could be done about this, and didn't have any ideas that did not include removing that table completely which is obviously not ideal.

Anyhow, a really nice experience overall and we will absolutely return.
author: Anne Y.

description: This place is great. Half priced wine night on Wednesdays and it's always such a great local, neighborhood-y place. Love it.
author: susan c.

description: Food is good here don't get me wrong, but when someone tells me that there are no available seat and there are three open tables I call their bluff. Just because I am not with anyone doesn't mean I shouldn't get a seat. Not cool.
author: A F.

description:
Still love Vega... Absolutely the best food in the hood. From start to finish, Giuseppe provides value and outstanding service. Limoncello is house made and is a wonderful way to finish a meal.

My recent faves:
Minestrone - heaven by the spoon
Insalata Ricca and Della Casa - fiber never has been more enjoyable
Pizza Capriccosia - all about prosciutto and egg - an OMG moment
Pizza Caprese - Buffalo Mozzarella with Heirloom Tomatoes, simple and yummy
Costolette Di Maiale  Al Sugo - every pork rib wishes for this moment, bathed in tomato and served on a bed of exquisite polenta.

Great wine list, staff and service!
author: Steve S.

description: The BEST Italian food I have had in this country. For a moment there, I felt like I was in Italy...
author: Jens L.

description: Consistent food.  Good portion sizes.  Yummy balsamic dressing.  This place gets PACKED, with lines out the door and down the sidewalk.  Make reservations!
author: Eva B.

description: Wanted a place for our anniversary. Saw the reviews of this place and wanted to try since it's so close to our house. I called them 1 hour and 30 mins ahead to ensure that they have table available for two at 8pm. A guy in the restaurant picked up the phone and he didn't ask my name nor phone number, just told us to come and it should be fine. I thought it was sort of weird but thought they might not take reservation. My husband & I went in about 7:50pm. The manager who greeted us asked if we had a reservation. I explained to him the situation, and he told us to wait for maybe 15 mins. We waited for 30 mins, but was not seated. There were a few tables open and when I asked if we could be seated the manager said those tables were reserved but no one was waiting. So we walked out and went to the one in West Portal who truly deserves 5 stars and serves us right away. The food from the photos on Yelp looks good, but the way they managed the restaurant was very disappointing. Will NOT come again and will not recommend to friends.
author: Gogo W.

description:
Great little Italian restaurant. Most everything is homemade. The four people in out party each had a different mean and each one was raving by the end. If you are in the area, this is an amazing place at a very reasonable price. 

One note...there is not a lot of seating. Things get crowded quickly. My recommendation is to go a little early so you don't have to wait.
author: Jon P.

description:
this review is not for the food, which is great, this is for the service. don't make a reservation here if you have after dinner plans, or a life for that matter. I made one (called right at opening) for 8pm on a Saturday and was not seated until nearly 9pm. the manager(?) was completely dismissive and didn't care at all that a reservation was made and would barely communicate back when we questioned the wait time (which should have been nothing). I have come here multiple times and the food is without a doubt 5 stars, but I can't say that I'll be back after that last debacle.

after reading the reviews I realized this problem with reservations is an ongoing trend. If you're so worried about filling your tables and you cannot honor your reservations then stop taking them!! simple solution. Also, I don't know if the man running the front of house is the owner or manager or what, but if he isn't the owner then the owners should really look into replacing him with someone more personable, and if he is the owner, you're an a**hole.
author: Some B.

description:
My new favorite spot.  Love this place!  The Gnocchi alla Boscaiola was absolutely amazing.  The pizza and homemade sausage are just like my family makes - authentic and delicious.  Great quality olive oil and parmigiano.  Warm and friendly staff and cozy atmosphere.  

I sum up this place as authentic Italian food at its best, offering healthy dishes and comfort food as well.  

Will be returning soon!
author: Cassandra F.

description:
- Wednesday night a few months ago, all bottles of wine 50% off. Ordered a bottle of Montepulciano d'Abruzzo to share. 

- Pasta (pappardelle with wild boar) was delicious. Pasta was handmade, al dente. Boar was tender, sauce flavorful. 

- Margherita pizza: It was okay. Granted, I prefer a certain style of pizza, and their take on the margherita wasn't my favorite.

- Tiramisu. Mmm....the last time I had tiramisu this good was at Steps of Rome cafe several years ago. 

Summary: Excellent pasta and tiramisu, bottles of wine half off on Wednesday.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
Giuseppe and Vega are the perfect hosts! Love their energy and enthusiasm!
You can feel the Italian vibe in every corner of this gem in Bernal Heights!
Food is outstanding and you can tell how fresh the ingredients are.

A must-try: Gnocchi alla Boscaiola (you can even request the vegeterian version if you don't eat meat) and Roasted polenta w/melted fontina cheese.

I reccommend making a reservation since the dining area is very small but so cozy!

Next time will be pizza time!
author: MT M.

description: This place is terrific! They have a great and reasonably priced wine list and tons of delicious food options. FYI, they have half price bottles of wine on Wednesday night. I think vega really shines in two areas... their pastas and their entrees. In particular, their gnocchi with sausage and mushrooms and roasted fish of the day are spectacular. My husband and I nearly always get both dishes and split them. The only thing I've had here that was disappointing was a side dish of polenta with cheese on it. It was dry and bland, and they took it back without any fuss. They don't take reservations but it's usually not hard to get a table within 10-15 minutes. This is definitely a neighborhood gem.
author: Diana G.

description: I recently joined a friend for a light supper at Vega.  It was a delight.  We shared a simple dinner of the Pizza Capricciosa with their house chardonnay at $5.00 glass.  It was a delightful meal at an amazing value.  Will definitely return to try other menu choices.  Highly recommend.
author: Terry A.

description:
Had a starter salad that was well dressed and the wild boar ragu which was tasty. The pizza was sad - overcooked and laden with cheese but sparse with the toppings and more greasy than anything.

Ambience was lacking with our two person table packed in, three inches gap on one side and ten inches on the other. Hard to have a private conversation when you're closer to your neighbors than your partner.

Seated 20 minutes after reservation and service continued to be slow. Won't be returning.
author: Alexander R.

description: Cute little neighborhood restaurant. We had reservations and got seated within 5 min. The food was super yummy and the house wine was good! We would definitely go back to try more things :p
author: Jessica B.

description:
Vega was introduced to me by my girlfriend who surprised me on our anniversary. I was not familiar with the restaurant and was surprised to see how busy they were. It's a small place so expect to hear multiple conversations including young children. We ordered the mushroom pizza as an appetizer which was absolutely delicious. We also ordered the meatballs with baked polenta. The polenta was made perfectly and had a great combination of textures. I really enjoyed the crispy melted cheese that came through underneath their amazing home made tomato sauce. We wanted to
Try more of the menu so we boxed up half of the pizza and ordered entrees. My girlfriend ordered the the chicken entree which came wrapped in cheese and prosciutto. It may have been my favorite dish. I got the spaghetti which was a popular favorite amongst the other diners. I really enjoyed the olives, capers with a sardine finish. The wine pairings were great as well as the service. Our Busser came by multiple times and checked in on us. We ended with cappuccinos and the flourless chocolate cake which was amazing. It was safe to say we were stuffed! We left with a ton of left overs which I'm looking forward to eating right now!
author: Rodney D.

description: 5 stars for their olive oil and their mushroom truffle pizza! Their on the pricey side when it comes to their entrees but I think for the food that you are getting it's reasonable enough. I wished I'd ask the name of the olive oil they use because its the best I've ever had and I actually hate olives! Their lamb was ok but will most definitely come back for their gnocchi and pizzas they were the stars!
author: Mara G.

description: We had four people came here for dinner on Sunday night after Pride. I ordered the mushroom pizza and my husband had the gnocchi.The pizza was very flavorful even though it's mostly vegetarian. My husband gnocchi with Italian sausage was so wonderful that I cleaned the plate with additional helping of the bread. It reminded me of what Italy tasted like. Definitely will want to be back again when we visit our friends.
author: Tommy W.

description:
I came here after work on a week day and was seating right in front of the window. 
:-) I just love those tables. Perfect for enjoying a meal and peple watching. 

The Pizza was fantastic! I enjoyed the PIZZA  CAPRICCIOSA - Homemade tomato sauce, mozzarella, prosciutto, artichoke, mushrooms, egg  $15

... and for dessert had the Affogato al Caffe - Hot espresso poured over vanilla bean ice cream topped w/ freshly whipped cream

The server was fun, and super cool. I can't wait to go back!
author: Charliena B.

description: There are some top-tier places that you take your out-of-town friends or dates to show off (though you could care less to return to), and then there are some places that leave you with such deep impressions that you want them all to yourself (and keep them as your dirty little secrets). Vega falls in the latter. Too bad it is such a romantic, intimate, and cozy spot that it is a sin to not to share it with your loved ones. I have been here on several occasions and have never been disappointed by their service, food, or delivery. Psst. The capellini with crab meat is the most highly addicting thing you will ever experience. But you didn't hear that from me. Shh!
author: Camie K.

description: 4+ Stars:  Delicious food, very very good.  Service was courteous and fast too.  We had to wait about 20 min for our reservation and it's a little cramped seating area but that's ok.  We loved it and will definitely return.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
After being whisked away by my date on his motorcycle, we stopped in front of Vega. My glasses refused to fit back onto my face after I put the helmet on so I was blind the entire ride there. Neither of us had any idea what neighborhood we were in but I had a feeling it was Bernal Heights considering its the one nice neighborhood by my house. 

The restaurant is so fucking cute! If I lived in Bernal Heights, I can imagine becoming a regular here. It looks like one of those nice neighborhood restaurants one could only dream about. Its warm and cozy and our waiter was not only nice, but he was gorgeous. All 6'4 of him. Mmmmmmmmm. I think the people who work here actually speak Italian too. My date made reservations but I don't think they were necessary. We got there at 8 on a Monday night but the restaurant did fill up at one point. 

My date and I decided to get a pizza and pasta dish. We got the mushroom and truffle oil pizza and the crab pasta. The pizza was definitely worth five stars. It was covered in truffle oil and was even better than the mushroom truffle pizza I had at ZeroZero the week before. The pasta was probably only three stars. It was alright but I didn't like the pasta to sauce ratio. Also I thought the waiter could've offered some parmesan to put over the pasta. 

The portions are really big and we had a ton of leftovers. Every dish I saw served to the surrounding tables looked amazing too! The dessert menu was kind of meh but we got the ice cream sandwich and it ended up being really good. Far exceeded both our expectations. My date said the cookie tasted like a chocolate chip cookie without the chocolate chips haha.  Extremely reasonable prices for the quality of food and the portions. I also tried Moscatto for the first time and it straight up tastes like juice. Me gusta. I am definitely coming back as soon as I can.
author: Tiffany V.

description: This place was recommended to us and it was fantastic. We had no reservation but showed up close to 5 pm and they were able to accommodate our party of 6 ( lucky!) This is a warm, cozy neighborhood restaurant.  Wine recommendations were fantastic as was  the pizza, pasta, gnocchi, chicken, and salmon! Some great choices for the kids too.  Kids loved the ice cream sandwich dessert! The service was wonderful and friendly. We would visit again next time in town for sure!
author: Lisa P.

description: Wonderful food. Small place with excellent service.  The gnocchi was great!  We will go back
author: Eric M.

description:
We've heard good things about this place and finally made it in as our friend, Roberto, works here on Saturday.

A quaint little place - love the deep red walls that give the place a warm and homey ambiance.  

Besides the regular menu, the day's special is offered on a separate piece of paper.  

What we had:

2007 Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 'Valle d'Oro' Cantine Tollo Abruzzo - $8 

2006 Valpolicella Ripasso Montresor Veneto - $9

Grilled local, fresh calamari on a bed of organic cannellini beans -  $12 - the calamari was tender.

Pizza Capricciosa - homemade tomato sauce, mozzarella, prosciutto, artichoke, mushrooms, egg - $15 - the toppings are separated taking 1/3 space eachwith an over easy egg in the middle.  The crust was thin and the toppings complimented one another really well and everything taste better with an egg!

Panna Cotta - buttermilk panna cotta made w/ fresh lemon zest topped w/ fresh strawberry sauce - $7 - this was compimentary.  It was smooth and creamy with a nice lemon flavor.
author: Gloria H.

description:
My boyfriend and I love this quite and quaint Italian restaurant in one of my favorite neighborhoods in SF. Vega is very romantic and perfect for a date night, but they are also kid friendly considering it's in Bernal which is a baby booming neighborhood. 

Everything I've had is delicious, from the salads to the pastas to the pizzas. You can't go wrong with this place if you enjoy good Italian food. Support local businesses!!
author: Molly A.

description: Went there yesterday made reservations for 7pm for 4 guests came 10 minutes early waited until 7:40 to be seated and another 40 minutes for food to arrive. Place is very noisy. The food is excellent and service is good when you finally get a table.  not really my kinda food.  Metered street parking on very busy street. Was not my first time there.
author: Sergei Z.

description: This has become my favorite Italian restaurant in SF! Food, atmosphere, service are all superb. I would recommend making reservations during Friday-Sunday dinner hours. It's a small place that seems like it seats less than 50 people inside. On a lovely evening it would be great to have dinner out front. EVERYTHING is delicious and portions are "real"! Tab approx $35 per person (appetizer, salad, entree, beverage).
author: Lissette I.

description:
Go early. Cozy and intimate. Killer food.

We split a warm pesto appetizer, spicy sausage gnocchi, and each had a glass of prosecco. 
Since it's a very intimate space, we sat at the window and watched the people line up waiting for a table. From what I understand, they are always busy, and I understand why. 

Super romantic and food that is absolutely out of this world delicious.
author: Caddy M.

description:
So many great reviews, such disappointing food and service. I ordered a couple of pizzas and salads and thought, "how could I go wrong?".  

Food is just not thoughtfully prepared.  Pizza not much better than a frozen Pizza from Safeway.  Salads pretend to be unique and are disgusting. Ingredients not fresh Mediocre fair and at a high price.  I'm NEVER going back and I live in the neighborhood.

Don't be fooled by 3+ star reviews.  NOT a neighborhood gem, NOT fit for foodies, NOT good.
author: Jana C.

description:
This is about the pizza at Vega. . I'm a huge thin-crust pizza fan, so I came here for their pizza. Definitely, their ingredients are top notch, high quality and fresh, and the flavors were stellar. What I didn't get was their crust... Literally! Their crust on the pizza was so paper thin I felt like I was getting some awesome ingredients on top of a soaked cracker! Like hello? where is the crust? Each slice would basically wilt down... it would be soggy because the crust was thinner than a lavosh. 
BUT, we did have two salads there and they were both quite plentiful and delicious. The customer service was great there. This restaurant is definitely worth a try since all the other dishes looked quite superb. Just DON'T come here for the pizza!
author: Luna R.

description:
Everyone, take your date here now. It won't break your bank, the food is good (and portions are large), and the house red is amazing and only $5/ glass. I kid you not. 

I'm not a foodie, but the atmosphere is superb and will make a date night seem effortless. 

Also, I was there on a Tuesday. Best Tuesday I ever spent.
author: Beatrice S.

description:
Really really enjoyed this place.

Pros:

-Intimate, romantic setting
-Candlelit tables
-Fresh ingredients
-Pizza is 100% authentic and completely Italian made (arugula with poached egg on top)
-Rest of the offerings were amazing (tip:  try the octupus prosciutto!)
-Jazz playing in background
-Nice two person table near window outlooking the street
-Neighborhood is pretty mellow at night

Cons:

-Can be hard to get a table (go late at night)
-Snobby and annoying wino type patrons
-Might be hard to find parking; again, go late at night
-Longer wait for food, but realize this is Italian style and everything is made fresh/from scratch
author: Matvei L.

description:
Loved loved loved the capellini with Dungeness crab and tomato. The pasta was super flavorful and cooked al dente. I liked that they weren't stingy with the crab - it perfectly complemented the tomato sauce. The dish actually had quite a bit of broth in it, which really brought out the flavor overall. 

I wish they had more wine options by the glass and that the place was slightly more well lit. It was a bit hard to see the menu and my boyfriend. 

The portions were very sizable, which made the already reasonable prices a steal in San Francisco. Homey, cozy, and intimate, with friendly and efficient service. Vega is a no-frills restaurant with substance. Goes to show you don't need trendy furniture and decor to make a place yummy - just a solid wine list and some really well-cooked food!
author: Brandy A.

description: Loved this place.  Great food, wonderful staff.  A perfect fit with the Cortland Avenue vibe.
author: Dennis S.

description:
**RESERVATIONS NOT HONORED

This was not my first time here, but it was my last. 

They don't honor reservations and the host is an outright lier. Arriving on time for our reservation, we were told that a table was just getting ready to leave, and we were offered a glass of wine. About a half hour later, another party of the same size that arrived after us was seated ahead of us without a reservation. 

We would not have accepted the wine or waited there 45 minutes past our reservation if we knew it was not going to be honored. The wine should have been comped. The food was good, but not good enough to make me forget that we had been lied to. 

Read the other reviews and you will see that this was not a mistake or a one-time occurrence. The host cares only keeping the tables full. Avoid this place!
author: David S.

description:
Tiny family-owned place. Pretty slow service. Complimentary bread.. meh. The place is tiny, and ridiculously loud.

With all the Italian options around SF, I feel like my expectations have grown a bit. The pizza and pasta I had was mediocre at best, and I prefer the tiramisu at CPK.

Sorry Vega!
author: Jess C.

description:
Found this place after walking through Bernal Heights one day. Excellent place for pizza and wine!

Got 2 appetizers: the artichokes stuffed with goat cheese and rolled with prosciutto, and Dungeness crab with avocado and lettuce. Both excellent! Actually I didn't have the 'chokes 'cause I don't like goat cheese. Yes I'm weird like that.

Also got the pizza rustica and it was great! Crust was crispy, the toppings of guanciale and chile pepper made it flavorful yet not overwhelmingly spicy. Got a bottle of Sangiovese to go with it and it was a good fit.

It's a bit cramp inside sadly. Service was great! Definitely will come back to try more of the pizzas.
author: Josh O.

description: Absolutely delicious little restaurant. Their gnocchi is out of this world. Try the sausage gnocchi.
author: Nic B.

description: Second time here in 2 years and food still delights with every bite!! Neighborhood gem.  Fungi pizza with white truffle oil is wonderful!  Great staff.
author: Nancy L.

description:
This review is primarily for the Rigatoni Al Forno.

I just ate here over the weekend, which was one of countless times I have been to Vega. We dine here regularly because the food is usually great, the service is amazing, and the ambiance is warm. 

This time, however, was a different experience. The food was very off. Normally, you can taste the homemade love that's put into the pasta sauce. When I ordered the Rigatoni (which was the first time I've had it here), the sauce was terrible. Though we waited for at least 30 minutes for a table and I was super hungry, I couldn't eat more than a couple of bites. The sauce reminded me of the thick, pasty, bland, ketchup-like stuff in Chef Boyardee. Disgusting. And disappointing.

It seems that as this great spot has increased in popularity, the ingredients have decreased in quality. It is tomato season after all!

Also beware that "fresh" Dungeness crab isn't exactly fresh when it's been frozen since Dungeness crab season closed months ago.

I still give two stars: one for the wonderful staff and owners, and one for the lovely feeling of eating in the comfort of someone's inviting home.

I'm sad to say that I most likely won't be going back to Vega on my own volition...not when I can make better pasta at home :(
author: Melissa M.

description:
Very lucky to have this cozy Italian spot in my neighborhood. The truffle sausage gnocchi is to die for. Pizzas are great. Haven't had a bad dish here. Service is on point.

Mangia!
author: Christina G.

description:
I've been to Vega twice now. Once back in April and once in June. 

The food is amazing! In particular my favorite was the braised shortribs with polenta. Also, the pizza is really good.

The first time we went here we had a reservation and ended up waiting over half an hour for our table but the service was great and it made up for the wait.

I will definitely be back.
author: Karina P.

description:
Vega for our Saturday night out to try more of their delicious delights!  Our second visit to Vega put us at the window counter with a fun view of the street at night and the enjoyable people passing by and/or waiting their turn for a scrumptious dinner.  To start, a full bodied red Barbera d'Alba (or two--so good) to welcome what would be an exceptional evening of appetizers and entrees.  We shared two appetizers, the grilled calamari and the clams and mussels with grilled toasts.  Both were out of the world good--I want that calamari every day! with a delicious sauce and a simple hint of lemon-so, so, so good!

We also shared two pasta dishes, the baked rigatoni with everything you would expect and super hot out of the oven and the pappardelle al ragu --lamb, pork and beef in a rich and lovely sauce spiced to perfection!

PS  loved to complimentary bread and super olive oil--both were perfect for wetting the appetite.

Fab food, good service!  We will be back, soon, for sure.

We missed dessert due to the very large portions and our need to try four dishes.  Next outing, we'll share an appetizer and entree and try the desserts!!!  Reservation please!

Thumbs way up on this Saturday night dinner delight!  A real pleasure!
author: Jeff P.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night - with a reservation - and had an absolutely amazing experience.  This place is always crowded, so I recommend reservations.  The Margherita pizza was heavenly, as was the the homemade gnocchi. The vibe is warm - dark and intimate.... feels like a hidden cafe in Rome.  Service was great.  
Bernal heights gem!
author: Kim W.

description:
First impression / service = 1 Star
Food = 5 stars

We tried Vega on Sunday, May 31.  We had been out shopping that day and Yelp showed that it opened at 4pm. We arrived at 4:30 pm. A server was sitting by the front door and was occupied with her phone.  We approached her and asked for a table for 3. She promptly let us know that they were not open yet and that they open at 5pm.  We mentioned that Yelp indicated that they open at 4pm. The response was, Yelp is wrong. We told her we'd be back at 5pm.  We took this opportunity to have cocktails at a bar near by. We went back to Vega at 4:59 pm.  The server immediately asked if we had a reservation. We said, no. She let us know that they were fully committed & couldn't seat us. Are you kidding me? The restaurant was empty.  We were shocked she didn't mention this to us at 4:30 pm when we first arrived. I promptly went to Yelp and booked a 5:30 pm reservation and told her we'd be back in a half hour. The server was visibly annoyed and agreed to seat us at 5 pm. When we left at 6:30 pm there were still two 4 tops available.  It was such an odd experience.  

The food was absolutely outstanding.  And the service improved once we were seated. I intend to give it another try someday.
author: Leslie D.

description:
MOUTH WATERING, incredible, impressive, yummmmm. Ommmmgggg my friends and I got pick up tonight.. We ordered the special crustinis with buratta cheese tomatoes and arugula, the gnocchi with truffle oil and Italian sausage, pesto gnocchi, and the chicken with prosciutto. 
We were all so incredible happy. With Italian food especially I am a snob, but this place does not let down. I so will be back, but next time to sit down for my dinner :) also the olive oil and bread is great!
author: Kayla C.
