description:
We came by last Friday and there seemed to be something wrong with the oven. Smoke filled the little front room we were sitting in and I literally ended up crying throughout my meal!! At one point I had to go outside b/c my streaming tears and stinging eyes needed a break. As we were finishing up our entrees we were offered to move into the main dining room which we gladly accepted. The server in the new section (blond lady) seemed very unhappy of our new placement: a) asked us if we needed boxes instead of inquiring if we'd like to order anything else b) never came back to check on us (we ended up ordering desert and espresso by calling up our previous server) c) placed our check on the table before we started our deserts

I would have let all this slide because the food was AMAZING but I received no apology or empathy for my painful smoky experience... and with so many great restaurants in the bay area when you drop $100, you expect a certain level of service.
author: Katya s.

description: Vega is a charming family run business with delicious Italian food, wonderful staff, and a friendly dining atmosphere.
author: Brittany R.

description:
Ok in bernal vega is our only Italian place.
It's really good!Their pizzas,the pasta and all if great.
It's just the food can take up to 30 minutes to 1 hour.Thankfully they give you bread with olive oil as a free apatizer.Food is great but the wait is what kills my 5 star rating.Friendly staff and nice and cozy!
I would go if I want to have a fancy bernal meal!
author: Bob L.

description:
We had seen Vega on Check Please and it looked like a really cool place so we checked it out this past weekend when we were in the neighborhood.  The place is pretty small so be prepared to wait even if you have a reservation at a specific time.  The wait staff was pretty friendly.  We started off sharing the Insalata Della Casa salad followed by the pancetta and patate pizza and the gnocchi della casa.  The salad was nice and refreshing and the pizza was really tasty and I even had enough to take home for leftovers.  My wife had the gnocchi and she really enjoyed it as well.

Bernal Heights is a great neighborhood and Vega is a nice Italian place there.
author: Blake B.

description: Came here for dinner on Saturday evening.   Great ambience (incredibly romantic).  Wonderful, rustic food and wine menu. Terrific food.  Huge portions.  And oh, so reasonable.  Hidden gem.  Highly recommended.
author: Vijay R.

description:
We were in the neigborhood and just walked in.  Glad we did.   Pizza and salad only but the food was very good, fresh, tasty.  The service was also very good.  Nice friendly people.  

I'll go back.
author: Drew M.

description: We love this little restaurant and frequent it quite often. Half off wine Wednesdays coupled with their amazing food...you can't go wrong!
author: Niloc C.

description: Had the mushroom pizza with truffle oil-AMAZING. Also had a terrific gluten free crust that was cooked well. The stuffed artichokes were tasty as was the crab appetizer with endives. Knocked off a star for the flour-less chocolate torte which was disappointing and the house petite syrah which was too dry and tart. Everything else was great so we'll be back.
author: Shalana M.

description:
I really enjoyed the food, but the service was a bit slow and inattentive.  

The Pizza Margherita was really good, especially with the added prosciutto.  We also enjoyed the Capellini with dungeness crab (there was plenty of crab).  The minestrone was nice and chunky with plenty of flavor.  

I've been here a twice and each time, it took a few minutes before anybody acknowledged my party and I standing there at the front door.  The place was busy both times, but the staff walked by us several times on each occasion.  When seated, I found myself looking around for a server to take our order for several minutes.
author: Brandon L.

description: I have to give a 4 star as this place is a cute little pizza place in  my neighborhood, so I'm biased. The food is pretty good, at least I have tried all the vegetarian pizzas - can't comment on the meat options. The wine selection is not remotely good. The wait times can be super long and sometimes the hostess can even forget to greet you as they are in a rush, but overall the food deserves a 4 star.
author: Ram A.

description:
I adore this gem in Bernal. 
I have returned multiple times on various evenings and have never been disappointed.

I suggest reservations, as I have almost always experienced a wait otherwise. That being said, they are efficient with the turnover....which is surprising to me since I usually want to linger in the comforting space for hours.

My absolute favorite is the Pizza Broccoli& Salsiccia, though every dish I have experienced has been impeccable.
author: Nic H.

description:
Came here For Valentine's Day Dinner.  I made reservation a week in advance as they usually have a long wait time.  

The place is very small but nice atmosphere along with very nice and friendly staff.

They came to our table to check up on us to make sure our food was good and if not they will fix it which i found really reassuring for a customer satisfaction point of view.

We order a pizza that had a cooked egg in it which was really good....but don't remember the name of it.

Their appetizer and lobster ravioli was pretty good also.

Overall, nice evening for a perfect date.
author: Steven C.

description: Food was really good. Especially the Squid appetizers. Main courses are huge and recommend their Spaghetti.
author: Bobby L.

description:
This is my go-to restaurant in the city. It works for a romantic evening out for 2 or a casual dinner with friends for 4. Service is terrific, price is very reasonable, and the ambiance always just right -- on the intimate side, but still with a gentle background buzz from all the other (happy) patrons. LOVE this place. Love it. 

I came here with my girlfriend on a Saturday night on short notice. Like an idiot, I'd suggested first that we go try to wait for a table at the Cheesecake Factory in Union Square after we'd done some holiday shopping. The wait? 1.5 hours... JUST TO GET A PAGER. And then, another hour after that, for a total of 2.5 hours. Needless to say, we looked elsewhere.

I'd been saving a dinner at Vega for a date night but decided to give the restaurant a call anyway to see if they could seat us quickly. Two rings and the host picked up, and he quoted 15 minutes. We got there -- found easy parking nearby, like almost always -- and ended up waiting exactly 15 minutes, just as we were told. We enjoyed a glass Italian wine suggested by the staff which was terrific, and then we sat down for our meal.

The food is here is terrific every time. Very straightforward Italian fare, everything under $20, everything fresh. We shared a pizza carpaccio (generous with the mushrooms and prosciutto) and -- my favorite -- the dungeness crab capellini. The pasta's simply wonderful, a fresh-tossed blend of capellini, chopped tomatoes and a light tomato sauce, garlic, olive oil, parsley, and plenty of crab meat. At $18 I still think it's one of the great bargain entrees in the city.

And the service! It's a small restaurant, so I suppose it isn't surprising that there are plenty of staff people checking up on each table, but what was most remarkable was how warm each person was. The host, the server, the busboy -- to a (wo)man, everyone smiled and asked how we were enjoying ourselves. We couldn't have had a better meal.

I still consider this a hidden gem, and I hope it stays hidden, great reviews notwithstanding!
author: Albert L.

description: The service was okay, and the ambiance/vibe of the place is nice, however the food should be rated with less than a star! We ordered the Margherita and Veggie Pizza along with the Rigatoni. I know my food and what I am tasting. Costco uses better ingredients on their pizza than Vega, really. The Margherita had a very poor quality Mozza and there were little tiny pieces of tasteless basil. The crust at Papa Johns puts the quality of this crust to shame. The Veg pizza was mostly mushrooms with really low quality olives. The Rigatoni was was made with such obvious canned tomato that it reminded me of eating something from a school lunch when I was a kid. The crappy cheese they used also reminded me of this. The whole dish tasted mostly like Ketchup. I wish I could give more stars because the people were not mean in any way but the way they prepare food is kind of mean.
author: Neil W.

description: We had reservations at 8:30 and came right on time. The woman seating us was extremely rude and seemed put out even though the restaurant was half full. The vegetarian pizza was basically a salad of bitter arugula on overly oily crust. The pasta with crab tasted like the floor of a seafood market. I asked to speak to a manager and the rude hostess replied ' it's basically us', and pointed to the restaurant staff. The owners need to reconsider their staff if they expect to maintain a quality establishment. Overall it was entirely unpleasant. The bread was 2 day old stale as well. It appears the owners stopped caring about the food in 2003. Olive Garden is a step up.
author: Ronald B.

description:
Having seen this restaurant on Check Please Bay Area, we had to investigate.  They are on open table, but we were going pretty late on a Saturday night so figured we did not need a reservation. We were able to walk in, and got a nice table near the window immediately.  The menu looked simply fabulous, and we had a hard time deciding what we wanted.  My one problem with traditional Italian restaurants is I have to point at the menu... I cannot pronounce anything to order it. 

We settled on sharing an app, and then splitting a pizza and a pasta.  This was plenty of food for the two of us. 

They brought us wonderful bread and olive oil.  The bread was dense and almost doughy and was a perfect start.  Its always nice to get bread and olive oil to start, and not having to ask.  They brought plenty, but we were hungry and refilled our bread without a problem. 

For our appetizer we got CARCIOFINI RIPIENI, per the menu this is described as "Warmed artichoke hearts stuffed w/ goat cheese, wrapped in Prosciutto di Parma, pesto and mixed greens." I describe this as "OH MY F** GOOD GOD".  Wow.  Out of this world.  Something I have never had, in a flavor combination that was spectacular and well balanced.  Nothing stood out, the flavors all just went well together. If I had any complaints it would would be too small to share for more than 2 people. 

For our entrees we split the PIZZA BRESAOLA & RUGHETTA and GNOCCHI ALLA BOSCAIOLA.  The pizza was perfect.  Perfect Naples style pizza. The flavors were awesome, the bresaola was some of the best I have ever had and it was topped with an arugula salad that was yummy and worked with the pizza.

The Gnocchi was wonderful.  Perfect little pillows of love that were so tender and delicate but stood up to the mushroom and sausage sauce. 

The desserts looked fabulous, but had no room for it.  We took our left overs home.  They wrapped them for us, which is such a nice touch.  I hate when you have left overs and they just hand you a box.  It is such a nice touch of service when they take your plates and wrap your items in the back and present them nicely to you.

On that though, the pizza was delicious in the morning, however the gnocchi did not reheat well.  We would have been better powering through dinner and eating all we could rather than take some home.  Totally not their fault though...

If you go, definitely order family style so you have multiple tastes.  I cannot wait to go back.

Only two downfalls is 1) its in Bernal Heights, someplace that I normally don't go or have a reason to hang out it. and 2) no fountain soda.  While I didnt need soda, we got prosecco, but for the most part, my general rule is: No fountain soda, No 5 star.
author: David P.

description: I really enjoy the food here but they need to fix their reservation system (this is the third time my yelp seat me reservation hasn't gone through), and not get annoyed when you want to add to your table. It's a great restaurant but they are just making it too hard to go back and recommend it...
author: Jo D.

description: Seated 30 minutes after our reservation time without an apology (in fact, somewhat of a rude tone by hostess when we asked when we would be seated). Reading other reviews, it looks like they regularly don't honor reservation times.  Pizza crust was oddly thick and biscuity, meatballs were lackluster and the crab pasta was a bit fishy. Highlights were the pillowy gnocchi and the toasted polenta that came with the meatballs. Used to be a neighborhood favorite but has gone downhill. Sad.
author: Jonathan R.

description: We really enjoyed ourselves last night. When we got there the table was waiting for the four of us and we were seated on time. The place was full - it was a Saturday night. It was freezing outside but the place was radiating warmth (literally and otherwise ;). The bottle of wine that our server helped us select was good and our pasta dishes were delicious. I had pasta de frutti de mare and the dish was big enough for take home the leftovers. I loved the alfogato desert even though having coffee at 10:30 pm was probably not the smartest decision of the night. ;)   Overall, a very successful outing. :)
author: ania w.

description:
This is a 3.5 star but couldn't go up to 4. Service throughout was top notch.

I had the gnocchi in tomato sauce.  Gnocchi itself was perfect.  The tomato sauce on it was really, really, really sweet which ruined the dish for me.  Husband had the pappardelle and liked it.

Will give it another try.
author: Ottis M.

description: The food at Vega is consistently good. We've enjoyed two of the pizzas: the Contadina with pancetta, mushrooms, fontina and a fried egg, and the Broccoli & Salsiccia, with broccoli rabe and Italian sausage. The salads are good. The not-quite-traiditional minestrone  is also very good, though it has a bit too much pesto. The grilled sardines are REALLY good--not to be missed if you like sardines. The pasta dishes look very good, and we look forward to trying them on a future visit. The only downside is the sometimes frenetic pace of the waitstaff as they try to stay on top of the orders in the room and large number of take out orders they also have to handle. Like its sister restaurant across the street, the dining room could use at least one more staff person. (Oh, and minus half a star for not being on Open Table.) I'd give 3- 1/2 stars if I could, but in this case, I'm rounding down.
author: David K.

description: There was 8 of us and Vega was awesome!  The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable. The food is soooo good. We all ordered something different and were all pleased with our orders. I highly recommend Vega. It's tiny, so I'd make a reservation, especially on the weekends.
author: Julie P.

description:
My fiancee and I went here for a spur of the moment date while back in SF for a few days. There was a two top open at 8:30 on a Saturday night. We were very pleased.

Our neighbors were loud and probably drunk but we saw they had the check so we decided to stay. Our waitress was warm and helpful. The ambience was a bit loud and the bench not super comfortable but it was intimate and romantic, not boisterous.

I got very excited about the stuffed artichoke hearts but, as a vegetarian, expected they were premade and I wouldn't be able to order them because of the prosciutto. I was very happily wrong! They were the beginning of a constantly awesome meal. Truly delicious.

My fiancee and I ordered the asparagus and egg pizza without pancetta. I asked for some lemon to squeeze over it. Truly the best pizza I have ever had. We also got the gnocchi Della something or other with fontina and Gorgonzola. Nathan though it had too much black pepper but I thought it was perfect. Honestly it was all too much food but we were happy to have leftovers. The bread and olive oil were divine too. My only real complaint was I wished for colder water.

One of the best meals of my life!
author: Denali D.

description: I came here on the recommendation of a friend, and now I think I owe her a bottle of wine.  This was simply the best Italian I can remember ever eating. The gnocchi a la boscaiola was simply exquisite,  smoky and rich with a perfect texture. The meatballs were amazing,  with a rich, slightly sweet sauce. The amazing food, together with excellent service, great atmosphere, and reasonable prices, is a stunning combination.
author: Robert K.

description: Disappointed this time around. Appetizers: Octopus had no flavor whatsoever. Meatballs in red sauce were very generic, not to mention they were out of the Polenta it was suppose to come with, substituting spinach which did not make sense. How can you be out of Polenta very early in the evening? Funghi Pizza was good. Gnocchi with  funghi and sausage ok but had too much sausage, not enough funghi and not as good as prior visit. Desserts were just ok. Strange, they do not carry "cream or half and half" for coffee. We're   Italian...know what good italian food should be like and this restaurant failed.  I don't think we will return.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: Super delightful. Wonderful front of house. Generous appetizers. Great pasta and pizza for the price.
author: Lis C.

description: Cozy little neighborhood place. Get the crab appetizer (with endives, avocado and cucumber). Our server Carolina was wonderful - we will be requesting her next time we go!
author: Scott E.

description: Vega is delicious and delightful! The cozy, romantic atmosphere is such a treat. I especially love the Capellini Al Grancio and the Saltimbocca Alla Romana. Can't wait to go back!
author: Kim R.

description: Bland food. Charged our party $35 to cut a birthday cake that we bought and brought in. We didn't even ask to have it cut. They charge for every single thing it's ridiculous. The service was not that great either. Don't come here.
author: Josh M.

description: The pizza was amazing.  I got the margarita but the dessert ( ice cream sandwich) could use some help. Ice cream tasted like it had freezer burn    However the pizza was good enough to still give her 4 stars.
author: Danny G.

description:
I've been to Vega twice now-the first time almost a year back-and I can't believe I have yet to review this amazing spot. I went to Vega for my birthday dinner last year, and was oh-so-happy with the food and ambience.  I returned last week and was once again blown away. I then promised myself that I would visit more often, as I now realize it is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city.

I love Vega's surrounding neighborhood in Bernal Heights.  The restaurant is small which creates a great vibe and has just the right touch of exclusivity. The atmosphere is perfect for a special occasion, date night, or just because you absolutely love this place like I do. The service is so excellent that you feel as if you are friends with the waiters and owner. 

And now the main event, the food.  The Pizza al Funghi is such an amazing experience, I can't even describe it in words.  I've also loved the rigatoni and the saltimbocca. I think every SFer must get out to Vega and check it out for themselves!
author: Bridget B.

description: Came here on a Saturday night with a group of three adults and one teenager. We were seated right away, but I had made sure to made reservations! The owner was extremely nice and went through the menu with us.. the hubby ordered the veggie gnocchi, the teenager had the meat gnocchi, I had the risotto and our friend had the rigatoni. All in all everyone enjoyed their main course. We also split the insalata Romana between two of us which was a good call for the size of the meal. Also we had the tiramisu. The service was great and the food was pretty good too. Go if you're in the area.
author: Carolina S.

description: So, the food here is VERY good BUT you must make a reservation and even if you do, be prepared to wait. This happened once to us and I thought it might have been a one time thing, but sure enough it happened the second time too. They seem to get overwhelmed when the place gets busy and things get a little hectic. I even noticed they seated a walk in party before us even though we had a reservation.  I watched several people who did not have reservations wait a LONG time.
author: Clive L.

description:
This review is primarily written for the rigatoni al forno, as it is the only thing I've ever managed to eat in this restaurant. Because it is so good.

So good it evoked pleasant childhood memories of sitting in the kitchen as my loving Italian grandmother cooked big family dinners, even though my actual grandmother is Jewish and not very friendly and the most exciting thing she's ever made is gefilte fish.

So good it made me want to simultaneously hoard extra portions in my fridge so no one else could have any and share it with everyone because something so amazing cannot be kept secret.

So good it made me realize that pasta, sauce and cheese absolutely can be worth $16.

Just. So. Good.

Also, the waiters are very attentive, the atmosphere is great and I've somehow never experienced a wait, although I would definitely recommend a reservation because this place gets busy.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Such a nice cozy out of the way restaurant. Saw it on television program Check Please. It was well worth going there. We had no reservations and it was a Tuesday night so we were seated right away. We ordered insalate de casa, very good. My husband ordered seafood pasta and he said it was outstanding. I ordered the gnocchi with sausage, mushrooms and truffle oil, absolutely delicious. The wait for the dinner was almost 1 hour. The owner came and apologized and gave each of us 2 glasses of liquor. Can barely wait to go back to this quaint restaurant and try everything on the menu!!  What a hit.
author: Anna-Marie C.

description: Decent pasta in a cozy place. Spaghetti a la putanesca was a little bit too much spicy for my taste but it was well made. The onwers seem to be Italian, which means a lot.
author: Marcos L.

description: I don't know why there is always a wait for this restaurant. Perhaps because we have limited options on Cortland, of which 1/3 are owned by the same people, Vega included. But I have yet to be impressed with a meal here. On our last visit here we were given burnt toast points to accompany the mussels/clams dish and the portion of seafood was rather small. I've tried the pappardelle and i've never seen pappardelle noodles so wide (they looked like lasagna noodles). The result was a giant clump of noodles sticking together with some bland sauce on top. They only good dish i've had here is the gnocchi but it isn't enough to bring me back again. Crossing this one off my list.
author: Fawn P.

description:
small intimate restaurant (which means tightly packed tables)

bread was a bit too crusty and hard for my taste

gnocchi was a bit salty and was the brisket

the pizza was alright
author: Long C.

description: This is one of the best authentic Italian pizzas I've had in a long time. The ambiance is great, I was here recently and our experience was excellent. Our server, Luca, was very knowledgeable about food and wine; he made great recommendations, and really made our night special. If you're looking for great food and exceptional service, this is a great choice.
author: Janet V.

description: food is very good! location is even cuter. service is a little slow, but not unbearable.
author: Julia K.

description: Cozy, intimate setting. Friendly service. Great wine selection by the glass. The pizzas are yummy and fresh with lots of creative combinations. The pastas are yummy. I really enjoyed the tomato basil gnocchi. I just moved to this wonderful neighborhood and expect to be frequenting this place quite a bit!
author: Allison N.

description:
We came here for dessert and drinks and had a really lovely time. 

First of all, there aren't many restaurants that are really OK with folks coming in just for dessert and drinks at 6 PM on a Sunday. Props to Vega for that. 

Second, the drinks and desserts were really very tasty. 

I had a glass of prosecco and a homemade ice cream sandwich. The prosecco wasn't dry, as described, but was tasty nonetheless. The ice cream sandwich was made of some sort of caramelized crust -- it reminded me of a to-the-next-level version of a graham cracker crust. Tasty, buttery, probably full of calories. There was a thin layer of homemade vanilla gelato, and the dessert was covered wtih caramel and chocolate sauce. YUM. 

My boyfriend had an americano (very good) and panna cotta. The panna cotta had a nice lemon flavor, and tasted light and smooth. Very good. Next time, we'll have to go for dinner. They have half-price wine bottles on Wednesdays.
author: Tom P.

description: Best baked rigatoni of my life. Get it with veggies. It has an amazing smoked flavor and delicious baked cheese on top that's crispy on the edges. Yum!
author: Alex S.

description: Absolutely wonderful place! The gnocchi with the sausage and truffle oil is incredible. Seriously awesome salads and pizza. The owner is so friendly and the dining experience is intimate. I spent my birthday here and brought my family- it was just perfect! Always a pleasure to dine here.
author: Steph P.

description: Amazing place for food, but if you want it to be more romantic, this might not be the place. The food is very delicious, everything tastes just right.
author: Alex C.

description: I love their atmosphere, staff, and amazing food! I had the four cheese pizza with pears on top, and it was splendid! It's a very cozy environment, and everything about this place is very sweet. They have a decent wine list and the prices were great too! Great date night spot or a nice place to take any family member to.
author: Kim M.

description:
I had been here once or twice before and really enjoyed it.  But on my most recent visit, we ended up walking out of this restaurant and won't be back again.

I had a gift certificate that gave us $25 off when we spent $35 on food and/or drink.  We showed up and it was SUPER busy  and were told (somewhat rudely - in retrospect it seemed they would rather we give up on eating there) it was probably an hour wait.  That was fine, we went to Stray Bar and nursed a beer for a while.  When we came back and inquired about the status, the manager/owner? looked at me unhappily and made the "metza metz" hand gesture, indicating he didn't know how much longer the wait would be.  I took a seat at the bar and soon after our table was ready.

We looked over everything, realized it was Wednesday and the wine was half-off a bottle.  We presented the gift certificate to our waiter (before ordering, as per the instructions), and then ordered two entrees and a bottle of wine.  He came back shortly and said that they could not give us the gift certificate AND a bottle of wine at half off, so I asked if we could order more food to get to the $35 limit, and then take the bottle at the half-off price (there was no fine print on our certificate about Wednesdays, or other specials, just that it was only valid Sun - Thurs).  He went to check, and the manger/owner came back and explained the issue, and I again offered to purchase an additional appetizer to hit the limit and get a bottle of wine. 

Then the truth came out - that the manager felt the restaurant was too busy to handle confirming our gift certificate at any point that night.  I pointed out he was not trying to work with us, but since we were hungry (after waiting an hour), I felt the point was moot and took back my gift certificate (annoyed, but hungry and willing to deal).

A minute later my date pointed out that they were being kind of rude to us, and we probably couldn't expect service to get any better.  I agreed, asked if she wanted to leave, and she did.  So we left.  Never to return.  Our server didn't seem surprised when I told him.  It's a shame, as after the hour wait we were not only starving, but really looking forward to the dinner.

Sorry Vega, but if you can't handle a gift certificate from two people are who are trying WAY harder to you to be reasonable, you either need to hire additional staff, or rethink your management.  In other words, don't write checks you can't cash.

We ended up at Blue Elephant where we got prompt, friendly service, and were able to order, eat, and settle the check in less time then we waited for Vega.   I still have two gift certificates that I won't be using, maybe someone else might want to try them?
author: Tmon B.

description:
Thanks to restaurant.com I got a $25 gift certificate for $1. Our only job was to order at least $35 worth of food and eat it. 

So we got a mushroom, fontina, mozzarella and truffle oil pizza for $14 and added an egg for $2 and proscuitto for $3. You've never had thin crust pizza until you've had Vega's thin crust pizza!!! Ridiculously delicate and light. We wanted to get the papperdelle, but they ran out. Must be good? Anywhoo, we asked for the servers recommendation and went with the GNOCCHI ALLA BOSCAIOLA with mushrooms, Italian sausage, parmigiano and white truffle oil which are like little pillows of heaven that just melt in your mouth for $16. All I wanted after eating this was to lay in bed and cuddle with my own pillow and blanket.

Our check came out to about $19 and this was including the mandatory 18% gratuity!!  And we got leftovers! SCORE!! Thanks restaurant.com for VEGA!!
author: Angela W.

description:
This is a quaint place tucked away in Bernal Heights. What I like about it the most (besides their decadent dishes) is the restaurants atmosphere. I happen to live in the neighborhood and often pass by at all times of the day. However, my particular favorite time is at night because you see, there is something magical and romantic that happens at Vega when the fog rolls in. So by now your dying to know right? It's simple, this little restaurant reminded me of the importance of window panes. Window Panes? Yes, Vega's Windows are what make the restaurant, without the clash of the kitchen heat and outside cool breeze and the small quarters this place would not be so cool. It reminds you of those chic flics where a guy walks by a coffee or restaurant and catches a glimpse of the love of his life through a foggy window pain, however the glare from the street lights does not allow her to see you, but you can see her...and then you right her a note and squiggle what's your name of the fogged up glass......oh geez of track of track sorry. Regardless add that to really good food, and you have a magical evening for two. Best of Luck, who knows maybe you'll meet the Love of your life there hehehehe. 

p.s Try the gnocchi, forego the broccoli pizza.
author: Lannette G.

description: I love Vega.  Always delicious.  Very few restaurants serve Broccoli Rabe, my favorite veggie.  Vega serves it with pasta or as a side.   Pizzas are crisp and light.  Salads are imaginative.  Pastas are al dente with delicious sauces.  I've probably tried most of the menu.  Other than pizza and pasta the menu is limited but the few second dishes they serve are flavorful.  The fish is served with a tomato/olive/caper sauce which is delicious and the chicken is prepared with proscuitto and cheese.  The  place is small and cozy and family friendly.  Service is warm and friendly and the prices are reasonable.
author: Jan M.

description: Had reservations at Vega for 6:00pm and was immediately seated. This was for my friend's Birthday.  The service was good. The food was good. I would go back again.
author: William W.

description:
Vega definitely exceeded my expectations. I found this restaurant based on the good reviews on yelp. We started off with one of their pizzas for an appetizer then we all had our own entree. I had the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce. The gnocchi was ok but the sauce was awesome. We also ordered the fish special which was Halibut. The fish was slightly overcooked however the overall dish was good. I don't recall what the other two ordered but their dishes were good as well. 
The kicker was that we came on a wednesday and got 1/2 off bottles of wine. We ordered 2 bottles so it was basically BOGO. Pretty cool. 
Overall I had a good time and Vega and most likely will be back.
author: D J.

description:
My wife and I ventured across town to give Vega a try after she saw their appearance on Check Please, read favorable reviews, etc.  Wish we hadn't- this may be a 4-star option in the cozy little neighborhood it is nestled into in Bernal Heights, however this is much lower from a city-wide perspective and I would not travel out of my way to dine there again.

We were able to park with ease and were seated promptly in what was a very busy evening at Vega on a Thursday night around 745pm.  The location has a nice ambience, somewhat dimly lit with candles on each table.  The effect provides a nice glow within the restaurant.  We shared a spinach salad, a margherita pizza, and a papardelle dish with porcini mushrooms.  We each enjoyed the spinach salad, which featured goat cheese, toasted walnuts, and raisins, and were eager for the next arrivals.   Though there are multiple offerings for pizza, margherita seems to be sort of the 'barometer' to gauge a restaurant's pizza, and neither of us were impressed.  The pizza was quite average, with a cracker-crisp crust edge and little flavor.  I can think of a number of better offerings, but in the grand scheme, for $11 it was not a bad value but simply nothing special.  The paparadelle porcini pasta dish was quite disappointing, greasy in appearance as it was bathed in olive and truffle oil, and simply unappetizing.  Perhaps we picked a loser from the menu and would have enjoyed the gnocchi boscaiola or another dish, but we decided to pass on dessert as we were both ready to leave after our uninspiring main courses.

On the upside, the prices were reasonable from my perspective, and the Nero D'Avola wine I enjoyed @ $8 per glass was well-valued.  Service was attentive and did a nice job.  If I lived in the area, I would surely give it another try, but having driven 20 minutes from across the city- I will pass.  I can walk 5-10 minutes  to several restaurants which I feel provide a better valued Italian meal in a similar price range such as Ristorante Milano, Pane e Vino, Via Veneto, Jackson Fillmore or A-16.
author: Andy S.

description: Got there at five and was seated immediately.  First they brought some fabulous foccacia and olive oil. Next a huge gorgeous salad with radicchio and arugula, gorgonzola dolce which was soft and creamy, toasted halved almonds, and a beautiful dressing.  Perfectly balanced.  The shitake pizza had an interesting, delicious crust. It was sublime, rich. I pretty much put myself in the wait person's hands.  She chose a Barbera for me which worked well with the pizza.  For dessert I had the buttermilk panna cotta with a strawberry sauce and the Smith Woodhouse port.  The service was exceptional; they were patient with all of my questions.  To see the menu, go to http://www.vegapizzasf.com/menu/
author: Pat P.

description: Absolutely LOVED this place. It is the perfect quaint restaurant for couples or a small dinner party. The ambiance is nice and romantic without being stuffy. We had: octopus and artichoke appetizers, and seafood linguini, spaghetti, boar rigatoni, and gnocchi entrees. All of the food was absolutely delicious, the portions were generous but not overwhelming. Although the food alone was great, I have to say the service was exceptional. Unfortunately, we were 15min late to our reservation, but they still held our table, and even greeted us at the front door by name! I forgot to mention it was my Auntie's 83rd birthday, but somehow overheard us during dinner and surprised us with a birthday dessert with a candle! Needless to say, this made my aunt so happy she declared this her new favorite restaurant. Sadly I didn't get the staff's names, but everyone was just so warm and lovely. I'll definitely be bringing everyone back here.
author: Sasha P.

description:
Great spot but i would recommend always making a reservation.  Wait times can easily be 30+ minutes if you're coming on a weekend.  I ended up waiting an additional 30 minutes even with a reservation.

It's a small spot with only a few tables - I'd guess the place fits maybe 20-25 people.  But it's intimate and warm and a great date spot.

I LOVE their mushroom pizza, light yet rich with flavor and incredibly generous with the mushrooms.  The baked rigatoni was very good as well but I think the pizza definitely is what I would order every time I come back.
author: Sean E.

description: Had a wonderful meal with excellent wine and service! Reasonable pricing and the real deal Italian food! Highly recommend!
author: Greta R.

description: Amazing service! Great food. They accommodated our kids special requests. We will definitely be going back.
author: Kwesi E.

description:
I admit, I am a creature of habit. Having established some of my favorite places in San Francisco to be in the Mission, my go-to spots normally involve some sort of brunch food, burrito, or tapa. Which, honestly, is just too bad.

I wish I visited Bernal Heights more. If Vega is any indication of the other offerings Cortland--secluded as it is--offers, I think I just may. Though I stopped by for a small bite, I thoroughly enjoyed every sip of petite syrah, every forkful of  house salad, and every crisp bite of pizza. Definitely adding Vega to the rotation!
author: Valerie C.

description: I love the gnocchi in this place!  I get hungry just thinking about it.  Definitely worth the trip to Bernal Heights.  It's quaint so it does get crowded.   To me, it just adds to its charm.
author: J C.

description: I love Vega so I probably shouldn't write this review because I don't want people to go there and make the wait for tables longer but oh well...
author: Nadia A.

description: Really cool neighborhood spot.  Helpful, friendly staff and delicious food.  Had the octopus salad, ragu and a mushroom pizza (shared them).  All of the items were so flavorful and good portioned sized.  Will definitely be back here to try more items.
author: Dilly M.

description:
Vega is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. Hands down. It's kind of hard to get to, and it's a little pricey, so I only go there for special occasions. But when I go, I'm in heaven. I've had the bass with pureed cauliflower, which was incredible. If you can remember exactly the way a meal tastes a year after eating it, I'd say that's a pretty good sign. More recently I had the baked rigatoni, which was also very delicious. I've had bites of the mushroom gnocchi, which is my fiancee's favorite dish, and it's so rich and tasty... Mmm. Vega is just the way to go. 

They also have a great wine selection, and if you decide to bring your own, their corking fee is pretty reasonable. The staff is very knowledgeable and kind- excellent service. I've also met the owner (her name is actually Vega!), and she was incredibly sweet and I almost felt a little star struck meeting her because I love her restaurant so much!! 

I definitely love love love this restaurant, and will be back many times!
author: Nina B.

description:
We love it here!  For a relaxed ambience, this neighborhood gem has great food (beyond just the pizza) and great service.

Wine list relatively limited so if wine is important for you bring your own bottle.
author: David A.

description: Vega was one was of our favorite restaurants. Every time we were in San Francisco, we would stop by Vega for dinner and always loved it. Tonight however, our expectations were not met. A new server 2 weeks into the job made our experience unpleasant. While the food was great, the server was inattentive, short and abrupt. Customer service was not on her agenda tonight. The bill was incorrect due to her lack of attention and she did not apologize for the inconvenience. Ultimately, we love Vega but this employee needs more training.
author: Bianca W.

description: The starters, especially the calamari was really delicious. The pizza (rustica) - the toppings was nice, but the dough wasn't really tasty. Wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. Salad had not enough oil but ingredients were yummy. Limoncello - it was extremely bad, to an extent I was thinking something was off with it. Had high expectations, but left with a mediocre experience.
author: Burak G.

description: On saturday night, we showed up probably 15 minutes earlier than the reservation, but we got seated right away. A casual, unpretentious, cozy place that serves very good italian food. I liked that there was no loud music, so it was easy to have conversation. This type of restaurant is hard to find these days. Highly recommended.  I was completely satisfied from appetizer to dessert (panna cotta).  House red wine ($5) was reasonable and tasted great too.
author: kazue w.

description: Why five stars? One: the food is great! Two: they're CONSISTENT. Three: great prices for quality! Four: Unpretentious environment. Five: they always make you feel special! Which is why we keep coming back, recommend them and take friends out to dinner here. Great restaurant!
author: Liz F.

description:
I don't think they want my money. When I came in and said table for one, he looked at me and shrugged and pretty much rolled his eyes. Owner was a butthole about seating me; one person. I watched couples come in and he sat them with or without reservations. He didn't update me, nothing. I left.



Owner(s): you probably shouldn't be in the front. Hire someone with a smile. Customer service. Try it.


I'll keep my money and spread the word, too.
author: Jesse R.

description:
Vega is located along a cute, quiet street in Bernal Heights, surrounded by other small shops and restaurants. Inside it is small, but cozy. The deep red dining room makes you feel like you're in someone's home rather than a restaurant.

The food was delicious - a nice mix of simple and original. We ordered the PIZZA BRESAOLA & RUGHETTA - a delicious thin crusted pizza with arugula and the most tasty, thin braesaola and shaved parmesan. We also ordered the GNOCCHI DELLA CASA, which can be served with tomato basil, pesto or gorgonzola and fontina. We went with the tomato basil - it was simply prepared, but very good. I think it could have used a little more oomph, but it was very good and we ate it all, so no real complaints! The waitstaff was very friendly, helpful and attentive.

I would definitely recommend going to Vega for a romantic dinner for two (like mine) or even a larger party (there were two birthday dinners going on that evening, too).
author: Amelia B.

description:
Disclaimer: I've only been here once and the base, margherita pizza was recommended to me. I'm also a NYC transplant, home of (in my humble opinion) what all margherita pizzas should be judged upon - Grimaldi's.

That said, I thought this was a perfectly passable pie. Crust was prepared well - just crispy enough and not too devoid of cheese and tomato.

The cheese was fine - could have been distributed a bit better, though. The sauce was a bit too sweet and tasted as if it was a blend of pre-made pizza sauce and some fresh components. "Real pizza" sauce should be prepared by hand, with fresh tomatoes and herbs, on-site.

I had a fine meal here - just felt that it was a tad bit overrated.
author: Scott H.

description: This is a cute and cozy place with friendly service and beautifully prepared food. We had the grilled calamari to start, along with the ensalada romana. Great combo, and the calimari was grilled perfectly and came in a zingy sauce. I ordered the pesce del giorno and they were more than accommodating with my no-dairy diet and gave me a generous portion of spinach instead of the cauliflower mash that normally comes with it. This dish was fab and I am looking forward to returning to Vega again soon!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
I went here last night for the first time and my date and I were very pleased with the experience. We had the grilled calamari to start. It was delicious with the sauce and beans it was served with and the portion was very generous for the price. We shared the gnocchi and the pappardelle for our main course and enjoyed both. Both of our wines were wonderful and the cozy space feels very intimate and homey. 
The shining star of the evening was the service. I'm in the industry and live here in SF and eat out for most of my meals. Both our waiter and the gentleman on support staff were perfectly on point. I can honestly say I can't remember the last time I received such great service.
Thanks Vega! We'll be back.
author: Madelyn M.

description: Food was excellent. Service was friendly with a smile and timely.  Always said yes!  Seating is cozy but it is fun speaking with the people next to you. Would definitely return and recommend trying it yourself
author: Lee G.

description:
Yes.  that is what i have to say about vega.  all the food was solid and the service was generally pretty good, too.

we had the goat cheese stuffed artichokes to start which went really well with the fresh bread they brought out.  for dinner, we shared the gnocchi with mushrooms and sausage and the mushroom pizza with white truffle oil.  SO many mushrooms on the pizza...so delicious.

i would absolutely trek all the way out to bernal heighs to eat here again.
author: Lisa C.

description: Made reservations here on a Friday at 730 , arrive at 725 told the hostess our name and what time the reservations were at she agreed. By the way we're a party of two and their was plenty of seating available then a party of six came in that also has reservations at 730 which came after us.  The host said " i spoke with you on the phone earlier , right this way ".. totally  fine,  now its 745 still waiting and a nice man sitting at the little 2 seat wine bar area asked my girlfriend if  she wanted to sit down because he wasn't using his chair, obvious of us waiting in the door way for 20 mins.  So we left and walked across the street to bernal star waited 5mins for a table and received the best buffalo burger I've ever had so thanks for message lady hostess that called at 755 , i waved from across the street.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Cozy and cute! Great pizza and wine! Tried the salami and the mushroom pizzas both good would deff go back!
author: Crystal A.

description: Fabulous food. Even though I keep ordering the catch of the day each time, I never tire of it. The portion is often more than I can eat. My son and friends ordered pesto gnocchi also fabulous. Service is just like in Italy--leisurely. A gem of Bernal.
author: Mary S.

description: They asked us to leave our name and number to call us for a table and they never called. Maybe the food is good? Who knows...
author: Munaf A.

description: As someone else has said - this is a real hidden gem...a REAL GEM.  It just happened to be near the home in which we were pet-sitting or we'd have never found it and we're certainly we did.  The Al Funghi and theBroccoli/Salsicca pizzas were delish and the neighboring table recommended that we add carmelized onion...excellent move.  And at 5$ a glass, their house Syrah was quite enjoyable...in fact all the prices are realistic yet the serving sizes ample, something that's hard to find at the trendy in-the-news locales. The coziness of the venue reminded us of New York so be prepared to (maybe) make some new friends.
author: Mb N.

description: A hidden gem in bernal heights with great fresh and authentic Italian food, will definitely be coming back!
author: Derek F.

description: Tonight's dinner at Vega was a solid 4.5 star experience. The service was attentive, food brought to the table in a timely manner, dishes were all super tasty and not over salted (an issue at many SF restos). The owners are also dedicated to organic and sustainable farming for sourcing their ingredients. And the prices are astoundingly reasonable. Brava, Vega!!
author: Sandy G.

description:
Vega has become one of my favorite neighborhood, go-to restos. When I want delicious food, warm ambiance, no fuss, and moderate prices, this is it.  I always look forward to this place!  Have tried everything from their truffle gnocci to liguini di mare.  All was delish.  And I'm typically a pretty picky eater.  My only complaint is the noise level can get kind of loud on a busy night.

You like truffles?  They got a lot of truffle infused and scented things going on here.  It's quite addicting and has a powerful aroma.  Truffle gnocci.  Mushroom pizza (delish). Basic spaghetti and meatballz.. yum!   Vega always hits the spot.

Ok, other items to note:
-Atmosphere: Cute, dimly lit neighborhood place on Bernal's main drag (only drag?).  Good for date night if you're in the hood, or any other excuse to eat delicious food at a chill place.  

-Their thin pizzas are solid.  Also, you can get the pizzas to go.  Beef stew was hearty and satisfying.
author: Caroline I.

description:
Total chill, no frills, casual, simple down to earth American style Italian, but some more authentic dishes too.  It's what La Ciccia should strive to be like (I still don't get why people rave about that place, and if you're with me on that assessment try this place out instead).  

Every dish from start to finish was dead on here, with the only 'complaint' being it's heavy on the cheeses.  Pet peeve: places that serve bread and oil with crappy bread...either don't serve it or take it up a notch.  Anyway, started with the calamari...usually I don't like this type of prep, but comparing to La Crapia this was actually memorable.  A crab pasta and flavorful rigatoni, with a side of cheesy polenta...devoured it all.  Everything was rocking, so I gave them the go ahead for a desert...bring on a affogato so I can leave no drops.  

Definitely a go to brainless local for me and the sidekick from now on.  Our other is Lupa in Noe for a similar experience and vibe.  Bill was $70 and we were stuffed with leftovers galore, if that's your thing.
author: A A.

description: Not a bad place at all. Small and intimate but a little pricey for what you get. Worth checking out but there are better Italian restaurant choices out there.
author: Kevin J.

description: The best authentic Northern Italian food in the area.  We drive from the East Bay just to come here.  They use local, fresh ingredients  and have a great wine list.  We have never had a bad meal here.
author: Gina A.

description: Saw this on "Check Please, Bay Area." Simply the best pizza ever, since spending the summer in Bologna in 1997. Their baked rigatoni with a bit (a lot) of crusty cheese was also terrific. How they can bake pasta and still have it as dente mystifies me. The place smells great, funky atmosphere but immaculate; perfectly attentive waiter. Prices are ver fair. We loved Vega and we will return! As soon as my cholesterol drops back below 280 or so.
author: Joseph D.

description:
Vega used to be Valentina's, which was my favorite restaurant in Bernal. This was my first visit under the new name and ownership and I was *very* pleasantly surprised. They have kept the menu relatively the same and still have my favorite: Quattro Formmagi Pizza with Pears and Gorgonzola, so amazing, I pretty much order it every time. SB had the pizza Pancetta e Pattate (potato and pancetta) which was also excellent.
The service was charming and attentive and the food almost seemed better than when it was Valentinas, or maybe I was just super hungry? All I know is that this time the Panna Cotta blew our minds. I'll be going back just for that.
I love that its super cozy and I am happy to see that my favorite things about this place have stayed the same (the amazing food) and things that I felt needed improvement (service was hit or miss with Valentinas) has improved significantly.
author: Catty C.

description:
I am astonished that this place has 4 stars.It was a complete disaster from the food to the service.
I ordered the pear pizza which was burnt black on the bottom and to me was not edible. My waiter was a big man who acted like he owned the place, who did not know how to serve. Vega, do yourself a favor and fire the big man on staff.
The price is too high in my opinion as well.
author: Nicoline B.

description:
A restaurant.com coupon brought me to this little gem. I hadn't heard of Vega before but the menu on the website looked amazing so I had to visit. The restaurant is small and narrow with low ceilings so if you're tall, you feel a bit large. Don't be surprised if that scene from Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory pops into your head, particularly the one where the hallway gets tinier and tinier as they keep walking down it. You get over that feeling once you're seated but the ambiance is like going back home to visit mom in the warmest most comforting way possible. 

I'm ordering you to order the Pizza Al Funghi Con Olio Di Tatufo and the Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola (Homemade gnocchi w/ mushrooms, Italian sausage, parmigiano & a touch of white truffle oil). If you don't order these, you're just a disappointment in my eyes. The pizza dough is thin crust and perfectly decorated with mushrooms, fontina, and white truffle oil (Warning, if you warm up the leftover pizza the next day it will stink up the WHOLE HOUSE. It'll smell absolutely horrible, but still taste oooh sooo gooood). The gnocchi, don't even get me started. Let's just say I had a Rachel Zoe moment. Die for that gnocchi.

So basically it's simple:
*Ladies wear your flats
*Make a reservation - the restaurant is small and can get crowded
*Order the Pizza Al Funghi Con Olio Di Tatufo and the Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola
*Bring me 

The last one is obviously optional but, just sayin'.
author: Jen Y.

description:
I went to Vega with my family on a Sunday night. We made reservations just in case, and I'm glad we did, because although the restaurant wasn't full when we arrived, there was a line out the door by the time we left.

First things first-- the food was wonderful. Eating here reminded me of the occasional Sunday dinners I had at my Italian next-door-neighbor's house when I was a kid. The portions were generous enough that the four of us shared an appetizer and three dishes and were too full to even try dessert. Our favorite dish was the braised shortribs over polenta-- the meat was so tender and flavorful. I'd also highly recommend the capellini with crabmeat; the homemade pasta was so fine my mom was almost convinced they were rice noodles. It was light and delicious and a good contrast to the richness of our other dish, the mushroom and sausage gnocchi. My picky parents who usually don't like anything non-Asian were very impressed.

The service was very attentive; our drink and food orders were taken promptly, waters were re-filled frequently, and the server checked up on us a couple times. The parking wasn't crazy by San Francisco standards. I'd definitely come back again to try their other pastas and pizzas too.
author: J C.

description: If you're a fan of red sauce Italian, this place is as good as it gets. I love the depth of flavor in their sauces, and am already craving going back again. We had salad, the meatball and polenta appetizer (so delicious, I've never liked polenta so much) and the ragu with linguini. It was a very rustic ragu with big chunks of carrots and tomatoes. Delicious, you won't be sorry.
author: Megan B.

description:
I love VEGA (before Valentina)

This is a little cosy-romantic spot up in Cortland. I live a couple of streets away so it is very convenient, but it is totally worth if you are coming from other hood in the city, wont disappoint. The service is always good, great authentic italian food, best pizzas in Bernal and a nice affordable list of wines. I like this place a lot and it offers a better dining experience than places like Delfina or Specchio in the mish. 

Make sure you make a reservation, this place is usually packed and its small.  Avoid waiting and starv-nation.

Other added values:

Wednesday : Real Deal- wine bottles half prize off  
Bank of America ATM next door
The legendary Wild Side West is across the street
author: Anaheli D.

description: It's really not that hard to keep people happy. I had planned to order three glasses of wine and a dessert over the course of the meal. I find it sad when your service is so bad, your customers cannot even spend their money. Even when the kitchen is off, over cooking both her baked pasta and my pizza, your job as a server is to help make up for that by offering good service. Stay attentive and people will spend money. Ignore them, they will leave. Not rocket science guys. Will not go back.
author: Eric H.

description:
Relatively quaint small restaurant. We only had to wait 10 minutes on a Saturday night with reservations, and several people kept apologizing. We did not encounter any problems with service.
The food was excellent! Even the simple rigatoni was delicious, with the cheeses and herbs used. Sea Bass was very good. Only fair part was the bread. It was a bit stale, and only plain olive oil to dip - would have been better with some spices in it. 
Overall, though, a great experience.
author: Randy T.

description: We live in Walnut Creek, but when we saw this on Check Please and went to try it out that very same day! We used to live in SF and I am a long time fan of the Bernal Heights area. This spot did not disappoint! So happy we tried it. The food is fantastic. It is small, a bit crowded and it can be noisy. It's not very kid friendly either, but our daughter made it work for her. We had a reservation but still had to wait 50 minutes to be seated, so keep that in mind when reserving. We would def come back again and again though. It is another SF gem to add to the list!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Vega is a smallish mom and pop kind of place in Bernal Heights.  I got there early and was seated amongst a number of families with children.  That was great as everyone seemed to enjoy the place, including the kids, and it's nice to find a family friendly venue.  

The menu is very inviting, although I found the food less so.  For example a salad of crab, cucumber, avocado, endive, lemon and chives was beautiful to behold and well-portioned.  But the crab had very little taste; the star of the plate was the avocado.

Gnocchi with mushrooms , sausage, Parmesan and truffle oil sounded inviting.  But the gnocchi were pasty and the sausage was bland. 

A main of sea bass came with black olives, tomatoes and capers on cauliflower and potato purée.  This was a success as the fish was perfectly cooked and the tomatoes and olives livened the plate. 

All in all a nice enough neighborhood spot.
author: David D.

description:
I was excited to try their pizzas, but was disappointed.
The "mushroom" pizza, only had porcini mushrooms on it, and a load of them.
And, they were not melted into the cheese, just thrown on top.  It was just overwhelming with just the porcini mushrooms because their flavor is strong. I think you should go easy on the Porcini mushrooms Vega, more is not better, and put a variety of mushrooms on it for balance. It was certainly nothing like the mushroom pizza I had in Italy...and I have had great mushroom pizza in Sonoma, so...

The second pizza was worse, because it was entirely soggy...it did have tomatoes on it, but I have had tomatoes on a pizza before without a pool of liquid below the crust...

I think that there are a few things for vega to work out, like how to make a pizza with tomatoes and fresh mozzarella without a soggy crust...it's been done before, it is possible...


Service was fine...This is a review for the pizza. Will not be returning to Vega.
Will keep looking for that excellent thin crispy crust pizza in SF.
author: Elektra T.

description:
I don't know if I've even been to Bernal Heights before and I've lived by SF practically my whole life.  Whatever.  I wasn't meant to find BH until last night because that's when we found VEGA.

A sweet, cozy little place with big flavor and hearty portions.  What an absolute delight.  Started off with the polenta topped with fontina cheese.  Please try this.  I could have left after just the appetizer alone and been 1000% happy.  But wait...there's more!  Hubby had the pizza w/mushrooms and truffle oil and was in heaven.  I had (and will continue to have) the baked rigatoni with mozz and tomato sauce.  I could barely make a dent, so I brought the rest home.  Incredible flavor but a generous amount!

It was the perfect place for our anniversary date.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  Ambiance was intimate.  LOVED IT.  We plan on having more dates at Vega.
author: sheridan r.

description:
My favorite pizza in San Francisco.

I highly recommend the Margherita pizza with an egg on top, which you may request on any pizza. If you haven't had egg on pizza, it is definitely worth trying: the egg is sufficiently cooked so you don't have to worry about salmonella, and the yolk adds a nice flavor and moisture that goes deliciously well with the thin crust.

They typically have some great specials that rival the pizzas. I recommend the minestrone appetizer special if available.

For dessert, the affogato--ice cream with a shot of espresso covered by home whipped cream--is dangerously delicious, although we once got it late, at which point the ice cream was already mostly melted.

The ambiance here is awesome: it is cozy and personal--great place for a romantic date. The price is somewhere between $$ and $$$. The service is very friendly. Not only does their pizza beat pizzas from popular spots such as Tony's, but the attitude is much more modest and intimate.
author: Quarup B.

description: Great thin crust mushroom pizza.  Cozy place with nice ambience.  Great for a couple of friends to catch up over an intimate dinner.  Wonderful add to Bernal Heights!
author: Tina T.

description: Shiitake mushroom pizza was a little weird. I wouldn't recommend it unless you just like eating a bunch of mushrooms on top of thin crust pizza dough. It was literally mushrooms and dough. The pork belly and porchetta sounded good but it was just a dense and hard fat with a tiny bit of tough meat in the middle. Nice location and servers, though. Probably won't go back.
author: Camille L.

description:
I love this place! Been here many times and brought different people. All say the same things. My favorite is the baked rigatoni. Love how you choose meat or veggie in it. They have a whole list of wine. A couple of times I had the house red wine which was good. You could most definitely get a good bottle for around 30-40 dollars. The last time I went with a few girlfriends and I had a gift certificate from Restaurant.com which was useful. Can't wait to go again. 

Sometimes service can be off and bit slow even. Sometimes I've gone here and sat down within 5 minutes with no reservations to having reservations and still waiting 10-15 minutes to be seated. It really depends.
author: Judy P.

description:
It's quite a trek to battle traffic to eat at Vega from Walnut Creek.  But the 6 of us were glad we made the trip.  

The food was delicious and service very attentive.  The ambiance was intimate and cozy.  Portions were very generous, not common for eateries with tasty foods.

Grilled calamarie cannellini was a nice option vs. a fried one.  It was lemony, tasty and healthy.

I highly recommend all homemade pasta dishes.  Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola did not disappoint.  It was very rich.  Personally I would have preferred more mushroom than sausage.  Homemade Spaghetti was the best I have had lately.  Pizza Margherita was my least favorite.  

The three desserts we had were all very good.  Panna Cotta had a  nice firm texture and yet tasted very light, and with a subtle hint of lemon.  Again, it is one of the best ones I have had in the Bay Area.  Panino Al Cioccolato and Tiramisu were both hard to resist.  

It was a wonderful dinner enjoyed by all.  I only wish there are more eateries like Vega around town.
author: Julia S.

description: This was my first time. Friends who live in Bernal Heights recommended it. I thought the food was very good and the service was friendly & efficient. I would definitely go back.
author: Randall W.

description:
Cute, cozy place. I made reservations on opentable a half hour before planning on eating here... so even though it was full when we got there (9ish pm on Friday night) it was awesome because they already had a table reserved for us. 

The waitstaff was so friendly. In general, Vega was just a very warm, inviting place. 

But anyway, on to the food: delicious! I got the pizza vegetariana because I love tomato sauce and mushrooms, but I'd definitely be interested in trying a white pizza w/ an egg on top next time... My friend got a special which was a papardelle with truffle oil and mushrooms which I had a taste of and was also excellent... but I also love truffle oil. 

I don't normally give 5 stars after my first time eating somewhere, but realistically, I'd be going here all the time if I lived closer. It's just as good as Beretta and Zero Zero, which are my two other favorite thin-crust pizzerias in SF, but with a softer atmosphere. Definitely don't recommend it for groups, but perfect for catching up with a friend.

The dessert menu looked awesome -- sadly I did not get any, but next time!
author: Richa A.

description: Ok I passed by this place a million times but never went in, until one night I saw them on Check Please Bay Area. The guy was raving about this sausage gnocchi, it looked so good on tv I just had to check it out. I went on Yelp and made a reservation through Open Table, went to the restaurant and the guy looked at me saying we don't have a reservation for you. I pulled my phone out showed him my email confirmation and he pointed out that's for tomorrow! OMG!!! SIGH...We decided to wait it out over an hour later, we were the last table to be seated, they were SUPER packed on a Sunday night weekend of Thanksgiving, aren't you people sick of eating?? why are you out and not home? The staff was super nice felt horrible we waited so long and gave us complimentary wine while we waited. So..was it worth the wait in the cold?? YES!! The gnocchi was as good as it looked on TV and it was a huge portion. I tasted my friend's pizza with the egg on top and proscuitto and mushroom and it was so good, I think it's the quality of the cheese that did it! My cousin got the paperdelle with boar meat, yum yum! Only complaint I got was from my friend who got the plain tomato sauce gnocchi, she said it lacked in flavor. To end it off Ice cream sandwich, YUM!! But what was weird I saw the photo on Yelp had 4 pieces and we only got 2 pieces, um where was he rest of our order? The tiramissu was very strong in coffee flavor, real good. Atmosphere is nice and quiet dim light, great date spot.
author: Karen T.

description: Right now, not happy. Had to wait for my reserved table, we went across street, they called, didn't leave a message, and  gave away our table. Not cool. Hopefully wont wait too long & meal will make up for it.
author: Pamela W.

description: Ooh, this place is so delicious!  And the nicest service too.  We had the pizza- highly recommend the 4 cheese (Quattro formaggi- sp?) and the Gnocchi with gorgonzola.  Totally handmade,delcious and they support the local schools.  Go here- or any of their  3 restaurants.
author: G. B.

description: It's pretty decent but I don't feel like it offers a good value- everything feels overpriced by about $3.
author: martin l.

description:
Friday night, earlyish, first time, very tasty appetizers: calamari and clams and muscles, but disappointing on the pizza: very oily funghi pizza.
nice waitress and good service.
Appalling noise levels, just too crammed and loud, wouldn't return based on that, oh and dank carpet flooring. Improve the seating and acoustic, I would then come back.
author: Anne C.

description:
The food was really tasty. I had the venison ragu with pappardelle and my husband had the four cheese pizza. Both extremely strong dishes! I didn't dock them a star because they overlooked our reservation and had us wait 15 minutes (they made up for it by comping us two glasses of wine), I took away a star because there was only one server for the entire restaurant.  Mind you, this is a really small space (10-12 tables?), but I've waited tables and I know how hectic and overwhelming it can be when you have too many tables. I'm guessing that the lack luster service our waitress gave us was because she was running the entire show herself. She looked seriously stressed.

The wonderful food will bring us back, though!
author: Emille L.

description: Vega's not only has great pizza but authentic Italian food. The gnochhi is beyond amazing. When you ask for wine suggestions you get them based on your preferences, not price. Service is warm and attentive.
author: elizabeth m.

description:
I'm reluctantly giving Vega a 5-star review, mostly due to the fact that it's menu doesn't change (keep it seasonal damnit!) 

BUT. Vega has been consistently delicious the three times I've been here. I love that it's small and has a very local customer base. As a recent Bernal transplant, it's great to have a fantastic Italian restaurant in the hood.

Everything is delicious. Really though.
author: ciara s.

description:
Went there for the 1st time this week.  Its a decent neighbourhood restaurant but honestly nothing special.  Excellent service though.  Everyone was really nice.  Unfortunately i cant say the same for the food.    we felt like there was something missing.  we didnt have anything that said WOW in our mouth.
We had the pizza and baked rigatoni pasta.    pizza was a bit better than the pasta.  the baked rigatoni was nothing special.  i can easily make this myself at home.

I'd go there again if i was in the hood, but wouldnt make a special trip for it.
author: Marcia B.

description: The food here was excellent. We ordered the prosciutto-wrapped artichoke as an appetizer - stuffed with goat cheese and served on a bed of tossed mixed greens, it was a delicious start to the meal. But the real gem was the pizza - mozzarella and Parmesan with pancetta and caramelized onion spread over the tip and an open face egg in the very middle. We requested a gluten-free crust, which is apparently made from a quinoa base and was fantastic. Easily better than standard pizza dough crusts. The whole meal far exceeded expectations - a diamond in the rough pizza restaurant in Bernal!
author: Chris S.

description:
Just recently had the pleasure of having my first meal at Vega.  We had a reservation and had to wait about 15 minutes for a table.  That's ok though because we enjoyed a nice glass of wine while we waited and the service was also kind enough to offer us a complimentary dessert.  

I think it is downright impossible to eat a meal and appetizers without taking something home.  The food was well prepared and delicious.  I will definitely be visiting this place again. 

We had one of their pizzas, which was cooked to perfection.  I will also note that it was nice and thin.
author: Gary M.

description: Gnocchi with sausage & mushrooms was nice, creamy, and tasty. Ragout pasta was undercooked.  Coffee bland. Cheese Pizza was nice.  Our server barely broke a smile.  Very cozy. The loud pop music was annoying. Overall, good, but overpriced for what you get.
author: lynns l.

description:
If you live in Bernal, walk to Vega for a solid Italian dinner. And yes, that includes you North Slope dwellers as I am among you. Christina and I returned home after an enjoyable meal.

The grilled Calamari salad was a hearty yet light starter. Take it from a guy who is generally not clamoring for Calamari, this dish is worth stepping outside of your comfort zone. I had the Ravioli of the day, a mushroom and Truffle oil dish that was awesome. One word of caution - if you're not into oil, this dish may not be for you. Me, I love the Truffle oil touch. 

The peeps are nice with the service very down to earth. OH! I highly recommend the house made ice cream sandwich - that and the Affogato - then again, I'm a dork for ice cream and espresso. 

Why didn't I give them 5 stars? A very minor thing; at $16 an entree, I feel they are a few dollars out of a reasonable price for what you get. With that said, their ingredients3 were clearly fresh across the board.

Go gets some tasty eats served up by very nice people - go to Vega.
author: Gary C.

description:
My wife and I moved to Bernal Heights 3 years ago after 10 years away from San Francisco.  The very first week we were in town we went to Vega and immediately fell in love with their food.  The next week we went back for the Wednesday night 1/2 off wine special.  We have been back every Wednesday since as it has become our favorite "date" night spot.  The food is fantastic!  We are partial to the Ricca salad, the Rigatoni with meatballs, the Carbonara (not always on the menu), the  pizza and the general feel of the place!  The owners Giuseppe and Vega are always very gracious. This is by far our favorite restaurant in the City and when we have any out of town visitors this is our "go to" place and everyone always loves it!!  

My only complaint....  They were on the TV show Check Please and now too many people know about our special date night spot.  Oh well, I guess it is worth sharing.
author: Ethan S.

description: We tried Vega for the first time last Saturday. It didn't start out well because we had to wait 35 minutes past our reservation time to be seated. But, once we sat down and the food and wine started coming we had a great time. The server (a woman) did a great job of handling our loud party of five. We stayed away from pizza and did four different pastas and the sea bass. The orecchiete and gnocchi were excellent. The minestrone soup was delicious. Also, the artichoke hearts were beyond delicious. We ended with three different desserts. Overall, I will definitely be back. But I hope they can honor reservation times better!
author: Brian J.

description: Last night I had a yummy meal per usual. However the wait staff were rude! We had 6pm reservations for 3 people. The restaurant was busy and customers are not rushed out the door which I appreciate. I don't have a problem waiting but  a party of 4 came in after we had been waiting 35 minutes and they were seated before us at a table that was the same size as ours. I pointed out this delay which seemed to only add to the negative attitude I received from the server upon arrival. I'm not sure what the host and server where upset about but being rude is inappropriate behavior.
author: Marla A.

description:
I took my fiancee out to Vega on one of her rare days off from the hospital.  For some reason Vega didn't wow me.  I am only writing this review because Yelp reminded me.  I had pizza.  My bridezilla ate pasta.  One thing that stood out was their willingness to substitute their menu according to our diet and allergies.  I am thankful for that.  I usually remember specific details on a 5 star review.  After 2 months, I barely remember anything about this place or the taste of the food (the food was good).  

Maybe it was an off day for me.  It was rainy and parking was difficult.  It may have clouded my memory bank.  

4 stars for not being able to wow me with an experience.  Food was good.  Service was great.  Will give it another try soon!!!

Thanks again Vega for being so accommodating.
author: Norm K.

description:
I made last minute reservations on Open Table on a Friday evening. There were plenty of openings, which usually makes me nervous...why is this place so NOT in demand?

When we arrived, the restaurant was about half full. The space was small and cute. Looked and felt a bit like dining in someone's living room. Wine prices were reasonable. We had a great bottle of zin for 36$. My girlfriend and I shared the Pizza Capricciosa and the Spaghetti alla Carbonara which were both amazing. You really can't go wrong putting egg on or in anything though in my opinion. 

Portion sizes were large.  Prices reasonable.

We sat near the windows which was nice to watch the passersby on such a cute, quaint street.
The server was nice and attentive. 

If you're looking for a trendy, modern place to eat. This isn't it. If you're looking to stuff yourself with great rich pasta, pizza, and wine in a very neighborhood-y restaurant and subsequently roll yourself home--you may have a winner here. I'd recommend for dining with family--parents in from out of town and the like, but not necessarily for a first date.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
The best Italian I've had in SF!  I ordered the GNOCCHI ALLA BOSCAIOLA- absolutely divine!  The gnocchi was soft and creamy, and the mushrooms and sausage had so much flavor.  And who doesn't love truffle oil?  It all blended together perfectly.  
For dessert, I had the PANINO AL CIOCCOLATO, which was like an ice cream sandwich with chocolate sauce and caramel drizzled on top.  It was soooo good!!  
The ambiance was romantic and the service was excellent!  
I've been to a dozen Italian restaurants in North Beach and they were all mediocre at best.  This is the place to go for an amazing Italian meal!
author: rose h.

description: Artichoke appetizer was delicious!  We had chicken breast with mozzarella and asparagus, pizza funghi, crab pasta, and baked rigatoni.  The pizza was the best out of all of the dishes, while the others were just ok.  The service was the best part of the meal.
author: Gabriela H.

description:
FLAGGING 

-b'coz Steve S. said so, and I trust Steve on these matters!

[prosciutto & pear  .   .   .]
author: Clifford L.

description: Stayed in the neighborhood and wanted something close by. Stumbled across Vega restaurant. It was delicious!! I had the special of the night which was halibut over mashed potatoes,capers,olives,tomatoes and sauce. I am not one that orders fish at a restaurant but this was so good I would order it again!!! The staff was very nice and it is a cute little restaurant!! Give it a try, you will most likely love it. You might have to wait a bit if they are busy, but worth it. Enjoy!!
author: Mary B.

description: Cozy, great wine options.  Had the gnocci...super delicious.  Overall great place for classic italian food.
author: Adrian N.

description:
Discovered this place on restaurant.com and decided to give it a try especially since I LOVE pizza. 

So, we got seated after a 15 minutes wait, and luckily it wasn't raining anymore. There isn't really a waiting area but out on the sidewalk. 

Ordered the insalata della casa - the pink grapefruit caught my eye. I love having salad with fruit in it. Very tasty and refreshing. 

We also ordered the gnocchi alla boscaiola - I am not even a gnocchi type of person, but this dish is amazing. I will definitely come back for the gnocchi. Sauce was flavorful and texture of gnocchi was perfect. 

For pizza, we had the broccoli and sausage - thin crust - and not bad. 

Will definitely be coming back for more using my restaurant.com coupons!
author: Willa L.

description:
