description: i was surprised how good this place is. My wife ordered the chicken saltimbocca and I oredered the cappelinnie bascaiola and both were outstanding!  We went on Kid friendly tuesday and it was a hit with the parents.  Next time, we are taking the whole family to this place!
author: N A.

description: I looooooove this joint. A very unpretentious, legit Italian place located on the quaint Cortland Ave. The staff speak Italian, people! It's a great spot for a romantic dinner for two, group outing or family dinner. Great pizza, the entrees are scrumptious and they have a solid wine list. Vega is our new go to neighborhood eateries. Check it out!
author: Shannon C.

description: The ravioli of the day was Spinach and Ricotta, and I ordered that.  Behind the front counter you could see the cooks preparing the meals, it was quite interesting to watch.  They are very attentive and got filled up pretty quick.  Since it is a small restaurant, many people came in trying to get a seat but were told to leave their phone number and they will be contacted as soon as one opened if they wanted to walk around.  I made reservations at 8:15 and arrived a bit early, although my table was not ready yet in the main dining area, I was offered a seat by the entrance if I would like to drink some wine until my table was ready.  Everyone seemed to be enjoying their meals and were complimenting the owner, I presume, on how much they enjoyed their meals.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Cute little restaurant in Bernal Heights. The decor was not to my liking, had no feel of Italy whatsoever and I thought the brick red color was just aweful. The salad and calameri dishes were good choices to start of with. The panzenella salad was a variation of the traditional and I didn't care for it. The  gnocchi with the mushrooms and the sea bass were by far the standout dishes. The vegetarian pizza was good also. The only dish that was pretty inedicble was the orchietta with brocolli rabe and garlic. The garlic was a bit burned and with the already bitter rabe it made it even more bitter. The desserts were fabulous. tiramisu and the cookie sandwhich were both a hit. I would come back if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Danielle E.

description: Really enjoyed Vega, excellent meal, good sized portions, and ambiance is quaint and not pretentious.  Good service, clean bathrooms, and good selection of wine, we had the Crab Appetizer, with Prosecco, then Jules ordered the Gnocchi with the sausage and mushrooms, omg very good, I had the Saltimbocca,wtith fresh asparagus, super wonderful sauce, had to lap that up with the bread, our friend Bill had the Lamb Ribs, over Polenta, all very good, perfectly cooked and timed perfectly, a nice red Italian vino, and voila great meal, for desert we shared the Mousse, very good, and since it was Jules' Birthday she got a candle on top...We are very happy customers, and will go again for sure soon...great neighborhood feel, love Bernal :D
author: Darrell L.

description:
Moving my 12/09 review from the Valentina page to the Vega page, as the restaurant recently changed the name.

-----------

This is the second time that we have gone to Valentina Ristorante since they changed owners a couple of months ago, and the food was incredible! 

My kids loved their margherita pizza, and my husband and I have loved every single dish that we have had so far. I especially recommend the Gnocchi alla boscaiola, so delicious!!  They also have a very nice list of Italian wines. 

The atmosphere is quaint and the flavors are very homy. I also like the fact that the owners are there at all times greeting people and coming to the tables to make sure that everything is going well. 

We will be going back again and again.
author: carmen c.

description: It's a nice little neighborhood restaurant. If it were closer, probably would come back frequently. Table bread is on the dry side. Spinach salad was decent and the goat cheese wasn't overly powerful. Had the pizza margherita but substituted bufala mozzarella instead of the regular one. Tasty, good sauce, a little salty. Thin crust whose edges were crispy, but center floppy. Seems like the only place I can get a crispy pizza all the way thru is Rome. Did not have enough basil on it. My wife had a pasta with wild boar sauce. She liked boar sauce from Capannina better, but the pasta here better. Topped it off with the homemade tiramisu. Not much to look at but tasted fine. Overall, 3.5 stars.
author: Veggie S.

description: I love Vega, the staff are great, the atmosphere rocks and the food is really good (love the quality:price ratio!), I particularly like the baked rigatoni with meatballs!  I would have given four stars because I find the Pizza to be too sweet for my taste...everyone else I know loves them so five stars it is!
author: Emma C.

description:
I miss this folks who owned this restaurant before...

It okay now, just run of the mill pizzas and pastas, nothing special.

The place itself is not as crowded as before, so it's easier to get a table (for what it's worth).
author: Roxie B.

description:
I am sorry to report that I had a horrible experience at the restaurant. I waited over 35 minutes despite having made a reservation, not given any explanation as to why we had to wait while others who have made reservations at later times were seated before us. I had assumed restaurants were about food as well as about the service. The unprofessional way we were treated at this restaurant would be among the top three worst I've experienced in my life time! 

Having seen numerous positive reviews on Yelp, I reserved a table for 3 on a Sat night. Arrived on time and waited to be seated. Waited... And waited.  In the restaurant, there were tables for 2 and tables for 4. And looking inside, I saw 2 parties of 3 seated on tables for 4. There was a table for 4 in plain sight when we walked in and I expected to be seated on that table. But for some reason, the gentleman in charge of seating us kept telling us to wait and that they were preparing a table. Another mystery was that he kept pointing to a table of 2 who were still having their desserts as "the" table we will be seated. Okay, how does he plan to fit 3 of us on a table for 2? He must have his reasons or tricks... And then the real surprise. A party of four who had a reservation 15 minutes later than ours walked in (I knew because the staff asked if they had a reservation), and they were given that very table for 4 we had expected to be seated. I just could not understand why we had to wait; is a party of 4 more valuable than a party of 3? Is a party of 3 a bad number? Wait, but then weren't there two other tables in the restaurant that 3 people were dining?

I asked a couple of times the reason for the wait, and I was answered with a mumbling about preparing a table (he kept pointing to the table of 2 who were still working on their desserts) and that the person in charge of seating (referred to as "Vega") had stepped out; hence the wait. That would not be considered a reason for the wait, rather blaming on someone else, which I am not interested at all, nor did it resolve the issue. In the end, we waited over 35 minutes and was seated at a table of 4 that had finished their meal while we waited. Based on how things went, "preparing a table" can only be interpreted as "waiting until a table of 4 who are dining" but not giving a  table for 4 that was already available. What's the point of having made a reservation?  (If it were just myself, I would have walked away, but unfortunately I was not there by myself.)

It was Saturday evening and I can understand the staff making a mistake or even being slightly negligent. But when you get zero explanation but an unintelligible mumbling and blaming of others, not a single "Thank you for waiting", not a single apology,  it really leaves a bitter taste that lasts a long while. So, I won't even try to rate the food, other than to say there is no way I could be impartial after having been treated in such an unprofessional manner.

I am very disappointed in how unprofessional the staff was. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone and I will not go back again. My only hope is that there won't be any more people that have to experience what I had to and have a perfectly fine Saturday evening ruined.
author: S Y.

description: Cute place with mostly tasty, solid Italian food. Minus one star for the oversalted salad though. The portion size was huge and the ingredients seemed fresh, but there was entirely too much salt in the dressing (and I tend to like things on the salty side). Nice wine list, with reasonably priced choices by the glass.  Good overall experience.
author: SL N.

description: My wife and I are new to bernal, and ate here a couple times.  Both times the food was great, atmosphere is mellow, prices were reasonable.   It's a nice casual date spot.
author: Josh F.

description:
We order take-out very frequently: never fails to delight, try the papardelle with boar ragout - or, if available, the eggplant rigatoni.
A delight to have Vega in the neigborhood.
author: Carel v.

description: great food, cozy vibe, lovely staff.
author: Caroline C.

description: I have given this place a few tries and overall it has been fabulous!  The calamari is out of this world even if the beans are a little too al dente.  Seriously, that appetizer is a meal and the best I have had of it's kind.  The house red is wonderful and the pizza has been great every time.
author: molly m.

description: Love this place! Everything I have ordered here so far has always been excellent. Great wine and food selection, cozy atmosphere and friendly staff.
author: M J.

description: Tried out this resturant Monday night.  Read great reviews, I would of given it a 5 star except for the rude service when we presented a coupon after the bill was given to us.  we spoke to the manager/owner and she was very considerate and we will surely return
author: jason c.

description:
Okay. I have to admit that this is a tough review to write. I have been to this restaurant twice and if I was going to review the place strictly on the food I would award 4 stars for what it is: thin pizzas, savory pastas, a few nice meat and fish dishes and solid appetizers/side dishes. 

I would also give the service staff 3.5 stars. I would normally give them 4 stars but on both occasions there were problems with the order and/or seating and it took a bit for the staff to realize and reconcile. In the case of the first time, they resolved the issue after a short wait. In the case of the latter visit, the issue was unresolvable. 

Therein lies the major issue with the establishment: the atmosphere is what creates the challenge. This place is configured in such a way that the space can seriously detract from the quality of the meal. Yes, it is a small space. But the real challenge comes from the fact that the space has a small foyer that seats one or two 2-person tables and the main seating area is a small and narrow rectangle. The result is that you can't really get two sets of tables down the sides. This was particularly obvious last night, when the five of us were forced to sit facing the wall (3 down the middle and two on the sides) as the table needed to be flush against the wall to accommodate the other table of 16 guests on the other side of the aisle. What made this galling is that both groups had reservations so the restaurant knew about this "overbooked" problem in advance. Our host was very apologetic but blamed it on OpenTable for allowing the reservations. 

As good as the food may be, it is hard to spend a lot of money on dinner and feel good about it while facing a wall.

RATING: 3.5 STARS
author: Peter O.

description: The place was good, but I think after reading all of the reviews I was expecting more.  The food was delicious and the service outstanding
author: Kairn G.

description:
We went to dinner here on Wed night. Much to our surprise, it was half of wine Wednesday. Not a bad way to be greeted. :) We like the wine and accidentally had a bottle (or 2) during our meal. The wine was great and clearly very inexpensive. It was game one of the World Series (we were those people who kept checking the score on our phones) so the place was quiet, but from the time we walked in, until the time we walked out, the service was impeccable. Our server was great, the bus boy was phenomenal. Our water glasses were always full and as soon as the bread was gone, we were offered more. BTW, the bread is great!! 

I can't lie. We had a very hard time trying to decide what we wanted to order. The entire menu sounds delicious. We started with the Arugula and goat cheese salad. Awesome! I really enjoyed it as is was not drenched in dressing. Very light and very fresh. Their salads (along with everything else I saw) are a good sized portion. This place does not skimp on food by any means. I had to smoked prosciutto pizza. Fabulous!! The crust is so thin and crispy/flaky. Just the right amount of cheese. Very tasty! My friend had the paste carbonara. I had a taste....damn good as well. For dessert (which I highly recommend) we shared the homemade ice cream sandwiches. Holy shitballs!!! To die for! I would suggest going just for those alone. :) 

Overall, a great experience!!! The food, service, ambiance.....all spectacular and I look forward to returning in the near future. Most likely on a Wednesday night. LOL!
author: Scott G.

description:
May not be fancy, may just be a neighborhood gem, but this little place is definitely worthy of 5 stars.  Service is friendly, charming and super efficient.   Food is delicious and very generous in serving size.  Prices are every-day affordable.  

Sardine appetizer, gnocchi, spaghetti with dungeness crab, pizza margherita are all super favorites !  

Extra kudos for salads that are dressed perfectly - - - tossed so the dressing coats all components, but not drowning in dressing so as to overwhelm the flavors.
author: bb b.

description: Thin, crispy-crust pizza outside of Italy!! Not to mention the delicious baked rigatoni... I lived in Italy for 4-1/2 years, and just got back from a month-long trip there. I'm happy to find the same caliber of Italian cuisine right in the neighborhood. Sunday evening was my second time at Vega, and both meals were fabulous, as was the attentive-and-welcoming-without-hovering service from two Italian guys (owners?) and support crew. I hope the owners like us too, because they're going to have to cope with us and our little dog Augustus on a regular basis.
author: Heidi C.

description: Delicious Pizza.  Most of their dishes are delicious.  Heavy but delicious.  The only thing I didn't like was their  bread was super stale.  Other than that I had a good time.  The customer service was excellent.  You really need to try their desserts.
author: Belinda H.

description:
Overall I would not go back here.

Too many screaming kids and it wasn't even 'kids' night, this really was a distraction especially as the acoustics were awful.  Service was extremely slow which would have been okay had the noise levels been more comfortable.

The salad and pizza were good; the fish and pasta just about okay.
author: Mary J.

description:
I really wanted to like Vega, because it's a neighborhood place, and is actually very close to me. I would rate it as 2.5 stars if I could, however, I feel that 2 stars would be more truthful than 3. The high points of the meal for me were 1) the house wine, which was exactly as described on the menu, and only $5 per glass - a great value; I wish more restaurants offered house wines at reasonable prices like this; and 2) affogato desert, which was divine. 
The rest of the meal was very forgettable. The pizza we had was "Cappriciosa" - pizza dough was so-so, and they used canned artichokes. We also had "gnocchi alla boscaiola" (gnocchi itself was good, but sitting in a bed of cream sauce and sprinkled with oil on top, way too greasy altogether) and wild boar pappardelle. The latter was a huge disappointment; I would have expected slow cooked/braised meat that's fork tender, in a slow cooked sauce; instead we got what tasted exactly like the frozen turkey bolognese from Trader Joes - the meat was ground, and tough, also tasteless, and it came in tomato sauce that tasted like a canned sauce. 
The ambiance of this place is lacking, and service was rushed and a bit spotty. Maybe I'll go back if I just crave a glass of wine followed by desert...
author: Sushi M.

description: great neighborhood place with delicious food that is consistent and reliable. i eat there frequently and wish they had some specials to add variety to my visits.
author: Lori K.

description: Yum.  Homemade gnocchi that melt in your mouth. Not heavy, not chewy.  Soft, decadent pillows.  Warmed artichoke hearts wrapped in prosciutto.  Fresh sardines... I could go on and on.   The food at this place could easily be served at some fancy 5 star restaurant for $35 a dish.  Instead, it's served at a cute little neighborhood spot with heart and soul for half the price.
author: Sarah B.

description: We love this place.  There are a lot of different restaurants nearby, but we always end up going here.  The food is great, the staff is nice, prices are reasonable.  Favorite thing is the grilled calamari with cannelini.  Pizzas are good, especially the Capriccioso.  House made gnocchi is some of the best.  And the fish special is always good.  Plus, Wednesday is 1/2 price on bottles of wine!
author: Bill E.

description: The best Italian food anywhere. The pizza margarita is to die for.
author: Sharon C.

description: The first time I went to vega, I had some gnoicchi alla  something, and it would've been good if they hadn't dumped a pound of pepper flakes on it! Even my dad agreed that it was too spicy, and he loves spicy food! The gnocchi itself was good, and the bread they brought was really good, but I can't give a higher score because of the pepper flakes and service. The waiters took a long time to get us our check and I saw them just sitting around. Over all, I think a two or three is good for this place.
author: Lily B.

description: One of the best! The gnocchi here is incredible - not to be missed. The wine specials on Wednesdays...excellent value 50% off. Family that owns Vega now owns LIberty Cafe across the street - hopefully Liberty will come back to its old glory. I life in Bernal Heights, and I feel so lucky to have such a great local restaurant...would travel across the city for this one!
author: Seth B.

description: Had pretty good food, but I came on a Tuesday which apparently is family night or something so there were children all over the place. The seating is pretty squished. But was still a nice experience.
author: J P.

description: I was very disappointed in this place. The menu looked awesome on line, but failed to deliver. They were under staffed (or we just had a terrible server). The food took an extremely long time, and was overall not very good. The worst was the gnocci-it was cooked to complete mush. My boyfriend and I barely touched our main courses and opted not to take it home. I am a student and that was sadly 80$ down the drain and I didn't even leave with a full stomach.
author: Gwyndolen K.

description: I saw this place on check please and wanted to try it out. It's a really cozy place in bernal that has really fresh Italian food. The truffle pizza was amazing!! Also I really don't like Italian wine that much but decided to go for it and asked for a recomendation. The wine was great and paired well with the perfectly prepared pasta dish I ordered.  Fast service and good food! The neighborhood is really great too, want to try all the spots on the block.
author: mark h.

description: Unbelievably horrible experience here - the dangerous sort of experience. Went here with two friends and three children. First trouble occurs when friend eats a mouthful of salad, crunches on something foreign and spits GLASS out into her hand. Second bad moment occurred after they served us a minestrone soup that has  an almond based pesto sauce in it  that was not mentioned on the menu. Why not? every other ingredient was mentioned. My child has a severe tree nut allergy and I had shared the soup with him. What made everything worse was the staff's reaction. Regarding the glass,the waitress' response was a somewhat defensive: " A drinking glass must have broken in the kitchen. This never happens.'' Regarding the nuts: the waitress and the manager looked at me as though I were crazy for telling them that for the safety of their customers they should include such information on the menu. I was then asked:  "So what happens, does he get a rash?''  You would think folks in the food industry would be a little bit more knowledgable about food allergies and how serious they can be. We spent the rest of the night monitoring our child for an anaphylactic response. As the Vega staff brought us the check they let us know that they had taken the salad off the bill. So very kind of them.
author: Lemon T.

description: this place used to be valentina ristorante.   it is exactly the same as it was when i went last month and it was still called valentina ristorante.  i don't know if anything else will change?  anyway, it is delicious.  the gnocchi is what it is famous for--the fluffiest you'll ever have.  my mainstay, the cappellini pomodoro, was perfection.  all my dining companions loved their dishes as well--gnocchi with sausage and the pasta with dungeness crab.  really nice wine selection and they have specials too--when we went all the bottles of wine were half off!  very child friendly.  lots of screaming kids, so ours wasn't the only one.  good for a romantic date but probably only if you come very late and the kids are sleeping.  takes reservations and i would recommend making them.  the owners are super nice too!
author: kate s.

description: truly a gem of a place and absolutely worth every bite and penny! as east coasters yet another place that gives the old school soho vibe. the food, ambience and wine is simply warming with a rustic edge. we had the rigatoni al forno which is too die for along with the asparagus! bread is complimentary and delicious! forgot to mention but the service is spot on, nobody rushes you and the staff is super friendly go down to the wine bar  (which is their sister restaurant and grab a drink if you're waiting), absolutely loved the evening! salute!
author: sue c.

description: Had dinner with some friends -- wow! wow! wow! The wood fire thin-crust pizza were so yummy.  I loved the one with fresh argula on top. The wines were wonderful selection and all reasonable. You MUST save room for dessert -- the chocolate orange cake is so good...as was the panna cotta -- not to be missed so save room!
author: peggy l.

description: I took my wife here for her birthday and it was perfect.  We started off with the Carciofini Ripieni and it was amazing.  We both had the Gnocchi Alla Boscaiola and could not have been happier with our choice.  We finished with the Panino al Cioccolato.  It was one of the best desserts I'd ever had.  The evening was exceptional.  Vega, the owner, waited on us and provided great conversation.  So friendly and easy to talk to.  A great cozy spot for outstanding Italian food.
author: Eric K.

description: Nice cozy atmosphere,  staff polite and accommodating. Food overall okay to good. My husband got the baked rigatoni with meat balls but they were out of the right kind of noodles so used penne which tasted fine.  Our friend got the capellini al granchio which the menu said it was to have dungeness crabmeat, tomatoes and capers.  I tried a little and it was good but didn't realize til later that I didn't taste any crab or capers...hmmm.   If I went again I would try a different dish (maybe one of the pizzas or gnocchi) due to the smallish portion size of the ravioli dish I got--literally 6 (for $16 I'm hoping for a few more!).   Maybe they were running low on ingredients b/c it was a busy night--we waited about 40 minutes to get seated.  We did get a great deal on a 1/2 priced bottle for "wine Wednesday"--very yummy ! It was a "3 or 3.5" for the food but b/c of the ambiance and service they earned a "4" for an overall nice night out.
author: Mimi W.

description: I'm torn. 3 stars or 4 stars?  I'm giving 4, because the restaurant didn't do anything wrong. The only reason I am debating is because we only ordered a few things.  Food and wine were very good, service was fine.  Met a friend, and the environment was conducive to having a nice chat and the service was not intrusive. We shared two pastas,  gnochi boccaiola and rigatoni with sausage.  the gnochi was excellent - nicely seasoned , and the rigatoni was a good rendition of that kind of "baked pasta with cheese on top" casserole.  I had a glass of Italian Syrah by Antinori. All good. As a few other reviewers said: I'd go back and try the pizza
author: Rob F.

description: we got this $25.00 gift coupon and ventured over to Bernal Hts. Vega was a big hit. The food was tasty, the volume in the restaurant was tolerable. Our waiter was awesome, but a bit over-worked. She was obviously trying hard to please everybody. The sea bass and gnocchi were pretty good. We were happy. Check it out. It's a real atmospheric section of Cortland Dr.
author: baruch g.

description: This place was awesome and a surprise! Had a lovely dining experience, service was good, ambiance warm and an at home feeling; nice wines and food was amazing. The gnocchi is to die for!  Most places ruin gnocchi by making it to heavy or ruining with an inadequate sauce - not Vega it's PERFECT! What a great neighborhood find - I can't wait to go back, maybe tonight.
author: Susan G.

description: Had a wonderful dinner here. The waitress was very nice and well versed on the wines. She helped us select a very good Italian red wine. The polenta with cheese was excellent, as was the home-made ice cream sandwich. Will be back again.
author: Pam G.

description: The homemade pasta and gnocchi were really good.  Although the broccoli robe was overcooked and boring, we still love the pasta .  We will be back to try more dishes.
author: C S.

description: Just had dinner there last Saturday with my wife and another couple and had a great meal.  The grilled calamari was fantastic and the artichokes were great as well.  I had the chicken saltimboca and my wife had the gnocchi in two preparations.  We both really enjoyed our food and the reasonably priced wine the co-owner recommended.  I never ate at Valentina's, so I can't make a direct comparison, but it's hard to imagine it was better than Vega is now.
author: Brad A.

description: Love it!  Tuesday night is half off pizzas when you bring your kids.  It's very family friendly and fun!  Bring the kids, and bring it on!  I love the food and the environment.  Thank you, Vega!
author: Janet J.

description: great spot, very cozy and romantic! tasty food and good service
author: Sarah Y.
